content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												Honestly I wasn't hoping for much when playing this game, just wanted a fun zombie shooter that I could play with a friend. It didn't need a bunch of bells and whistles, I just wanted it to be fun. Unfortunately the few times I've played it has been either boring, frustrating, and/or tedious. The ammo seems to be a bit random, the first playthrough was fine. The ammo was a little scarce, but as long as you played slightly conservatively it wasn't a problem. The last 2 times playing the ammo was basically nil. I spent most of the game just running around the zombies because I didn't want to waste ammo (or using a bat)....and yet after 40 minutes of playing, my friend and I had only picked up 3 ammo total. Funnily enough one of the places we had to go to was a gun and ammo shop that we were supposed to "stock up" on to prepare for the level...and yet there was only one thing of ammo and every single weapon at the place had no ammo. That kept happening, I picked up 7 or 8 guns in a row  throughout the playthroughs which were ALL out of ammo and nothing to be picked up. It just became frustrating.Another big complaint I have is that the maps are generally quite big, yet several areas have absolutely nothing in them (besides zombies). There are lots of deadends and places that just serve no purpose at all other than to make the map look bigger. You have to search for a single item or location, yet the maps are so big that it just feels incredibly tedious making progress/finding items in the game. You go to one location, are told to find said item, have to go to the other side of the map to grab the item, then go back to the inital location to activate it or trigger something, and so the cycle continues. Then in my most recent playthrough my friend and I were stuck for about an hour. We couldn't understand how we were possibly missing something, had gone through every single room and location at least three or four times. Finally we googled a walkthrough, and turns out that a door that was supposed to be triggered opened just didn't work. It glitched out for some reason, we rewent through the steps (that we previously had done correctly) and nothing would fix it, so we were just about to quit out of the game...when it crashed. That basically sums up how well my experience has been when it comes to Contagion.

content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												This game feels like a Half-Life mod. It's absolutely not worth $20. There are only 6 or so maps, and half of them are long big maps, and the other half can't really be considered "maps" at all because they're just a single house or two and you hold out against wave after wave of zombies. Yawn.Overall, the game just feels unpolished, like not a lot of effort was put into it. After about 3 hours, I felt like I had seen everything there was to see. It's also pretty misleading. Their intro video mentions how ammo and guns are found in logical places - no they're not. Wrecked humvees will have gun cases and crates strewn all around with no ammo/weapons (you can't open anything except doors) but go into a women's bathroom and you'll find sniper ammo in the sink. There's lots of random nonsense like that which completely takes away the immersion and survival aspects the game claims in it's marketing.So overall, a pretty disappointing game. It's not terrible, and if you're playing it PvP with a group of friends, you can get some laughs out of it for a few hours. But it just feels like a mediocre Half-Life mod. Your lights have an annoying "camera grunge" effect that we couldn't figure out how to turn off. The animations don't seem to have any blending, so they look awful. Your arms that hold the guns look strange and contorted, very unnatural. It's just a mediocre, unpolished game. I don't recommend it.

number of helpful: 57 of 95 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												+ Impressive visuals; exterior environments look incredible; water/rain effects really stand out and react wonderfully with lighting+ Cell phone is a great feature that was integrated very well with gameplay+ Only a handful of game-modes, but many of them are novel and fun with tons of replay value+ Controlling zombies after death was very well implemented; devs put more thought into this than most games of the genre, and there is an unexpected amount of functionality+ Maps are surprisingly large and easy to lose yourself in+ Barricading mechanics are simple and intuitive+ Game engine is very, very well-optimized; the game runs smoothly+ Maps change every game; Objectives differ, paths close and open, item/weapon pickups are randomized+ Voice communications operate on differing channels; survivors use one channel, and player-controlled zombies use another (this adds so much to the game, as player controlled zombies can effectively coordinate against their former companions, basically turning death into the start of a new game with new objectives, on the same map, against other players - VERY fun)+ None of those endlessly recycled "special" zombies that are so prevalent in other games of the genre (with the exception of a "riot-gear" zombie, but they are just scarce enough to be a minor challenge without the pitfalls of being irritating)- Melee weapons were not as well done as I've seen in other products of this genre, and they are rarely used; the game places an overwhelming emphasis on firearmsLockeProposal's Big Day OutCommunity GroupCurator PageSerious Steam Reviews subReddit

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												The base gameplay disappointed me. Progressing through the game's levels seems to alternate between insta-killing every zombie running at you with headshots from a mile away (this works with almost any weapon, so there's really no point to carrying other weapons aside from using the separate ammo) and being swarmed and quickly killed in tight quarters by either a huge swarm that spawned in thanks to an ending sequence or one of the armored zombies.There's extremely little in the ways of avoiding/stealthing/distracting and the melee combat has no weight at all (zombies will continue to run at you at full speed while you attack them, so you'll just be constantly running backwards while slowly chipping away at their health), so I never felt like the game gave me any choice or variety.The netcode was a problem in the majority of servers I played (leading to unreliable combat), the player zombie mechanic is frustrating rather than an interesting challenge, and there's almost no mechanics that reward or even acknowledge co-operative play. Medical supplies or other interesting items that could be used to help other players are extremely rare, and covering/protecting teammates is mostly a non-problem in the linear campaign levels, where you will most likely be funneling everyone, including the zombies, through single doorways and alleyways to be shot/slapped with your gun.I wanted to like this game from the start, when I bought it on early access, and I love the art design, but it all feels wasted in one of the blandest zombie/co-operative games I've ever played. I don't think anything short of a complete redesign of the game mechanics could get me back into this game again.EDIT 11/28/15:I have a lot of changes to make to this review, such as looking at some of the newer maps and some of the content I missed. I'll start on the revisions when the 'Flatline' game-mode has been released.

number of helpful: 24 of 36 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
[Skip to the verdict if you want a short summary]What is contagion?Contagion is a first person zombie horror game created by Monochrome LLC and running on the source engine in which you play one of eight characters who have to survive in a zombie ridden world. At the moment there is four main gamemodes which are Hunted, Escape, and Extraction. In hunted you experience tense Pvp battles with players online whilst at the same time fighting off zombies and scavenging for supplies and ammo. In escape you follow objectives sent to you via an ingame phone to escape (as the name suggests) the area you are currently in. This is my personal favourite gamemode for an atmospheric horror experience! And finnally: in extraction you have to help rescue Ai by taking them from one side of the map to the other via a Gps on your in-game phone.The loveThe main thing I love about this game is the atmosphere; every second and every turn is an intense moment. Most of my time playing this game I spend with my heart beating rapidly as I brace myself for a zombie encounter. This atmosphere is mainly brought on by the difficulty which comes from the random infection chance when hit from a zombie meaning any damage could be fatal and also the scarcety of ammo. The maps in these game are truly amazing. The game feautures a system which randomizes the map everytime so you will be experiencing a new adventure with each playthrough. Aswell as this the maps feauture tight spaces and lots of corners which adds a cloustrophobic ephect of if you see a zombie: your more or less going to have a heart attack. Whilst talking about the maps I feel the need to mention the amazing soundtrack and also sound effects used within the game which make up for the mediocre voice acting. These two things combined mean that you will feel as though you are actually there walking through those tight halways listening for the rumble of a nearby zombie. The graphics on this are what I would expect for a game of this type; not astounding but they dont need 4k graphics to give me a true horror experience. Moving on, within the options menu we have a wide variety of options to customize our experience and to provide the needs of those with a microwave computer, which is what I would expect for a non-port. A small mention I am going to give because I think it could be a good feauture but hasnt been used to its full advantage yet is the workshop support. This alows people to make custom maps and zombies which could bring the horror to a whole new level. So far not much good content has surfaced but I have high hopes for the future. Now onto the multiplayer side of things: you can join a random hosted server via a search from the main menu after selecting your desired map and gamemode. This means you can either play co-op or the mode named hunted in which players converse in heart renching pvp battles and fight to the death. I feel this gamemode is a really nice addition to the game but I feel it is lacking some larger maps. The main thing that seperates this game from other zombie games though; is the infection feature. This means that when you get hit by a zombie there is a chance of you becoming infected and being a zombie. Signs of this is the noise slowly distorting and the colours on your screen slowly fading. This adds a really cool aspect of the game which gives you the choice of whether to tell your friends that you are becoming infected or sneakily bite them while they are not looking! I feel this adds a new dimension to the co-op  gameplay. Also if you die during a game you will respawn as a zombie which I think is good because it rids the game of a boring spectator mode. Time to talk about my favourite feature in the game: the co-op. There is nothing more fun then hoping intom a game of escape with my friends and experiencing the horror together. It also adds a lightheartened twist to the game. Finnally I am going to mention that a free Dlc has just been released containing a new gamemode, some new maps, charecters and weapons. I think it is good that the developers are still supporting their game and I hope to see more things like this in the future.The hateSomething I dont like in this game is theHud though this is mainly prefrence and is not game breaking. I just feel that the Hud feels like some 90's shooter and isn't very polished. Mainly the wapon slots in the top right corner. But as I said tis is just preference. My main problem with the game is the terrible Ai. It is truly unpredictable: sometimes the human ai will walk into walls and sometimes they will do as meant. Sometimes the zombies will chase after you and sometimes they will stare into space. I just feel this ruins the immersion and otherwise perfect atmosphere. Another problem is that the deddicated servers are not very reliable and thematchmaking is pretty appalling. This can be avoiced by sticking to hamatchi co-op like I do. But I feel like I am missing a big chunk of the game witrhout hunted which would be hard to play on hamatchi unless I had alot more friends. Something that is a minor problem is the lack of story. I say this is minor because the game doesnt really need a story because all you really need to know is that you are getting away from the zombies but I just felt like a small chunk of the game was missing for me. Another thing that isnt really bad but some people could find bad is that the game is very slow paced and you are not just running at hordes of zombies with a chainsaw. Im saying this could be bad because some people may expect this from a zombie game. My final complaint is a few small bugs such as when you scroll down the texts on your phone by left clicking: you cant scroll back up. These bugs are minor and can probably be easily fixed so Im not to salty about them.The verdictContagion is an atmospheric zombie horror that will have your heart beating rapidly but dont go in expecting a fast paced run and gun. A definite buy if you have a co-op partner.Love:+Atmosphere+Co-op multiplayer+Difficulty+All around good graphics+Options+Worshop support+Infection+Free contentHate-Bad dedicated servers-Hud-Bad Ai-Some bugs-No story7/10Thank you for reading, if you enjoyed don't forget to:Join my curator group!Visit my website![axlshack.wordpress.com]Watch me on youtube!

Posted: September 23, 2014
												Contagion is going on the right way for a FPS zombie survival game. From the same founder of ZPS, it's worth to try out this COOP game, even better with friends! One free DLC is coming soon and will bring good improvements to the game. Currently with 5 game-modes (Objective; PVP; Coop Extraction and two familiars from ZPS) and 8 different type of characters to choose; including more than 12 types of weapons.The maps are pretty well made and I known for sure it takes time to create a master piece like that, each rounds the objective and other paths can change on the area, doors can be locked and you must find another way etc. You must walk around to find the items to unlock the paths and complete the mission to escape and win.For now, I recommend to play this game with friends, you can check out some populated PVP/Objective servers; but for a first try, you should do 'objective' to train your aim and see all the commands for your first experience.TL;DRGood co-op game (8 players and pvp servers with 16); free DLC coming in January 2015 with good improvements on the game-play; new animations, weapons and characters and future Linux support! Recommend to play with friends and truly worth it to buy in this price (75% off).Have fun!

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												Pros:-Different take on a zombie killer is a breath of fresh air.-Players' ability to be common zombies is definitely another breath of fresh air.-Workshop support, and by extension, modability.-To make up for the difficulty of hosting games over the Internet (details below), it does have rather decent single-player gameplay.Cons:-Seems to need a powerful computer and graphics subsystem to play, i.e. something more powerful than even L4D2 needs.-No lobby to gather friends or other players in.-Woefully lacking network support that other Source games have makes it really difficult to host games over the Internet.  Needs either Hamachi, NeoRouter, Evolve, Tunngle, or router/firewall portforwarding/port unblocking wizardry to work at all, let alone well.-No Linux dedicated server.  Most dedicated server establishments are built on Linux owing to the expense of getting a Windows license, not to mention the fact that the best place for a Windows system is behind a heavily-fortified firewall.-In light of the above, the price on a game this modern might scare off others.  Were this in GoldSrc, I'd give it a pass.  Not this time.A mixed bag, but the best time to pick up this game is when it has a very steep discount applied to it, i.e. during seasonal and "special event" sales.  Until these deficiencies are addressed, my thumb goes down.

content:
Posted: January 6
												Contagion is a zombie game that offers you several game modes and maps to explore and survive the rise of the infecteds in game modes such as Escape and Extraction. The gameplay is relatively slower paced in modes like Escape as compared to other zombie games like No More Room in Hell and Left 4 Dead 2. In Hunted mode, you're placed with not just the threat of zombies, but also your fellow survivors trying to hunt you down. Not to mention, you can also play as one of the zombies when you died as a survivor, hence providing you the ability to command other zombies to hunt down your former survivor friends. Furthermore, you can also play as a cockroach instead of the typical and boring spectator camera.Pros:*Devs did a great effort in producing a game with an apocalypstic atmosphere with the great use of lighting and eerie background music.*Offers many game modes and several maps to survive.*Every time you play Escape and Extraction, objectives are shifted which provides you with unique pathways to explore the world of the living dead.*A large variety of weapons to choose from.*Instead of waiting for the game to finish after you died as a survivor, you can play as a zombie.*You can play as a cockroach instead of becoming a boring spectator camera.*Has steam workshop to customise your game.Cons:*Some guns seems to be unfinished. e.g. when unloading the Remington 870, the racking sound of the pump cannot be heard, unlike the Mossberg 590.*The Scar-L's suppressor doesn't actually reduce the noise effect of the gun on the zombies, but rather attract more zombies.*Some melee weapons have their sound misplaced in the animation, especially performing a stealth kill on the zombies. e.g. baseball bat.*Lack of updates and new contents for the game which the devs had promised.*Some maps such as Barlowe Square can be a maze in game modes such as Escape, which can be hideous sometimes when you try to complete an objective.*Some maps such as Roanoke PD has a bug where you can sometimes hear the helicopter's sound on the roof even though it has not spawned yet. Likewise, when you enter back into the police station building after the trip to the roof, the roof environment sound can still be heard.*When you spawn into an Escape game, you start at the beginning of the map, regardless of how many objectives other players had completed. This can be annoying when you try to catch up to other survivors.*Has a bug where zombies can sometimes get stuck in some places of the map. Such as windows or furniture when they're spawned.All in all, I still personally enjoy this game regardless of the unfinished contents, bugs and lack of new updates. Its still fun to play with your friends and a game worth a try if you're into zombie, horror and survival games.Rate: 6.5/10

number of helpful: 16 of 23 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												Many of my friends and I are into zombie co-op games, so naturally Contagion is one of the titles which we would try on. Before I begin on descirbing the game itself, the first thing I would like to mention is that the number of people on my friend list who has the game, which is 21, is higher than the number of total players currently in game at the time I am writing this review. So, unless you can find yourself a good team (this is an 8 player co-op zombie killing game), please be prepared to face zombie hordes yourself. There will be one or two players in certain servers, but they will most likely leave half way or rambo about and turn into a zombie before you can realize what is going on. You will be real luckly if you can meet a quality player or two in any server. Truth to be told, this game has seen better days in terms of player count. There are some merits to the game itself. First of all, as a realistic zombie apocalypse co-op game, the game is rather well-made, graphically speaking. The game itself uses the source engine, so expect something along the line of Left 4 Dead. The game mechanism is rather simple and bare, so as to make sure that you don't get too much on-screen help. There will only be a health and stamina bar; you can carry 4 items of all types, some essential in solving in-game quests; you will only be able to see the silhouettes of items when you go near them. Realism, so yes, that's all you get. The enemies are simpler as well, as there will only be two types of zombies, one the normal ones where you can kill with a bullet in the head, if you are able to place it there accurately that is. The other is a "riot police" zombie, which soaks a lot more lead before you can kill it. Bullets are as scarce as they are sacred in the game, so think before you shoot if you can help it. Oh and you won't have a crosshair so you will need to depend on iron sights unless you are using a shotgun. Having said all that, the game itself is really not bad, though there are major problems elsewhere. Firstly, this game has a poor finishing. In the game I was playing before writing this review (and left because I was alone and I got overran halfway), I was pushed down a ladder by a zombie. That wasn't the problem, the problem is that, after being pushed down and suffering some dammage, my gun model disappeared! It won't be much of a problem if this is another game, but do not forget that Contagion does not offer any corsshair. So, what happened is that, I can't use my iron sight because the model has disappeared! The problem was solved by switching to another item (a card-key) and back, but shouldn't this bug be fixed at some point? Also, I have had issues with map skins. I was playign an official map and all reflective surfaces (and glasses) turned cyan after I did some alt-tabbing. You will know that vision is real important in this game if you are familiar with it, and it is not a simple matter of being irritating when glasses turn into solid cyan. If you can't see what's behind, hordes can close in a lot easier. Trust me, it's fatal. And did I mention that zombies tend to get stuck a lot? Yeah, though I am not complaining. Also, let's not forget that Contagion has an extremely weak game community. There's just a handful of players here and there, and there really isn't much of a back-up community to support the game. Not much custom maps, same old boring official maps with the same quests again and again, it gets repetitive. There are some die-hard fans, though most of the players I met are those who came back after a year or so to clear everything again, and then leaving it to gather dust in the vitural game shelf. I am one of them.So, my final words will be that, do not get the game unless you know what is going on and what you will be expecting. You'll most likely enjoy a lone adventure for an hour, maybe with a random teammate or two who has 300 ping, and then grow bored with it pretty soon. Nothing too fancy about this game that is worth the money.

number of helpful: 27 of 44 people (61%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												It's not that the game is bad but rather it's simply bland.   As I type this it's on sale for $5  and it has been cheaper  even here on Steam when I bought it for $3.74   it's also been similary priced on the humble store for $4.    So know that the game has and no doubt will be again cheaper if you're on a tight budget.   The standard asking price of $20 is absurd though and is clearly priced high soley to make it appealing during large Steam sales.The game has two major modes.  One being a Co-op where you have to advance through the map doing objectives while trying to not become zombie lunch.  This mode is the best the game has to offer but it's not great.   The generic gameplay  gets old quite fast so hopefully whomeever you are playing with (and god help you if you actually bother to play alone) better be a rather amusing friends.   Otherwise once you play a map once there is little reason to ever play it again even though objectives are  somewhat randomized each time.     The game is terribly easy except if one of you actually manages to die.   If that occurs they get a few zombie lives and  this is where diffaculty steps up, player zombies are a actual threat and likely your team will be wiped out due to them in many cases.   This also causes trolls to get themselves killed to disrupt the game as early as possible.  These types of players are not overly common but do exist.Then there is the PVP mode which is just god awful.  It mostly consists of players trying to camp  and a few being brave enough to hunt the others down.  The phone can be used as a method of  playing hot and cold  which will give away other players positions.  Why do you have the numbers of everyone you are trying to hunt? Who knows, but while this may sound like a neat feature it also serves as a warning to the camper that the threat is coming.    Again with the majority of players prefering to camp this causes the brave hunters to often die because killing 4 campers one after enough tends to get you shot a few times during the fire fights.  It's a terrible game design.   Likewise however if you die you become a zombie and can try to get some  brain flavored revenge.... or cheat...  You see the game has another issue when friends play together it doesn't take long before they realize the zombie can help their buddy human.   So lets say the human is camping in a room with 1 entrance  the zombie can sit just outside and call NPC zombies to gather keep calling them keeps the zombies with him making  a zombie protective shield  for thier friend and attacking any player that comes and you'll know their coming because they will no doubt be using the noisy phone.     Beyond game-play  the sound is generic, and the graphics are heavily aged because they decided to go with the Source engine.  A great engine sure even more so in its prime but we see other indie games looking better or having unique art styles to comensate this just once again decides to be bland.    There are just too many games today to choose from that do this genre better, some of them even free like No More Room in Hell.   So there's no reason to buy this game at the end of the day.   You're reading this review during a sale right?  You can do better for your $5.

Posted: May 18, 2014
												This game is so very difficult and cruel. Best to host your own game and disable player zombies, or you will fail, fail and fail again. With the right players it's very fun.The game is highly objective based co-op in the vein of Payday, and it's also a bit like l4d, but a bit more in the survival sim genre. Ammo will run out if you try to kill everything. Death is permanent; there's no revivals or respawns to see here. It's not always clear where to go; you have to figure it out, and the map will change each time. One map in this game is as long as a whole l4d campaign. If you fail, you start over from the very beginning. Did I mention it's hard?

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												//Updated with responce to Awesome-oFirst of all, when I bought this game it was in beta stage. However, there was no indication of game being not finished.I was actually hoping to see the complete release version when I was buying the game without "Early Access" warning (which they removed because, apparently, beta equals release).I find this to be misleading adverstment and a foul play to trick players into buying this game and this is a one huge reason to consider twice before buying any other possible titles published by Monochrome.Animations are hideous, sounds are acceptable and gameplay is basicly boring and repetative.Oficial hosted servers feature the difficultues above normal as rarely as dragons borns to this world and, believe me, normal difficulty is not challenging at all. Yet the game allows you to host your very own little server with ability of minimal management of it.Game still develops, but yet again - I was hoping to play a bloody complete game. Therefore, I do not recommend to buy this game or other future possible titles of this publisher just because of the way they treated the steam community with this one. Also, what is going on with "indie" being placed on every single title published by amateurs?Indie is not an indicator of how developers were poor while developing the game. Indie is not about consuming the fast food while developing your little toy. Indie is not about begging the community for money at kickstarters or whatever.Indie stands for independence. The ability to manifest your very own and your very original view on something in your game. Contagion was contaminated with community at alpha. This is not an indie game - developer depends on playerbase.This is just bold daylight robbery.Awesome-o, your comment is very inaccurate and is full of false and misleading information.The game is no longer in "Early Access"I know, right? That is the main point of this review.the animations are really good because they utilise the source engine effectivelyNope, they are not. You can take a look at cinematic SFM release trailer as a sample of animations and I really doubt that a living being is able to perform such oddities. In game reloading, moving and head bobbing (which failes to turn off when turned off in options for some reason) are awful. With same success I may "utilise the whole collection of my crayons effectively" to draw a doodle on my wall.This game will always be "in development"And I really hope that it will be in development for, at least, two more years.Full release and exit from the Early Access status usually means that all or most of planned features were implented in game. A good developers adds the minimal ammount of bugs to this checklist as well.This is clearly not a case here. I own this game for few months already and I keep receiving 250MB-400MB updates from time to time.This game is crawling with game breaking bugs.The day I bought this game I had no sounds at all available in game, which was reported by many other users as well.In same version survivors were able to climb on the weapon's shop on Barlove Square, where no zombie could reach them.In same version survivor could be trapped inside the objective without ability to leave it in rescue game mode.In same version zombies had 8 audio files, which makes approximetly 20% of current zombie sounds.In same version boltcutters/keys failed to drop from the deceased survivor, which made it impossible to complete the escape game mode.In same version it was possible to delay the infection by allowing the zombie to bite you again, while pressing the movement button.Does not sounds like a good experience, eh?Some of them were fixed in recent 200MB patches, some are still available for experiencing and dozens of new ones are added each patch.Bloody hell, they are still adding the maps (which are very few for now) and game mods after the "full release"!Contagion is and always will be an indie game because the devs published the game themselves.Your definition of indie game is poor and incomplete.Assassin's creed black flag is indie game then because it was developed by Ubisoft Montreal and published by Ubisoft.

number of helpful: 24 of 39 people (62%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
												Bought it at early and still haven't regret it. The game is a nice zombie survival shooter, even though it has it's share of bugs and glitches it still offers a great experience. Story=======The story is a little fuzzy when you start, you pick from a group of survivors and shoved in the middle of a zombie outbreak.  In most game modes you are given instructions through your phone by a unknown individual helping you escape the area but of course you need to complete certain tasks let it be taking out a fire to holding a location for a bit. There is of course a few pieces in some of the maps that hint what is going on, as more content comes out the more players will understand or piece together a story about the zombie outbreak.The developers have also started a comic series free on their site to tell more about the story. It's rather interesting and shows a bit more about the outbreak. It's worth the read. Gameplay=======The gameplay breaks down to modes  and humans vs zombies. Mode 1 = EscapeThis mode is pretty much the story driven type, as you start the map you will be thrown at the start location , from there you follow the text messages on your phone and complete tasks that will lead to your freedom. However there are a few twists, for one if you play online anyone that is killed will become a zombie creating a hard situation to deal with as they are a bit faster and annoying :P , second the objective path will change each round for example one route will have you go through a gun store to the gas station where the next round will get you to enter a threatre and push towards the bank. This randomness adds a bit more fun and reply value to enjoy.Mode 2 = HuntedYour shoved in the middle of a free for all. All humans are against each other nothing else matters, ammo is everywhere as well as guns so go out and murder your fellow humans because hey the world is over anyways. Remember though ...everyone you kill will become a zombie that might end up helping you become the last survivor or could be your undoing and lead to your demize.Mode 3 = Extraction You are randomly thrown to one of many spawn locations on the map, you may be with fellow survivors if you play online or by yourself. Your mission is straight forward head to a random location which you will find npc survivors needing help, you need to hold the location for a set amount of time then extract them...just remember the further you complete the objectives the more zombies start spawning at the next location one and anyone that dies will become a zombie and are forced to try and stop you from saving those npcs. Mode 4 = PanicI can't say much for this one as I haven't been able to find a room for it. It looks rather interesting. Humans vs Zombies =Human players have the ability to use melee weapons , guns , med kits and special items such as bolt cutters and keys to progress their story. Humans also have the ability to instant kill zombies with their melee weapon if they sneak behind a zombie which is nicely shown with a kill animation. Humans also have the ability to turn into zombies if they take enough damage or meet the random chance of luck.....as time passes your screen will become grey and your sound will become very quiet until the final moment of your scream in which you turn into those you have been killing this whole time. Zombie players are nothing special, they aren't L4D special zombies where they take damage or dry hump the survivors to death. When you think about they are very weak, one shot to the head and your dead. However player zombies do have some abilities, one is roar which allows you to call near by zombie npcs to your aid, they will follow you and also you can give them a waypoint to charge. Zombies can also jump, crawl , break down doors and grab players biting them and giving them a chance to join your rank by infection. Overall=====The game is something different , at times it does feel like the mod No room in hell which is a good thing. The concept and direction of where the game is aiming is awesome however there are many issues such as zombies getting stuck to players abusing broken mechanics such as throwing keys or cards under desks or objects that will force players to a halt as they can't progress forward . The story is also non-existence until the comics came out but then again what zombie game really has the full picture as the concept of a zombie outbreak is always based on the idea of pure chaos and pieces of information which does work out. Should you buy it============For coop = Yes it's rather fun and enjoyable For singleplayer = Not really worth it as it becomes very dry after the second run.For PVP = if you can get into the 20 player servers it can get pretty crazy and fun. But if your just going for pvp and not big on coop then might want to wait until a sale day. Final Remark:My fellow survivor decided to be a jerk by taking all the ammo for everytime of weapon even the ones he didn't have....so I decided to show him the reason why not to be greedy by dragging a mob of zombies into one room which killed me and then grabbed another mob and fellowed the survivor....the end was rather enjoyable as he finally understood that a bathroom wasn't the safest place to hide during a zombie outbreak.

number of helpful: 20 of 32 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												-Review for release version-First off, I have no idea why this is getting so many negative reviews.  This game is hands down one of my favorite video games *ever*, and not without reason.  I'll split this review into three sections:The Co-op Game ModesCo-op is IMO, one of the weaker aspects of the game, but even then manages to be pretty good, if co-op is your thing.  Extraction is my favorite of the two team modes, where you must find survivors hiding in their homes, defend them from zombies, and get them to the edge of the quarantine zone.  The sheer number of zombies pressing in on whatever stronghold you happen to be in is enough to cause panic at the worst of times.  Add the zombies ability to climb into the mix, and often you'll watch a friend as a hungry mouth stretches through a window to bite him.The NPC survivors are admittedly not the brightest, but it's nothing game breaking.PVP- The Hunt I know that Contagion is primarily marketed as a co-op game.  Do yourself a favor, and play the pvp.  It's the best.  Playing with friends makes it better than the best, weather you team up and destroy the opposition, or just save a bullet for them.  The gamemode is last man standing, with players scavenging for weapons and ammo while hunting each other and avoiding the undead.This mode is a beautiful mix of stealth and combat, chasing and hiding.  Each weapon has it's own niche, and even the weaker ones are often so cool that you can't help but use them.  You are forced to make choices on the fly as you hunt your prey, but do your best not to be trapped by the roving hordes.  Any gunshot alerts the dead to your location, and players can easily deduce it too by watching the movement patterns of the horde.Headshots are always an instant kill, with the exception of the sig, which is an instant kill 90% of the time.  Choosing between spraying with your assault rifle or taking a careful shot with a crossbow to avoid making noise is the lifeblood of this game. General gameplay I struggled not to mention most of this stuff throughout the rest of this review, as it factors into everything else.  Too make it short and to the point:Melee- Simply amazing.  Swings take chunks out of zombies and snap their bodies in the direction of your blow.  Make sure to aim for the head.  Against players, one hit is usually enough to down them, but it's difficult to get in close.Gunplay- Each gun has a perfect feel and balance based on it's type.  Admittedly, in the beginning I thought the hit detection was off, but then I realised the the recoil has more of an effect than I realised.  Taking your time for that perfect shot is super-satisfying.  Again, zombies lose chunks of flesh, skull, and brains as you shoot them.  You can even blast their legs off.Explosives-  Deserves a seperate section, despite having only two tools, the grenade and the IED.  Both are VERY powerful, in a good way.  If you aren't careful, you'll end up killing yourself.  Zombies caught in the blast will often lose their legs but survive, so watch for crawlers.Gore-  As mentioned multiple times before now, the gore is exactly what a zombie game should have.  Skulls break, arms are chopped off, legs get blown into nothing.  As of the latest update you can even decapitate zombies.Rating- 8/10, only critisims are that the game needs more maps, and slightly better co-op.  You will not regret buying this game.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												Contagion is a first-person, cooperative multiplayer that takes various approaches and scenarios of a zombie apocalypse into a video game. Contagion is a sequel (?) or a spiritual successor (?) to Zombie Panic: Source, which is a free multiplayer mod.  Does the game stands apart from other zombie games? Is it worth playing? What about the replay value? Let's find out. Contagion has a problem on standing out from other zombie games. There is no uniqueness or distinct flavor for this game. Escape Mode is one of the most common gameplay feature where you (and your friends or other players) have to do objectives while trying to get to the extraction point and not being killed on the way there. Escape Mode does have a "moderate" replay value, but most of the time is wasted on backpedaling to an old area to get something or do an objective. This leads to quick boredom and it kills replay value. This mechanic seems familiar to Left 4 Dead's AI Director system in terms on what items are located (along other things), but to go back to a cleared area to do an objective is a bit, odd. In the other hand, Escape Mode can be enjoyable if you have a group of friends to play with (and if your friends really enjoy it). Escape Mode seemed to have died out very quickly and that gameplay feature is the most popular one. Try to play PVP mode? Good luck on that. The main problem for Contagion is that the player population is very low and the daily numbers are abysmal based on Steam Charts. Contagion does have sale promotions on the Steam Store to get other gamers to buy the game (as it was shown in Summer, Halloween, Autumn, and Winter Sales), and the results varied. Overall, Contagion is typical, bland, and certainly identical to other zombie games. Contagion was in development for a good amount of years and doing a Kickstarter to help "fully" develop the game is in question that the reader or gamer would have to judge for themselves. A summary...1. Is the game worth $20 or regional equivalent? Definitely not. 2. Are there updates and DLCs for the game? As far as I am concerned, there was a DLC recently released as a update (and it is free). However, the time span between updates are terrible. 3. Replay value? It varies from "moderate" to downright dreadful.4. Sale price of $5 or less (including its regional equivalence)? Your choice. For me, it is not. I would not recommend it unless you are an avid gamer who likes zombie games. It's a buyer's beware, and take serious accounts from pros and cons for the game from different reviewers.

number of helpful: 27 of 46 people (59%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												I have thoroughly enjoyed this game so much that I wanted to write a review. Let me start off by saying there are PLENTY of zombie titles on Steam for around the $20 pricetag, except none of them deliver as much as Contagion does. This game is so much fun to play, even if you decide to play escape mode alone, it's still a blast to play. This is my go to zombie game every time. The graphics are great, I have no complaints there. They really do a great job in the graphics department. It's just so pretty and smooth. The guns each have there own feel to them, you don't feel like you are using the same gun like in most games. The game modes are some of the best, you can play escape mode which is more objective and obviously you do the objectives to get to the end to escape. The best part is its all randomized so you never play the same objectives and can throw you for a loop just when you think you know what to do. There is Hunted mode which is PvP based and is so much fun, there aren't any Panic servers I don't know why but I haven't gotten to play that game mode. Extraction is very challenging, especially if anyone died and becomes a zombie, you really have a tough time and adds to the suspense. The very fact you can be a zombie is huge in this game, they do it right. If you die too many times as a zombie though you will stop respawning and you become a spectator which can really bum you out, Only negative thing about the game is that. I love playing all the game modes however, and there are plenty of people to play with. They really emphasize the headshots in this game, and if you dont you will run out of ammo SO fast and you will die. I have nothing bad to say about this game, and the developers are still working on this amazing game and are about to release a free DLC to us buyers with 2 new maps 4 new guns and more. You will not regret buying this game, it is a blast to play.

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												so, up front this game tries to do what L4D does, only realistically. depending on the difficulty, you can have A: plenty of supplies/minimal zombiesor B: you get two bullets per player and only headshots can kill the massive endless hoarde of zombies. the inventory system does help to promote teamwork as you can only carry 4 items at a time. this includes healthkits, keys, flashlight, and weapons. sharing is caring in this game because you will run out of ammo. the accuracy of most weapons is a bit..touchy, but overall a headshot is a guarenteed kill. just be careful because every hit from a zombie has a chance of infection (server preference) and once a player zombie spawns, the difficulty cap starts to kick in.because of the accuracy issues of the weapons + the sometimes laggy servers, player zombies have the run of the field and most other players will give up just to restart the round.maps are usually a form of escape mode or "hostage rescue" where the players work to get from point A to point B with certain map variations (randomly generated objectives or closed off paths which force going a different way.) as much as one would thing this would help with the repetitive nature of the game....it doesn't. you'll still be doing the same thing over and over, but in a different path. the game is probably the most terrifying when played solo, but it's also the most difficult if you don't know what you're doing or where to go. speaking of navigation, all you get is a phone giving you a general location to move to and a waypoint marker that has a hot or cold proximity counter. the instructions aren't always clear so get ready to be lost and confused for your first playthrough. objectives and instructions are given through a sort of text message system by one of the player characters (or just texting yourself solo) while realistic, it can be distracting to try and read your phone while being attacked.there is a multiplayer versus mode as well, which is a deathmatch scenario with zombies thrown in for fun, but those servers are hardly ever populated.overall it's an ambitious title that tries too hard to be realistic. you'll enjoy it for about a week unless you're a true co op zombie fan.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2015
												I don't recommend the game, not because it's "bad", but because it's mediocre. There's nothing really special about this game to recommend it to anyone. I got it on sale, and it's given me about 20 hours of moderate fun, so I'd say I'm satisfied. Don't pay any more than $5 for this.Pros:- It's fun to shoot zombies- The Sig Sauer is really fun- The flashlight looks great- Boarding up a house and then shooting zombies through doors is really cool- Big levelsCons:- Zombies are only really affected by headshots. Contagion prides itself on being more realistic, but a .45 ACP to the chest will slow anything down - as it is, anything other than a headshot is wasted ammunition.- Guns sound bland, except for the Sig Sauer. I really wish game developers would take field trips to gun ranges to hear what guns actually sound like, rather than just relying on movies.- Too much bullet spread. If guns were as inaccurate as they are in this game, nobody would use them. I pointed a rifle at a wall about 20 meters away, didn't move the mouse, and fired five times, waiting enough time in between each shot for the rifle to settle down again. I checked the wall and there were five different bulletholes. At 20 meters, you should be able to put a round in the same place all day long.- It isn't cognitively demanding at all. If you try to take it slow and be smart, you'll be disappointed, as every encounter ends up being a non-stop headshot fest.Overall, I think they could've done better. It feels like it's in Early Access, or something that might have once appeared on XBox Live Arcade. Underwhelming stuff.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												The game is...okay, by zombie standards. Nothing super impressive. See a zombie? Kill it. Oh! See another? Kill that one, too. Its the usual run-of-the-mill zombie killing fest we have seen on the uprise the past few years. Graphics are a little dated, being Source and all, although Source is indeed a friendly engine, they should have waited for Source Engine 2 to come out. Animations are very stiff, even for a zombie game. Zombie motions seem generic. Although it could be a placeholer for more intricate animations later on, so it is tolerable. Its small details that are easy to overlook. Glitches with holding certain weapons/items are apparent (Wielding a fire extinguisher like a shotgun, for example, or the third person melee swing animations never matching first person animations, which causes hit registration problems in online play, only. Single player is unaffected to my knowledge)The sound quality is grainy, unfortunately. The Moans/groans of the zombies can sometimes (about 40 percent of the time) overlap, causing a sound that is akin to flies buzzing in your ear. Most of the time, though, it is drowned out with gunshots and player dialogue. The Player Dialogue, though, is limited at this stage, although there is much room for improvement. Certain situations like finding weapons could in the future have callouts (Like "Hey, shotgun here if anyone needs it!" Or "Pistol ammo, here!" Or something similar, since most of it can be overlooked by mistake by players that are not as aware) Now, one feature that I would love to see would be a voice feature to attract zombies. Picture, if you will, a scenerio where one player has very low health, most of the team can escape, but this one guy, one good hit and he is gone. He could use the last of his life to go on voice chat and use his actual voice (through the computer microphone) to attract the horde towards him, thus allowing the rest of the team to get to safety (Make an achievement for this, perhaps, too?)DLC Announcements for this game were announced mid to late 2014, and were pushed back, I am certain there were reasons beyond what has been stated. Maybe so, maybe not, is that our concern? No. Things happen. It is a part of life.There are some issues with voice chat, although, from the developer response, it is from the limitations of the Engine itself, not to any fault of theirs. Solution? Use TeamSpeak or another outside client, seeing as this game was more meant to be played with friends, rather than total strangers.All things considered, the game DOES have massive potential that has yet to be tapped into! Tatsur0 and group, I apologize about any misunderstandings before, and I wish you the best of luck in the future of Contagion! I will change and add to this review as the game develops. I cannot wait to see what you have in store for us!

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												Contagion, the game I love the most.This is my review on a little game called Contagion.  It's had alot of work put into it and I find it to be my faviorite game. It may not be the game I give a reword on for being greatly put together, but it sure has become adictive. TO A PERSPECTIVE(NOT IMPORTANT)Contagion is one of those games that you'll meet intresting people on. Mostly people from diffrent contrys who don't know what your saying like Gemens and "Vikings" but people all the less. Contagion was released in the time of zombie games, and was one of the most inhabited by diffrent races looking for a good goul game to play.  I started playing when my brother bought me the game when on sale. I found myself trapped in a dark place the first time I played it. Surrounded by people saying things like (UNCIARR) and (TOLLA CARBIAC TUE?) I was realy confused. Then one day I found myself a translator, someone speaking both english, spanish, and german! He guided me through the small frazes that they used and most important tought me how to survive the harsh world full of sludge monsters that ooze blood when you shoot them. I was and still am young at the "video gaming experience" so at every sight of one of the monsters I felt myself fill with cold shivers. But then when I learned the game everything came to a stop, than rewinded and made me what I think is a "pro player" and am now playing this game more than any other. Anyway on to my review.GAMEPLAYContagion fits into a catigory of a "Team Work Game" meaning you usualy in most of Contagions gamemodes need to work together. It has a survival of the team and not a survival of the fitest feel at most times, and is enjoyable with friends. They have fixed most glitches from the first time I played and it feels to run nicely. It has a fair amount of gamemodes with their own original touch to them. New maps would be great, as their are not that many courently in the game.PROBLEMS/GLITCHESThis game seems to have grown from the first time I played it in that it does'nt seem to have many glitches. Yes, ocasionaly you will find a zombie stuck in the stairs or a zombie to be walking on water like it was Jesus, but overal I havent seen many at all in the last few hours I've played. COMBATEThe combate in this game is dull, it seems to lack what its potentual leads on to seem in that its worse than it seems. Trying to melee a zombie easily is imposible, but it does make up for this with its smart takedowns ability. The weapons are great and fairly acurate to what it would seem like when firing in other first person shooters. At times the zombies melee is a bit to fast for the player and thier speed is a bit to out of hand, but besides that it seems "ok".ABILITY/LIMITSThe graphics are quite decent for a game like this, and then running first person view animation is fantastic. REPLAYABILITYIts diffrent gamemodes alow it to be played many times, and since its all different depending on what kind of team you get or what kind of weapons you find, it gives it lots of replayability. No glitches rune it making it very playable, and in the next year I could find myself dropping time like a bomb on this one game.ONLINEThe servers can be played on very easily and even with bad internet you can still play it quite well. The other players on it seem to be very kind and acceptable, especialy considering you don't know what they are saying most of the time with thier strange little accents.REVIEW I gave this game 88.9/100 on this game because of its replayability and online formate.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												I’ve played most of the zombie games recently available. Contagion is easily my favorite. The only other game that comes close is the Nazi Zombies series. As an adult gamer, I don’t have much time. I play at least once a week with my friends online. We use a mumble server. Voice chat is absolutely necessary as teamwork is insanely important in this game. You will not be able to run off by yourself and survive. I have a dedicated private server. Which is easy to set up and lets us play without trolls or kids. We prefer the coop “escape” mode.The best thing about this game is how brutally hard it can be. Head shots are the only practical way to kill zombies. Ammo is so scarce every single shot counts. It is common to be down to your last two or three shots with zombies on your tail. You can run away, but eventually you will have to stand and fight. Finishing a level is very satisfying and a real accomplishment. The levels are enormous, but well laid out. Some game modes do not have a map, so getting lost is possible.  Once you learn them you will not get lost, as most are fairly linear. The downside is that there are not many maps. The game needs about twice as many maps as it has now. A few people have released maps via the workshop. While most of these are very good, there are not many and few people play them.

												Good concept but ruined by severe issues (headshots are sometimes broken, you can't get rid of weapon auto-switch, shotgun shells have no cinetic effect, you can shoot 6 shells of remington  in a riot cop at point blank, this has no effect at all... no push back, no impact on gear, just some dmg that you have to stack to kill him).This is really poorly executed and is just one example among huge amount of flaws.Add lags and desynchs, rubberbanding in some servers and your day is complete.Games suffers of major flaws that come to ruin your gaming experience.Badly optimized, bugged like an alpha stage.Overall : not bad and original concept but too much issues. The co-op aspect of game is really good and will require constant teamplay if you want to succeed.That also means that playing with random teams can rapidly become a real bad game, no fun, restart another random s.h.i.t.game, rinse, repeat.. Or better option : swap to fun game.Anyway, despite the really good idea and atmosphere the game produces, the almost constant issues that I meet ruin the fun.Very good idea + bad execution = I can't recommend.4/10

content:
Posted: March 29, 2016
												At first this game seem to be a worthy investment. It throw out of the window the arcade, repetitive and boring gameplay that standardized L4D; focusing on speed runs from point "A" to "B" slicing and gunning through hordes of zombies and "specials", just to arrive to a "safe house" full of weapons and ammo, and repeat the same thing two or three more times in order to finish a map. Contagion focus it self on cooperative gameplay, management of resources (weapons and ammo), map exploration in order to find those resources and find a one of the three randomly generated scape routes. The gameplay is a "relistic" survival zombie game, were only head shots kills zombies, attacks from them cause infection and ammo is littely found.The problem is, the game has bugs since it early access like zombie pathfinding, charcters skeletons, animations..., there is no lobby and kick system, to play multiplayer with your friends only you must have your own server, there is only a few maps to play and to make it worst there is no modding community fix that. There characters are lifeless and boring, they only swear bad words and that's it. L4D is FAR MUCH BETTER in that aspect and also in the maps.Contagion has good mechanics, but L4D has better characters, better maps and better modding support. A great zombie game would be the mix of these two games OR a remastered first person edition of Resident Evil Outbreak.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												So I had this game gifted to me as soon as it came on steam early access on sale for $5 around December 2013 played it for an hour before giving up and uninstalling. Recently I got a week ban on CSGO and was looking for something to kill time until my ban ended. I played this game again for about 7 hours of May 2015 and there were plenty that has changed.Improvements From Early Access:Loading Times:When this game first came out, the load times were absolutely horrendous. Taking 2-3 minutes to even load a map and 30-45 seconds to load the opening menu. Now using the same computer at launch, it takes 10-15 to load the menu and a minute at the most to load the server.Improved AI:The ai survivors in the extraction mode at launch were basically potatoes. They would follow on command but were unarmed and didn't react to zombies. Now survivors are armed with basics weapons, usually a pistol but I have seen them armed with a shotgun and now react to the zombies.Cons From Early Access:Community: Originally this game and all it's servers were packed from its kick starter hype, finding around a 100 people on 15 servers just on the first tab while I was browsing. Now in May 2015, I can find around 10-20 total in all the occupied servers. What I've seen through steam forums is that monochrome has lost most of its original team, and that promised DLC and kick starter backer bonuses were never delivered. Currently at the moment this community is so small I practically play with tr same guys every night and I practically know everyone's first name and basic information.Regular Review:Just playing as if I had no knowledge of before.So loading this game for the first time again in a year I decided to run a game of Hunted, a game mode of up to 16 people surviving in an open arena until there is one. Unfortunately there was only one occupied server with around 10 people playing on the same map (Aurora States). So I spawn in, the map is a dark zombie overrun surburban neighborhood, and I start with a pistol a baseball bat, and some ammo. I hear the moans of zombies and gunshots in the distance, and quickly run to a nearby house and hide in the garage. I think some of the zombies on the street heard me as I hear the front door starting to break, suddenly machine gun fire breaks out and I hear someone enter the house. Suddenly I hear a player enter the house, because it has irregular footsteps and I hear their flashlight flick back and forth. Paralyzed I aim my gun at the door waiting, as the man is going door to door looking for supplies. Then I hear a crash of the window glass breaking and a hail of gun fire and the screams of a man dying. Probably unaware that anyone else was in the house, he opens the garage door where I immediately pump his body with lead. There I stood, looking at the loot of the two men, with an ar15, a revolver, grenade, and around 80 rounds of ammo. This was the most heart pounding zombie experience I've experienced in a zombie game, including DAyZ Standalone and No More Room In HellPros:Sound: The guns in this game sound fast, and powerful but not too much where it overdoes it. The rhythmic beat of the small caliber mp5, to the thundering sound of the remington sniper, sound responsive and fluid.Controls: Controls feel semi-realistic blending the arcade like movement of hl2 and the movement of Insurgency is the best way I can describe it. However you can see your ammo count, see a stamina bar, and see your health which makes it more of an arcade kind of feel. Infected:Zombies react to noise and sight very well in this game. Run across a street into a home spraying an ar15, and you'll get a horde surrounding you within minutes. Also a very cool element is that everytime a zombie hits you, you have a chance of getting infected, where your screen and sound will blur and turn muffled until you turn. However I wish there was a way to revert it or slow it down like the pills in No More In HellCons:Characters: There is no story in contagion per say, but all of your selectable characters have a "backstory" which consists of a paragraph description in the selection menu. How am I supposed to even care about these characters when there's no reason to. Also they have no personalities whatsoever and all have the same 18 or so lines in the quick command bar and don't even seem to know each other. Overall worst cast of chaarcters in a video game, don't even know their names to criticize them individually.Weapon Balance: The weapons in contagion especially the melee weapons are extremely unbalanced. How can a zombie take a full swing from a fireaxe, and live but die from 1 hit on a Kabar Knife. Melee weapons are a joke, and if you find one you should immediately drop it. Okay now you might say, balancing melee weapons is difficult. Well look at No More Room In Hell, a similar game also based on the source engine. In that game, there are heavy swings, which take time to load up and can decapitate zombies, and fast swings which usually don't do anything, both are dependent on the weapon you're using and how much stamina you have left.Melee weapons aside, the main weapon you'll be using are the guns. However these are horribly unbalanced especially against zombies. I haven't played enough to see of it makes a difference against players in hunted, but here every gun can one tap a zombie with one well placed headshot. Whether it's a high powered sniper, or your 9mm starting handgun, it all feels the same. Also there doesn't seem to be a bullet dropoff damage, as I can get kills with a colt from about 30 meters away with a headshot. Compared to no more room in hell, .22 or 9mm ammo takes 2 headshots to connect, meaning you'll need to use .45 or higher to get a 1 hit headshot.Music: Bland, forgettable, don't even remember how it sounded most of the time. No contrast either? Always stays at the same volume except in a loading screen when it starts to fade out.Lack of Maps: Maps are very limited, and the community is fairly dead, so no new maps are coming out to play on via modding workshopLack Of Map Change or Vote Kick: Servers seem to be stuck playing the same map over and over with no way to change the map,meaning once you beat a map, you just play it again. So that means everyone is stuck playing one extraction server on Aurora Estates, and escape on Roanake PD. Also we can't vote kick any trolls, and with a severe lack of community, I've never seen a server admin who could helpLevel Progression:Playing a coop map such as Escape on Roanake PD is especially unfriendly for new spawns. Instead of placing a checkpoint t to spawn new players, they spawn right at the beggining, leaving them up to 3-9 objectives behind everyone else which is something that should've been fixed a long time agoOverall:Pretty average zombie FPS with some cool ideas but poor execution, and the community has suffered from it in terms of number, and overall support for this game. Score 6/10Would reccomend buying if $5 or less and to buy in a bundle to play with friends Would recommend playing No More Room In Hell-Better Weapon Balance-Active Community-Active Modders With Maps (ex. played on the walking dead prison)

content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Review as of 8/11/2016TL;DR Only recommending if you have friends to play with, otherwise it's boring/dead (no pun intended)OverviewContagion is a Zombie survival game with an emphisis on gunplay and spooky areas. The game itself plays very well, and is actually pretty fun. It contains many different modes which I will further go into detail nowEscapePlayers must work together to complete all the objectives and escape. Objectives, items, and pathing are random, so each play through is different. Any survivors that lose their life along the way will return as infected and must eliminate the remaining survivors before they complete the objectives and escape. This is esentially the story mode, as there are some events that happen and much of it is scripted.HuntedThis is a PvP game mode where the last survivor standing is the champion. Supplies are scattered throughout the map randomly. On death, much like Escape, you turn into a zombie with the goal of killing all other players. ExtractionPlayers must work together to protect civilians and help them escape once the rescue vehicle arrives. Once you approach the location of the civs, zombies will start hording around the house. You must use the supplies at the location to defend yourselves from the zombies until the rescue vehicle arrives.Escape is my favorite gamemode because it has the most story!ProsCreepy atmosphereFun gunplay (for the weapons that are there)Not too easy (like L4D2)WorkshopConsDevs abandoned the gameWorkshop is mostly just phone backgroundsNot many servers with people in them (not dead, but there's just not many people playing)Few weapons

content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
												The game itself has some potential, its fun to play with friends and can be fullfilling to do alone. But the game lacks content. The game could be a good one and worth the money if it had more maps, more gamemodes, more weapons, more zombie variations and better music for background, weapons, environment and zombies.The game also lacks any form of character customization. If you are not going to put that freedom in a survival game then atleast build up a nice storyline around the present characters maybe even with their own pro's and con's.beside all this the game can be fun for a little while when played with friends but eventually (around 1- 3 hours) it's get really boring and you know any bush and tree in this game. My message to the creators:- make improvements to the sounds in this game- try to add 4-8 new zombie models (atleast), more is always better- Add new weapons and ways to modify them- more maps, play with heights like walkways and tunnels. make a scary shipyard with huge rusted boats. make a map that you are inside a giant mall with several floors with shop you can go into and small rooms in the back ect.- more game modes. if you make it fun to have several things to do you will automatically play a game much longer, its that simple. there are ALOT of modes you could think up that would fit this kind of game.overall score (5 stars max):2 out of 5 starsI hope they will keep working on it and will add in new stuff to make the game better and worth the cost of the game. Hopefully they will not screw their buyers and ask money for additional DLC.

												I was following this game when it was annouced for the first time back in the day.I was hyped about it and i couldnt wait more for it, when it came out on kickstarter i was amused, but sadly i couldnt afford for backing monochrome back then.When it was released on steam i had the moneys so i bought it and i noticed it changed a lot compared to the alpha videos on the official youtube channel.So heres my conclusion, these are my pros and cons about this game:+ Its a spiritual sucesor to ZPS, so you can feel it has a little bit of it, it even has a Panic gamemode which tries to be faithful to the original mod+ Hunted mode is the gamemode that i spent a lot of time playing it back then+ I like games that needs cooperation, and the matches i have been back then i encountered with people that was very communicative with the players and started helping each other.- Now theres no activity on the servers, looks like the game is already dead.- Flatline mode needs some fixes, like other stuff in the game.- I have experienced some bad optimizations on the framerate on other pc's/laptopsWell, if you liked ZPS you definetly need this game, but i suggest you to organize a match with some friends because its rarely to find a server full of people to play with.

												I really want to love this game but you can't even play all the levels after installing (missing textures). The modes are good and the game had a lot of potential but the bugs are too harsh and the game still feel like early access. All of that could have been forgiven and I would have given a positive review but for the killing blow... the game has been abandoned by the devs. Yeah there was an undate towards the end of last year but that 5 months after a previous update and it’s now very late March, so another 5 has gone by.Actually, the real killing blow is the dead servers. If you want to play it now, you better have some friends who want to play it too.I wanted to love this game, I gave it more chances than any other EA I have purchased but as it is now, I can’t recommend it at all, to anyone. There is nothing this game does that another game doesn’t do better, heck, there aren’t even and combinations of factors that this game has that other can’t do better. That didn’t need to be the case, it just needed to not be shelved by the devs.

												The game itself has some potential, its fun to play with friends and can be fullfilling to do alone. But the game lacks content. The game could be a good one and worth the money if it had more maps, more gamemodes, more weapons, more zombie variations and better music for background, weapons, environment and zombies.The game also lacks any form of character customization. If you are not going to put that freedom in a survival game then atleast build up a nice storyline around the present characters maybe even with their own pro's and con's.beside all this the game can be fun for a little while when played with friends but eventually (around 1- 3 hours) it's get really boring and you know any bush and tree in this game. My message to the creators:- make improvements to the sounds in this game- try to add 4-8 new zombie models (atleast), more is always better- Add new weapons and ways to modify them- more maps, play with heights like walkways and tunnels. make a scary shipyard with huge rusted boats. make a map that you are inside a giant mall with several floors with shop you can go into and small rooms in the back ect.- more game modes. if you make it fun to have several things to do you will automatically play a game much longer, its that simple. there are ALOT of modes you could think up that would fit this kind of game.overall score (5 stars max):2 out of 5 starsI hope they will keep working on it and will add in new stuff to make the game better and worth the cost of the game. Hopefully they will not screw their buyers and ask money for additional DLC.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2014



YouTube™ Video: Contagion: Impressions 

			Views: 640		

			Contagion: Impressions Today we talk about Contagion, a first person zombie multiplayer game. It may seem like a Left for Dead clone at first, but when you get into the game, you'll start to see it's...		

Above is my impression of the game.Contagion at first glance might seem like Left 4 Dead, but when you get into it, it's actually very different from the L4D series. Rather than a linear map, or run and gun game play, Contagion features an open map level design, and conserving resources such as ammo is key to your success. The game can get hectic with 8 player multiplayer and will involve some discovery by the player to progress through the game. It still has a few rough edges here and there, but overall it's a pretty enjoyable experience. Pros:- Open world environments- Co-op or PvP game modes- Interesting player to zombie game mechanics- procedurally generated objectives and item placement Cons:- Open world can leave players lost at times- A few bugs and quirks that still need ironing out- Zombie game play lack luster after a couple of tries

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Me and my flatmates used to play this game for hours almost every night. We regarded it as the best zombie co op game ever apart from the occasional crash and all was well. Go to play it again after the last few updates. OH MY GOD. What the hell have you done to this game? It now crashes constantly to the point where it's unplayable, the characters now swing their guns all the way from side to side when you look around, which really puts you off - not to mention. THE AIMING. It takes a full second just to point your gun, so basically by the time you're aiming at something other than the floor/ wall and pulling the trigger, the zombies are already gangbanging your face. If you switch weapon while shooting and then switch back to that weapon the game crashes. The zombie ai is now so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that half the time they either don't notice you whatsoever or run in the opposite direction. The revolver is now an utterly pointless piece of junk - it aims slower, shoots slower and reloads even slower. The textures are all bugged out (mostly on the high graphics settings) and basically, the game no longer runs smoothly or even really works. I feel sorry for all the people who paid full price for this, but at least we only paid $5 on sale. Even so, I feel ripped off, and thoroughly depressed. At least I got in over 100 hours while it was still a good game, but seriously devs, you suck. You ruined this game, absolutely ruined it. I miss it. I miss wasting hours doing headshots and pretending it's the apocalypse with my friends, and I want that back. :'(

content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
												I have found this game incredibly fun and fulfilling, even with the more limited content available. The slightly slower pacing compared to a run-n-gun zombie shoot-em-up is refreshing as you have to actually scavenge for your ammo and supplies and, especially on harder modes, conserve as much as you can. If you like cooperative play like I do, the escape and extraction modes are fun, especially if you find a good group of people. In escape, you have to navigate a level with some objectives and obstacles that rotate through a couple different scenarios, and in extraction you locate NPC survivors, hold out for a time against hordes, and then escort them to a drop off point. As with any online game, you will probably get in several games with people that aren't as cooperative or skilled, but when you have a good team it's very fun. If you favor competitive play, there's always hunted and panic modes. Hunted is your basic pvp, where players killed become zombies and when there's two left, all NPC zombies charge at the two remaining players. In Panic, one player begins the game infected but may not know it for a few minutes, and the only zombies in the level are the player zombies, while the first player zombie respawns as a SWAT zombie. Human players have to kill the zombies a certain number of times, or survive for like 20-30 minutes to win.All in all, I got the game on sale for $5, and I would say it's the best 5 I've spent in a long time. Yes, some graphics aren't as up-to-date and some animations can be wonky, but it's not distracting to me at all. I would recommend this game even at the 20 price if you think this sort of thing appeals to you.
