content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												This game is about survivors and zombies. Typical. First-person shooter, focused on surviving rather than l4d-styled zed slaughter, thought amount of zeds you need to kill is pretty high. What does this game offer: - mostly possible to kill zeds with only headshots or explosives (body shots will deal quite little damage, melee mostly effective on head too);- @40 minutes long maps (varies depending on knowing map, amount of players etc, good team can run escape in @20);- multiple game modes: Escape: follow 1 of 2 possible routes in zed-infested areas to escape; Extraction: find survivors and extract them; Hunted: pvp, where you kill other players (and then they spawn as PZ and try to kill others too); Panic: objectives (player zeds and survivors only, like escape) and classic (1 turning into armored zed and taking down others survivors, till noone left or zed life/time out). Shame, but almost noone plays it now - thought it's kinda quite funny mode; Flatline - currently in beta. This mode is somewhat between NMRiH survival maps and Killing floor: zombies come in waves and you need to fight them off. From NMRiH there are traps in map, from KF - shop between rounds (shop is take what you can, no money required and items are rather unlimited, but seems anything dropped in shop area being wiped out).- 4 difficulty levels, which influence amount of zeds, their attack power, friendly fire, amount of guns and ammo spawned on map (however, PZ lmb attack seems to deal constant damage for any difficulty - only bite [rmb from behind] might be affected in terms of damage, since infection chance does increase);- Equipment: few guns to shoot (3 rifles, 3 auto rifles, 2 explosives, 2 SMGs, 3 shotguns, 3 pistols for 2 types of ammo summary, bow and crossbow) - some even with flashlight attachment, and melee weapons to swing (ineffective unless fully charged head hit or special takedown from behind). Also, sometimes other equipment(gasmask and pocket flashlight you cannot put in pocket xd, wielder for making barricades at doors and windows, keys and keycards, fire extinguishers and boltcutters);- few mods from workshop (mostly - damned useless anime background for phone);- upon death/infection - turning into player zombie and hunting survivors down (or being killed by them and then being roach-spectator after few tries);- decent graphics;- only english as supported language;- zombies: casual, a bit faster, armored (no headshot and backstab instant kill) and player zombie. Sometimes, when ppl cannot use shotgun properly(or going for achievement), crawling zombies.- cards and achievements (atm no achievements for finishing new maps yet);- dedicated official servers for each map and mode, as well as some private servers;- after a while, it's a bit bothersome to play all over the same maps - but it's issue for all games;- not big number of players online - many note this issue, thought i rarely cannot find ppl to play with.Personal opinion - game is somewhat between L4D and No More Room in Hell: alot of guns and ammo for them, alot zombies you need to kill, but mostly only headshots can bring them down and melee isnt 1hit. What i find disappointing - ability to carry 3 assault rifles (98 bullets in) + 150 bullets for them + smg (30 bullets in) + 150 bullets for smg when u`re average Joe without much of pockets and backpack (NMRIH is free zed game and has nice solution for this 1 issue, but has oldest graphics, which is focused on mostly avoiding, not killing everything). Still, for teamwork and shooting zeds game is sufficient enough.However, do note, that you need to train ur skills to land headshots and playing with random people is sometimes.....annoying. If you have some friends you want to play this game with - then it's good, since having team w teamwork can save the day.special note: promised by devs, ALL dlcs and updates are free. So far i have this game - true. Recently they've added few maps and guns and going to add flatline mode.As for soundtrack - well, typical, but when they published it - on-date owners got it for free. Also, it's much cheaper than in other games.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
 The most underrated zombie game on steam. Contagion is an excellent zombie survial FPS which is fun and requires skill. I was very supprised by the amount of negative reviews for this game is it defientley worth around £10 for the hunted game mode alone. The other game modes are a bit hit and miss, however hunted is a unqiue multiplayer experience which should be played by anyone who is a fan of zombie survial games. In addition I would even go as far to say Contagion has provided me with more enjoyment than more popular games such as Left 4 Dead due to the rewarding gameplay and zombie being a much bigger threat. The graphics are also defientely worth mentioning, when playing on max settings it is amazing how impressive they are. The best looking game I have ever seen on the source engine by far. Don't get me wrong the game isn't perfect but it is definetly a 7 or 8 out of 10 (Especically for steam summer sale price of £3.75). A must have for fans of the zombie survial genre don't be put off by the negative reviews.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												PERSONAL RATING 7/10RECOMMEND FOR CERTAIN PLAYERS BUT NOT ALL, READ CAREFULLY! Contagion is the closest thing to being the game equivalent of traditional “George A. Romero” Zombie apocalypse…or max brooks zombie survival guide setting…or the walking dead…you get the picture. Slow, hard to kill…zombies. My review will touch on aspects I feel focus on the strengths and weaknesses of the game. There are plenty of both trust me.GRAPHICS AND ATMOSPHERE-the good-The visuals serve well on initial playthroughs. I honestly felt helpless and weary what could be around the next corner. The stark contrast in environmental lighting made good use of my flashlight. All of it  makes a trigger finger really twitchy. Weather changes with rain in some maps adds nice ambience too.-the bad- My only complaint that the exterior parts of some maps lack of variety, changes in lighting in procedural sort of way could remedy this. Much like the ever changing maps on each walkthrough can stir up silent dread awhile longer. After my first 10 hours or so even on solo play-throughs, the fear diminishes pretty quickly. PVP GAMEPLAY-the good-By far the strongest aspect of the game, players will be served PVP modes on ALL game types. Died as a survivor during escape or extraction mission? No worries, you’ll always have a guaranteed turn as the member of the undead. Cut loose and wreak havoc and fear on your friends and enemies.The game mode Hunted, is specifically catered to this. You can start a game with a group of survivors or a player controlled zombie. Gunning, mauling, and devouring each other till the last man standing wins. Of course, even if you’re killed it’s only the beginning.  Zombie gamplay is present in this mode as well.Even though I fall in the lets say…..%10 of the gamer population that does not enjoy pvp, I’ve actually had fun…given that the company wasn’t too obnoxious or a bunch of hate mongering trolls. Mind you this pleasant experience only occurred once in my 24 hours of total game play. But hey…if you enjoy trash talkin and♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥some one off over the mic or text.…this game definitely for you.-the bad-Now for the downsides…. If you’re not big on player versus player….you’ll hate this game. A gratifying experience is slim. The best way to try to enjoy this of this is to wrangle up a group of friends and some how make a private server.  Even that’s not STRAIGHT FORWARD OR FREE, AS IT SHOULD BE.CO-OP GAMEPLAY-the good-When surviving with friends (and at very rare times random players) that have a good sense of teamwork, CO-OP in contagion is tense, gory, and suspenseful  fun!  It requires a lot more thought and planning. Running in with guns blazing has its place but doing it all the time will doom yourself and your fellow survivors….which in most circumstances you DO NOT want…trust me. I admire this pacing cause it’s more of a thinking man’s game.When player synergy is possible reaching extraction points and claiming victory is quite gratifying in a “high five” sort of way.-The bad-9 times out of 10, your co-op mission will fail when joining public games.  Too many things can go wrong such as…. -Having to deal with being lost for long periods of time if joining mid game -Players that join mid-game as zombies can quickly spoil your chances of survival- Uncoordinated player survivors will slow progress to a crawl.-Confusing or vague clues for reaching the next objective The pvp aspect has too much of a presence in co-op gameplay, even if you create or join a server that disables the “infection” or “player zombie” feature. Once you’re dead…you’re out. There should be a optional “left 4 dead” feature that appeals to PVE players, such as being incapacitated into a “bleedout” status. Other players could be allowed a window of chance to aid comrades to their feet when health is depleted, at least for a limited amount of times before death. This would give a nice set of balanced options for PVE and PVP, more appealing across the board. At the moment this game unfairly leans to the latter. SOLO GAMEPLAY-the good-If you wish to truly experience terror and what it means to be prey, initial walkthroughs of extraction and ESPECIALLY escape mode on your own will certainly deliver…. Most likely only skilled players will be able to accomplish this, and victory is so very sweet when you’re able to run screaming toward your escape. I’ve only been able to pull it off twice in each game mode, but man it was thrilling. -The bad-Replay value on your own is basically zero… Even with procedural map generation, throwing yourself at the similar set of objectives the second time around is quite boring and a tedious chore. If a chain is only as strong as its weakest link, this is it… contagion highly depends on group game play to be anywhere near fun or even approachable the second….third….time around. Most likely there’d be never be a forth….If you really want this game to have staying power in your library, bring friends....and some how your own server.... >:(MULTIPLAYER OPTIONS-The good-Contagion is well suited for those looking for PVP for public lobbies. Pick a game mode, join a pub server and you’ll shooting or munching on other players in no time. Nuff said.-The bad-Okay so….-No “friend only” lobby option-No direct private server options-Servers for RENT are available on contagion….-Free private servers can only be created via 3rd party programsWith aspect like these, contagion still feels like a mod and not a developer’s fully released game. Lacking intuitive or direct access to people not accustomed to modding or pc gaming. -FINAL THOUGTS-If you’re looking for a great combination of zombie survival and PVP gameplay, definitely grab a copy.For players that have a strong affinity for co-op fun and thrills..... should think twice though….if you have a dependable group of friends and a means for creating your own servers, then it’s worth a buy.If not….stick to l4d2.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												Hello!So I got this game after watching a Let's play of RoosterTeeth like a year ago. I don't play this game with friends and I've only played Escape mode. I enjoy playing because it's challenging. You get a very limited amount of ammo even on normal difficulty so you need to make every headshot count. Zombies are a bit buggy sometimes, like staying crouched, suddenly moving at a rapid speed, just wrecking you so you get massive aimpunch and aren't able to recover or in very special occasions simply not dieing. I like the variation in armory like having a Scar 20 or a M4a4 (if I'm not mistaken), revolvers or colts and also crossbows and compound bows!Some positives and negatives from a solo player perspective:Pro's:- Challenging- Great maps- Great assortiment of guns- Good voice acting (altough sometimes repetitive)- Maps last between 30mins to 1 and a half hours- Objective rotations (sometimes objectives are different than the last time you played)Con's:- Buggy AI (zombies stay in a crouched position, don't die or simply demolish you)- Flashlight is too bright!- Objectives can sometimes be hard to spot or hard to get to- Accuracy of weaponryAll in all, great fun game, but if you expect top notch quality it might not be something for you. For €10,- I feel like it was a investment well spent.Thanks for reading my review! :)

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												Contagion is a horror survival FPS game running on the Source engine in which you play one of eight characters who have to survive in a zombie ridden world.So what does this game offer:- Multiple game modes, including:• Escape: Follow 1 of 2 possible routes in zombie-infested areas to escape.• Extraction: Find survivors and extract them.• Hunted: Online PvP mode, at the same time survival fighting off zombies and scavenging for supplies and ammo.• Panic: Objectives (player zombies and survivors only, like escape) and classic (1 turning into armored zombies and taking down others survivors, untill no one left or zombies life/time out).• Flatline - coming soon.- Multiple game-modes (including survival, survivor rescue, PvP and more)- Offline & Online co-op multiplayer- Encourages teamwork- AI to play SOLO- Atmosphere- Long maps- Challenging- Good graphics- Some paths in the level randomize with each playthrough- Developers still updating the game with more content- SDK- Workshop supportThis game is absolutely fantastic if you like horror zombie co-op, PvP, Difficult, SOLO Survival games.

												I think in my opinion this game isn't worth £15. This game still suffers from a few problems even though there are some fun bits in this game. I mostly played the Hunted mode because i enjoyed it the most. Hunted mode is where you go around and try and kill other survivors. If you die then you become a running zombie and try and hunt other survivors. But as soon as it comes down to the last few survivors, it becomes a game of hide and seek. which on a very large map can get very annoying.  I found some glitch spots where you can not get hit from zombies and stay hidden throughout the match. Even some hidden spots where the zombies night vision cant see you.I find that people who start with a SIG than the 1911 have the advantage becuase of the longer clip size and that finding ammo for the SIG is easier than the 1911...or maybe i just suck with the 1911There isn't many maps on this game. Even though the items and map changes a bit each round. I find that it isn't enough for a game that costs around £15. its an okay game but It just needs some fixes and more content. If you're a zombie lover then you'll proberly like this, but i'd give it a miss.

												When I first saw the project several months ago, I was very excited about its release.  After purchasing it for $5, I feel the price represented the game accurately, about what you'd expect to see in a gas station bargain bin.  A bunch of my friends that play l4d2 purcahsed it during the same steam sale, and we played it togeher once for less than an hour. We tried it again a few days later but couldn't stand more than 10 minutes of it.  When over 12 people all quit a new game that quickly, a consensus has definitely been reached.  We never made that mistake again.  The lack of details in the graphics and the overall gameplay makes it feel like a graduate student's final project.  The screenshots on the store page are very flattering.  It had some great ideas, but last generation graphics combined with confusing gameplay and lack of features and maps killed the game.

Posted: June 4, 2016
												This has to be the most disappointing game I've come across in a long time. I don't understand how it's gotten positive reviews up until now. The concept is great and the trailers make the game seem that way too. However, once you're in the game, it's just a painful road of confusing modes, horribly done controls, and extremely laggy servers (unless you pay to have one hosted, which I refuse because the game isn't that good anyway).The worst part about this is the lack of tutorial. You are tossed into the middle of extremely annoying zombies and are praying you remember the controls. Dying is a huge punishment since it spawns you as far away from anything as you can. Memorizing the maps is extremely difficult and if you're not spending hours upon hours of figuring that out, you're screwed.I do NOT reccommend this game. I had hope it was go ing to be good, but unless you can pay for a good server and have an highly updated computer, you're not going to have fun. They spent way too much time on the graphics of the game and very little on the actual game play. Horribly disappointing, avoid it at all cost.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Contagion is a zombie game with a good portion of realism. It uses the source engine and allow us players to create custom maps which I love it so much. GamemodesThere are many game modes out there but no tutorial so you are better off by watching the trailer first to get to know about the gamemodes before you get confused will all the new features. For example if you had enough with coop, you can play against other players in a level filled with the walking dead. Main featuresThe main core in this game is that the zombies are slow and they won't die so easily if you don't shoot his brain! This is very important because headshot differs from brainshot here so aim it carefully on the forehead where the brain is located! There is also the infection rate which can be very high depending on the difficulty. One of the unique feature is to turn into a zombie which will happen when you are infected or when you died. Your new goal now is to kill all the remaining survivors. Playerzombie are faster than normal zombies and can roar which makes the zombies follows you. You can command zombies to different places and the blending ability is a skill that will turn you into a regular ai zombie as camouflage until you stop the blend mode.Furthermore the ammo and weapon spawns are all randomly located, the same thing happens on some objectives in escape mode too which boost up the replayability greatly.The gore system in Contagion is pretty well made. If you have a sharp melee weapon you can cut off almost every bodypart from the zombie. If you cut off a leg they will turn into crawlers. Cutting both arms will disable their ability to attack. All the wounds will be displayed even on shooting. You can even do finishing melee moves if you manage to sneak up behind a zombie.OVER 1000 hours!? WHY THE THUMB DOWN?Because I tried everything to keep this community together and keep having faith on this company for two years, but, alas, without luck. I'm a hobby level designer and created the custom map HotZ and I'm also currently working on another project for Contagion called TWZ. The development of HotZ took me almost one year and until now it received regularly updates. Seeing how everything is going downhill due to the bad decisions of Monochrome is incredible frustating and sad for me since I invested a lot of time and effort for this game. I met a lot of nice and helpful people when it was still active but now I just reached the limit. Seeing the people who I know leaving one after another makes me very sad.UpdatesSadly even with all the gamemodes the content seems to be rather small since the whole core team left Contagion and that speaks a lot about the image of Monochrome. The company promises free DLCs but due to those critical hiccups it got delayed pretty long and there is still a lot to do. Even though Monochrome manage to release some new content, it does includes a few  gamebreaking bugs that has been there without any hotfix. Currently this company just stopped listening and responding to the community completely and with Tatsur0 ignoring any post regarding to his own game Contagion... is indeed the worst thing that can happen to a game.CommunityThe community is much smaller than before and it keeps decreasing due to the lack of updates and communication with the playerbase. There is also almost no support when it comes to custom content. That's why we don't see any map related content in the workshop which is quite a shame. The mentioned community interaction on the forum is just a promotion on Tatsur0's (CEO) twitch channel that has very little to do with interacting with the community itself where it really counts.ConclusionThere are many zombies games in steam that focused more in action than on the survival aspect and the consequences unlike Contagion. Contagion is a game that has a deep learning curve which makes the game so special...BUT sadly, the game feels kinda unfinished and filled with a lot of minor bugs. The lack of updates with sloppy results and the lost of the core developers certainly crippled the community to death.Well, think twice before you buy any games from this company but if you really wanna buy it then do it on sale and don't forget to try out my custom map :)

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Contagion is a wonderful game, but there are some disadvantages that are sort of disapointing :/. #1(Disadvantage:Zombies in Hunted Mode)When you really just want to play with your friends on random maps like with the "Hunted"mode, it can be fun but dayum it gets really, REALLY annoying. Zombies are actually the annoying ones because they're just everywhere, plus with just one gunshot you attract almost every zombie in the area. If there was a mod that would remove them(zombies)the game would be amazing so then the plaers wouldn't have to worry about zombies killing them.#1(Advantage:Zombies in Hunted Mode)When you get killed as a Survivor you turn into a zombie, the undead can climb walls, roar to basically call other zombies, and attack survivors from behind which if completed to do that the survivor that has been biten will then turn into a zombie in a short but long amount of time. Anyways if there were any players(survivors) camping somewhere, the zombies could attack them killing the survivors so then no one else would have to wait a long time to become a survivor(Every round everybody becomes a survivor just a fyi). But still ZOMBIES ARE JERKS!#2(Disadvantage:LAG)Frag not Lag is a fricken lie for this game so don't believe it -.-. You absolutly have to change the texture settings to medium. If you don't have to do that and can be kept on high with barely any lag, then you my unknown friend is lucky!#2(Advantage:LAG)I HAVE NO IDEA! Or probably you can get past crap easily with less things being able to hit you.#3(Disadvantage:Ring Ring PICK UP THE LOUD RINGTONE!) Okay, in the settings it gives you a choice to what type of ringtone you want. SADLY, all the ringtones are loud and can attract survivors that want to kill you, or zombies that want to eat your flesh. Vibrate is the best one cause it's quieter and doesn't have a long "tone".#3(Advantage:Ring Ring, Troll Ring)Ifyou want to troll keep using the loud ringtones, it'll attract players to come to you and zombies. If you know that you wont be able to take down a player cause they're camping somewhere, do a few gunshots and use the ringtone. The stupid thing about that is that the zombies will be coming for both of ya'll. The ringtones can also tell you where other players are by listening for the tone. But warning they cann also call you!IF THERE ARE ANY QUESTIONS OR OPINIONS JUST TELL ME :3, sorry if you didn't like the review or thought I didn't type enough but hey I just felt like reviewing something.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												It's a great concept, executed rather well. The problem comes from other players, who will frequently run ahead to either get themselves killed to grief on the survivors (as it's too easy playing as a zombie - more on that in a bit), or just to finish the map before anyone else, often leaving new players lost and confused.Additionally, it's far too easy to play as a zombie.  Zombies have four times the survivor's sprint, and can duck faster than bullets fly in order to avoid headshots.  Speaking of which, headshots are the only way to kill a zombie, which is fine, but not so much when a shotgun at point blank doesn't even make them stumble. Zombie players will often simply hide around corners, waiting for a player to walk by for a single swipe - hoping to get the RNG on their side for the infection chance.All in all, the game has the potential, but until zombie mechanics are changed to balance players versus zombie players, don't get this game unless it's on sale, of unless you have a group of friends and a closed server (or enough friends to fill a server by yourselves).

												This is a decent game with a lot of potential but in its current state, its pretty bad. Playing solo can be fun but thats about it. The multiplayer is stupid, its fun until people start getting turned to zombies. Then they stop you from going anywhere and the fun is sucked out. Its like a play on left 4 dead that didn't work. Infection is about the dumbest thing in the game. You get hit once and you have a chance to be infected, with no way to cure it. The Server system in the game is also pretty broken. You try to connect to a server and it could give you a variety of errors. Not to mention there is no way to tell what difficulty you are joining on unless you specified for a certain one. Maybe in the future this could be a good, enjoyable game with friends or alone. But as of now, Its not great.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												This game is really good, but there're no updates since 2015, it has some bugs and clunky mechanics I would love to recomend it, but the game is dead. The game is playable, but the controls and mechanics feels really unfinish, like if they never actually test it, zombie players have so much advantage since aiming is really hard, if a zombie player move in zig-zag and jump or crunch, it's almost imposible for a player to kill it and zombies have like x4 times the stamina of a player, for new players this might be frustrating. Melee weapons are really hard to learn to use, first, if you have a fire axe and a zombie has 1 arm, you would expect to at least have some range advantage over the zombie, but no, since zombies don't get pushed by melee weapons, you can hit the zombie and if you don't move quick enough he might hit you too, I'm not saying this is "imposible to master" but it feels like I'm triying to fist fight a zombie, ho! and melee weapons hits use your stamina, so you can't spam swings, but zombies can run and attack.The other thing that bothers me a lot is the GUI, it's so unfinished, if you're playing with a friend or two and any of them turns his/her light on, then it's really hard to aim, the light cone is really strong for other players but not for the one using it so if someone aim with light to the zombies you might have a really bad time aiming to the head. Light bouncing while playing is another big problem in long term, light reflects from ground like if it was a mirror, so is often really hard to "look around for things" since you can't actually see the things in the floor, This might or not afect you depending on your eyes, but for me, I can't play for more than and hour or two, because of the light effects.The game is overall really good, the "real aspect of the game" is really good made, like the limitted ammo, health and resources, the ambient is really good and it makes you feel that you're there escaping from real zombies, but the lack of content and the high price (9.99 usd at the moment) makes it a bad game, they could easily make it a good zombie game, with a simple tutorial, campain mode with a little back storry in game and easy to host co-op game, charge 2.99 usd and make it a great indie game, but they didn't...

												It has a lot of potential. I got it for $3.75 during the Autumn sale and after 30+ have zero regrets about that purchase. It's a lot of fun, especially with friends.EDIT: 100+ hours now. Game is released and there is workshop support for community maps, plus several new maps and modes added since beta. Devs have said that upcoming "DLCs" will be free and will add several new maps, modes and characters. Get this game, it is awesome!EDIT EDIT: This game has been out for years now and in my opinion the developers do not understand the meta or what makes their own game fun. My review after 350 hours is that while I enjoy this game very much it has a lot of problems and never had enough players to justify all of the game modes the devs keep trying to add. I recommend picking it up during a deep discount sale if you enjoy Source Engine multiplayer games and zombie themed stuff like I do. Do not pay full price.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												Escape: If you've played any of the original Zombie Panic: Source modification, you know escape mode. You and a number of friends play as human suvivors (for now) of a zombie outbreak, having just retreated into the lobby of a deserted and overrun metropolitan police facility and you have to work together and make your escape from the building. Along the way you scavenge for ammunition, tools and supplies to help you overcome the challenges of the facility. As your friends fall, they turn into Alpha Zombies, able to sprint, climb, and jump with abilities normally outside the capability of a Zombie (more akin to a 28 Days Later infected, or an Alien in AvP). Able to access some areas inaccessable to the human players, the quest for survival becomes more difficult as time goes, and the number of Alpha Zombies rises and surpasses that of the remaining humans. The escape route is randomized, keeping the map fresh for many play throughs.Hunt Mode: A well done tense stalking simulation, where you and a number of friends begin as humans scattered amidst a zombie infested suburban community, cul-de-sacs and all, or a quarantine research tent complex deployed in a local municipal park. Each round you must outlast the rest of the players to be the last one alive, whether through pacifist evasion, cooperative efforts, or active negation (killing the other humans Hunger Games/Running Man style) - and as the players fall, they become alpha zombies, just as in escape, making the game progressively harder as time goes on.Two key factors of both the above modes is that the maps themselves are large (in the virtual square footage sense) and structurally randomized in some sense, doors / pathways open in one round may be blocked, locked or closed off in the next - fires and other phenomenon are randomized somewhat as well - keeping the levels fresh for many play throughs. Additional, resource placement (ammo, weapons, tools), is randomized throughout the level as well - the shotgun you found on the receptionists floor may not be there the next time.Contagion uses the Source engine as well, so the movement and feel of the game is on par with other Source games I've played, keep that in mind if you're finicky about those things.My Wishes:   1) While there certainly would be work involved in rebooting and refining a dozen or so maps available for Zombie Panic: Source, I think the effort should be made. I remember several that were quite excellent that I'd like to see make the jump into new & revised Contagion versions, especially with some of the new mechanics granting the classics some new (undead?) life.  2) There needs to be a mechanism to allow unlimited & a selectable number of zombie respawns in Escape mode - sometimes when the randomizer hands the humans a large amount of ammunition and better weaponry early in the map it's impossible for a small number of player zombies (if any humans die at all) to provide much challenged to a well armed troupe. 3) There needs to be voting mechanisms for the usual - key settings, map change, kicking offending players, etc.I haven't played much of the third mode, Extraction, where you must help Counter-Strike-esque "Survivors" (I still call them hostages on VOIP in game half the time) hold out in a house until extraction arrives, then escort the survivors to the extraction point, and then a new house gets chosen with more surivors, repeat. As in the other modes, as players die they become Alpha Zombies, making it more difficult to protect the AI survivors. The zombies seem to swarm the hold out point, so a successful strategy I've seen a lot use it to sprint in quick, get the hostages, er survivors to follow you, then run out of the house with them to another part of the neighborhood until the extraction arrives. As the survivors escape, they toss out a pittance of ammunition and the occasional weapon. Since you can only enter the house activated as the hold out point, equipping is rough with a full set of eight or more players, and the escaping survivors don't provide enough resupply (by far) for the mode. I don't know if there's a fixed number of survivors to rescue, or if it just keeps going until all the players / survivors die - just haven't played enough to know.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												I played this game for about twenty hours since the sale I got it in 6 months ago. OPTIMISATIONThe first thing I will point out is that the game is greatly optimised unlike most of the zombie games I have encountered recently. I use a amd processor in case your wondering. GAMEPLAY its essentially like left for dead with two differences, you can have a team of eight players and zombies are stronger and less numurous.ZOMBIESthere are normal zombies that can be taken down with headshots and then there is only a one special zombie which is one with a suit of riot gear.GRAPHICS I think they look nice for a indie game, textures are great and lighting makes the game look more realDIFFICULTY it is actually difficult to complete a map in a game starting off, most games have a infected setting turned on so a single scratch can result in a player turning into a zombie and become a enemy to the other players. COMMUNITY majority of players I have encountered in this co-op game are pretty cool and co-operative however you get some rotten apples every now and then. this includes people who hog weapons and ammo and team killers in freindly fire servers who  decide to blow up a pack of C4 in the middle of a group of freindly players. MAPSthe maps change of objectives each time you play them, there are about 5 good maps in this game for the escape (campaine mode). I had fun completing all of these maps.MODS loads of neat customisation mods available

												I tried to like this game; I really did. I bought it and convinced my friends to do the same. I would not recommend this game to anybody. Sorry boutit

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Really good game for those of you who like zombies.Great Survivor vs Survivor action, aswell as several Co-op modes vs both AI and Player Zombies.Hunted - S vs S based mode with Player Zombies aswell. You spawn in a random location on the map, and your objective is to stay alive the longest. Scavenge the abandoned houses along the way, but beware - hitting B as a human brings up your phone, and you and other players can see who is close aswell as get a buzzing noise when hitting the trigger. If you die you will respawn as a zombie and your only task is to bring down the remaining survivors. Last survivor alive wins the round.Escape - Band together with friends and strangers in this Survivor vs AI / PC zombies. Your phone will let you know what objective you need to accomplish and your main goal is to escape from the map. Weapons, ammo and items will be found along the way. Make sure you check every corner as they are sometimes hidden or you need to progress further to unlock the areas they are in.Extraction - Survivor vs AI / PC zombies where your goal is to follow the GPS on your map and find survivors held up in houses. Once you reach a holdout point, vast amounts of zombies will begin spawning, so share your ammo and your weapons with your friends, as each member of your team that gets killed will come back as one of the ravenous corpses coming to eat you. Round ends when all survivor packs have been extracted, or the zombies kill either all Player survivors or NPC survivors in a pack.Panic (Objective) - The P:O mode was taken from the spiritual prequel Zombie Panic! Source, another game worth picking up as it's free, and features a strictly PS vs PZ combat zone, where the survivors need to complete the objectives much like in Escape.Panic (Classic) The original game mode from ZP!S which just like the Objective mode features only player combat. Survive the zombie rush. Zombies have limited lives and the first player to turn becomes the strong Riot Zombie.Happy hunting and good luck surviving!

number of helpful: 9 of 15 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												This game promises way too much, and it doesn't look like they are gonna deliver anything better than this unpolished game.It says 'unique characters', but for me they look all the same. The few lines of 'background story' to each character is everything you get.In the trailers, they NEVER mentioned that we are gonna get small confined maps full of zombies that can spawn just from anywhere, and only a handful of 'survivors'.In a co-op mode, there is no storyline. Just random situations in the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ maps. just a 'go here, find this, go there'-like objectives. Firearms are limited and zombies come at you in endless numbers. It's the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t every round. They say 'Every round is unpredictable' ; well that's not true. You run around, fight zombies by unrewarding and boring fighting mechanisms, and you get to the end 'somehow'.Perhaps they wanted to make a zombie sandbox game. I thought that's what this could be. I was wrong.As mentioned, the maps are small. Each map is EXACTLY the same every round. In a deathmatch game, those with best camping skills are rewarded.If you walk around fighting zombies, guys will come after you and kill you. One blow from a zombie is enough to make you into a zombie. Better you camp with your back to the wall, and wait for the brave freeroamer to come in and get killed by you.I can see what they wanted to make. In their imaginations, this was the best realistic zombie simulator.But it's mediocre, really. I'm a zombies game fan, and I know that 'Left 4 Dead' is an unrealistic, arcady and funny game with running zombies. But it had at least enough variation - even without that 'completely unpredictable' ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t - to keep me entertained for many many hours.I can see they tried. But Should that be enough? I don't think so. I won't say don't buy it, but don't believe what they promise. Keep down your expectations. You won't need them.But all the features that could have been good, are only half done. And I really don't believe that it's gonna be any better.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												Maps are huge and there's lot of objectives to follow in the best mode which is Escape.  You are free to roam around some of the map but have to complete certain tasks to enter into new areas and eventually find the exit.  Each time you play a level there are different objectives and routes.  Along the way you must scavenge for guns, ammo, keys, and other items that will help you progress.  In survival mode you have to last 20 minutes and can use a nail gun and wood to barricade yourself into a building.  The graphics and sound are extremely well done and the guns feel powerful and accurate.  With some friends playing co-op this game really comes into it's own.  8/10.

number of helpful: 12 of 21 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												When first playing Contagion, I thought to myself, "Oh a slower left 4 dead".  And while that might be true, Contagion is also a lot more.The game is still in "Early Access Beta", and so far it is shaping up to be quite promising.  My favorite mode is "Escape".  You need to work with your team mates, watch each other's backs, and... escape.  The slow pacing adds to the sense of dread and paranoia that will hit you while you scavange for a few more bullets and try to find the way out.  The smart phone your character carries provides objective updates and on some modes a map and GPS directions.Reaching the end and escaping is highly satisfying after the methodical gameplay and teamwork you need to use to get there.  Once more maps are added it will only improve this great game even more. This game is well worth the price of entry and a steal if you can get it on sale.

number of helpful: 14 of 25 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
												Contagion is a neat little game, Best described as "dayZ light". If you like the concept of dayZ pvp and loot but don't want to suffer through a "simulator" that requires large amounts of time investment and forces you to eat/drink and walk extreme distances then Contagion is worth a try. This game also has a coop mode that is basically Left for dead but with more players. Players must get from one objective to another and find gear along the way. One cool thing about contagion is that when you die you spawn as a zombie until the next round. This means that if you are infected or die early on you don't have to be taken out of the action. The PVP mode is basically a free for all. Everyone spawns around a pretty large map with a pistol and compete for gear. You can choose a building and board it up to create a little hideout. Its pretty intese when dozens of zombies are trying to bust into your little fortress. When you die you respawn as a zombie for a chance to get revenge on whoever killed you. As a zombie you can gather hoards of NPC undead and direct them toward the survivors. This game features a nice variety of gear. Everything from Crossbows to machine guns and plenty of melee weapons. Also the devs continue to add gear and maps for free. Only a few nitpicks with this one: Some maps can be difficult to navigate in coop. You can sometimes get lost especially if you aren't sure what to do next. Also some servers have zombie players disabled. This means that if you die you will respawn as a cockroach until the round ends. I suggest avoiding those servers unless you really hate those pesky player zombies. Also the population of the game can sometimes die between steam sales and content updates.... Only a few servers to choose from in those scenarios. Overall this game is really cool because you get the intese PVP that dayZ is known for but without the open-world grindyness or low framerates that dayZ subjects its players to. Contagion runs on the source engine so the framerates are high on a variety of system configs. The graphics aren't anything special but the game still looks great. I give it a thumbs up.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Heh, this is going to be a long review. It is not going to be all-out dissing the game, but there are ups and downs about this game. I know it is in beta but the game seems to be centering around tasks. It might just be me noticing this but the animations are a bit choppy, zombies will randomly dissapear, and the zombie's animations are a bit odd remarking their savage behavior. What I mean is that this game needs more time, I think the game shouldn't have been released at this time, giving it's condition. Yes, the game is almost stable, but I think that if they put more effort into the zombie's animations that will fill up that space. Moving on to the players, the melee weapons are hard to get used to, due to lack of damage, making them complayely useless. This game is relying too much on the guns side. Unlike NMRiH (No More Room in Hell), the melee is actually usefull, the Contagion team needs to add Critical Hits, and the ability to sever limbs. The players animations confuse me between weak hits and powerfull hits with melee weapons. I think that they need to show the player charging up their hit, and then releasing it upon the enemy. If the Contagion crew wants some inspiration, I recommend these games to light a spark: L4D 1&2, NMRiH, Project Zomnoid, The Dead Linger, and  7 Days to Die. I know this review was long and I hope the Contagion crew reads this and might get inspired or get notified of these glitches or problems, I will update if I come across anyhing.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I cannot say this game is the best I've played in a while, but it is worth trying out at least. There is at present a limited number of options for maps at the moment (a situation I expect to change in the near future), but from what I can tell the map quantity does not need to be high. It offers a dynamic gameplay so that each playthrough is unique. The maps lock certain ways and unlike others each time, which is unique unto itself. The fact that players who die come back as zombies makes the game that much more fun. It is somewhat limited in scope, however. The physics are not as polished as some other zombie games, and there are only two kinds of zombie to face - regular and armored. The player zombies act as 'leaders' for the horde only in that they can command them; they do not have enhanced hp or special abilities. However, the games modes included do make up for the seeming lack of variety or polish. Hunted is effectively a deathmatch with zombies thrown in for flavor, escape is the classic left for dead style run through, escort is the typical escort-style mission with zombies, and panic is a simple pc v pc human v zombie deathmatch mode. Another plus is the survival-style limited resources provided. Every game mode, no matter the type, forces the player to constantly scavenge for ammunition and equipment, which is how one would imagine a zombie apocalypse to play out. Over all this is a decent game, though if you dislike the survival horror genre stay away. Ammo conservation is paramount to survival here.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												Contagion is survival horror at its finest.  Lurking around every corner are walkers that could potentially bring a survivor down on their own, making each encounter all the more terrifying.  Hordes of the infected have the capacity to overrun groups of survivors, making cooperative play all the more important when it comes to this game.  All in all, contagion is a fun zombie experience with a lot to offer and will keep you on your toes, whether you, yourself, are alive... or not.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												   Horrible game. I got this game a month before release and have seen it try to improve itself over the past year and let me tell you it has improved in some areas but still lacks in others that leave me feeling like it's a waste of time to play. I used to play Zombie Panic: Source ALL the time and I loved how it wasn't a realistic take on zombie killing and it wasn't too cheesy either. It allowed for a lot of fun memories with people who just wanted to have a good time. I never seen that in contagion. No one in contagion ever seemed friendly at all. Even their ZPS classic mode in contagion didn't add up. It has nothing to do with ZPS. The only thing that is even similar is just the carrier roar and even then, it's not the same. Stupid.   I just hate how this game killed an already amazing game. I know a lot of people seem to enjoy overly realistic games, but for me, games are supposed to be an escape from reality. Not put me right back in it.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Honestly, this game isn't perfect. The AI needs an overhaul, the Player Zombies are overpowered, and balancing is needed.But, if there's one thing that keeps me coming back, it's these developers.They actually listen and know what their community wants.The game shipped with 8 players max.Some of us asked for more players, and they raised the cap to 16.The game came with one PvP game-type called Hunted, pitting players against each other and a bunch of AI-controlled zombies. Some guys wanted the ability to disable player zombies, some guys wanted to get rid of the AI-zombies.What did the devs do? Both. They released a game-type called Zombie Panic and added toggle options for Player Zombies and Infection.Most devs keep quiet about their work, these guys don't. They have a list of things that they are working on.Pioneer Express? Barlowe Square? They told all of us about these maps. What are they working on now? CE_Biotec.Got a question about the game? Post it in the forums. If it's something that the community can't answer, the devs probably will.Some reviews have said that the devs ban people who criticize their game. They don't, otherwise I would've been gone a long time ago.Now, onto the actual review.This game is hard, and I mean ridiculously hard. That's one of its charms.It's a survival horror game that forces you to work in order to master it, a lot like the original Resident Evil games.Ammo is scarce, navigation is difficult, and zombies are strong.Eventually though, these 3 problems fade away as you begin to conserve ammo, learn the maps, and aim for the heads.It's a game that punishes you for stupid mistakes, but every time you do something right, you'll feel like you've accomplished something.It's a love-it-or-hate-it type of game, and it's one that I personally enjoy.

												I hear alot of people with negative opinions about this game. Though it is in development I already think this game is amazingly fun, and I'm sure I'm going to spend alot of hours on it. It may seem difficult at first, or the controls may seem weird(I always change mine to what fits my playstyle) but if you give the game a try I'm positive you'll have some crazy adrenaline filled moments that will have your palms sweating. If it is going to be your first time playing, I highly suggest you play a coopertive mode such as Escape or Extraction. If you play a pvp mode on your first time you might get a little frustrated from dying by more experienced players. Once you have a hang of the gameplay and find yourself a friend or two you'll quickly find that this game could potentially be one of your most favorite games.

content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												First of all, I would like to say that I've been a fan of Zombie Panic! Source, It was my favorite steam game, I've played years of it and when I heard about Contagion I got super excited for it.In the weekend they put the game for a free weekend and on deal, I played the trial and fell in love with it, After a while I bought the game and I'm not dissapointed, A big thank and congratulations to the developers for making such a great game.This game is similar to Zombie Panic! Source so you'll get almost no problems with understanding the game's gameplay.So basically there are various gamemodes and maps, Each map with it's own objectives and each mode with it's own point.For a start I would suggest trying out ce_losmuertos (Escape : Los Muertos)From what I can tell it's the easiest map out there.Talking about the game, You at the start are a survivor, And there are other zombies/infected that are out there trying to stop you, There are many actions that you can do when you are a survivor or a zombie, Which is great and balanced.The game has some realism, So you'll get tired after sprinting (Yes theres sprinting!) for a while, Jumping and you have no crosshair, So iron sights are a very useful thing here.For zombies you can roar, Use your zombie vision, Blend (Activate a CPU to play for you) and command other zombies.If you think you'll let zombies hit you and you'll be fine you're wrong, Because theres infection!I really love these kind of games, So it's a 5 out of 5.

content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Inevitably this game will be compared up against Left 4 Dead 2. This is understandable but not entirely fair to the game although there are certainly many similarities. In a market already oversaturated with zombie-games left, right and center what is there to recommend? What is there to make this stand out? Honestly I can't answer that since I haven't played most of the other games out there. What I can tell you though is why I like it.First of all it has atmosphere in spades. The graphics do a lot to help with this and by that I don't necessarily mean visual fidelity but the overall style. Where L4D is a little lighter on the horror and as a result tend to be a brighter game this is darker and more - dare I call it - "realistic". When I say dark I mean litteral darkness and your flashlight is designed in such a way that it isn't a magic lamp that illuminates everything and make things instantly better. You'll have to see it to know what I mean but I can tell you that facing off against a gang of zombies in a dark room can get very tense despite your flashlight.The pace is also very different. It's slower and less arcade than other similar FPS zombie games. Zombies move slower and though they can "run" (more like walking fast) there are no sprinters. It builds more on the premise that even a few zombies become a serious threat if you let them come up close. Headshots are the name of the game and ammo/weapons are meant to be scarce. Melee is an option but don't expect to wade through even a few zombies with your sledgehammer. Zombies take multiple hits to go down, swings are slower than you might think... oh and they use precious stamina that you also need to sprint.I could go on but I hope the above has already given you a sense of whether this is something for you or not. You can read about the different game modes elsewhere but in brief there's one PvP mode (hunting others on maps filled with zombies) and two co-op modes. And when I say co-op I do mean co-op: don't expect to get far or have an easy time without some serious teamwork!Bottom-line: don't let comparisons to other games (such as L4D1-2) influence your decision. Both this game and L4D2 are among my favorite zombie co-op shooters and I love each for their way of doing things.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Honestly, this game isn't perfect. The AI needs an overhaul, the Player Zombies are overpowered, and balancing is needed.But, if there's one thing that keeps me coming back, it's these developers.They actually listen and know what their community wants.The game shipped with 8 players max.Some of us asked for more players, and they raised the cap to 16.The game came with one PvP game-type called Hunted, pitting players against each other and a bunch of AI-controlled zombies. Some guys wanted the ability to disable player zombies, some guys wanted to get rid of the AI-zombies.What did the devs do? Both. They released a game-type called Zombie Panic and added toggle options for Player Zombies and Infection.Most devs keep quiet about their work, these guys don't. They have a list of things that they are working on.Pioneer Express? Barlowe Square? They told all of us about these maps. What are they working on now? CE_Biotec.Got a question about the game? Post it in the forums. If it's something that the community can't answer, the devs probably will.Some reviews have said that the devs ban people who criticize their game. They don't, otherwise I would've been gone a long time ago.Now, onto the actual review.This game is hard, and I mean ridiculously hard. That's one of its charms.It's a survival horror game that forces you to work in order to master it, a lot like the original Resident Evil games.Ammo is scarce, navigation is difficult, and zombies are strong.Eventually though, these 3 problems fade away as you begin to conserve ammo, learn the maps, and aim for the heads.It's a game that punishes you for stupid mistakes, but every time you do something right, you'll feel like you've accomplished something.It's a love-it-or-hate-it type of game, and it's one that I personally enjoy.

Posted: September 5, 2014
												   Horrible game. I got this game a month before release and have seen it try to improve itself over the past year and let me tell you it has improved in some areas but still lacks in others that leave me feeling like it's a waste of time to play. I used to play Zombie Panic: Source ALL the time and I loved how it wasn't a realistic take on zombie killing and it wasn't too cheesy either. It allowed for a lot of fun memories with people who just wanted to have a good time. I never seen that in contagion. No one in contagion ever seemed friendly at all. Even their ZPS classic mode in contagion didn't add up. It has nothing to do with ZPS. The only thing that is even similar is just the carrier roar and even then, it's not the same. Stupid.   I just hate how this game killed an already amazing game. I know a lot of people seem to enjoy overly realistic games, but for me, games are supposed to be an escape from reality. Not put me right back in it.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
												Yet another zombie game, yet another game built on the source engine, it's very similar to Left 4 Dead but less arcadish, whereas in Left 4 Dead you are given military-grade weapons with practically unlimited bullets vs hundreds of athletic zombies and first aid kits everywhere. Here you get a more hardcore, classic resident evil atmosphere, where objectives(like finding keys) are not spoon-fed to the players and they have to find how to escape(for example) the map themselves, and most zombies are slow as ♥♥♥♥, and ammunition is scarce.Weapons range from simple household weapons to police/military weapons depending on the map and mission. There are melee weapons but they aren't as polished as left 4 dead's and you can find yourself missing a lot of swings. The game is very cooperative but when you die it's not the end. you get to become a zombie, and you can try to kill the other players and stop them from completing the mission. Also, from zombie scratches and bites alone you can get infected and turn into a zombie even though you still have hp left. personally I don't like these features, as it basically negates the hp system because one scratch can kill you anyway, and when players die they become wise-zombies that know how to hide and ambush which can break immersion and kill fun for the remaining survivors, I liked the dynamic respawn systems of L4D better, but it's still a unique feature to this game.The online community is kinda dead as there are lots of servers but few of them actually have players playing in regularly, and playing with random players isn't that fun in this game as it can turn into a looting race between survivors, so make sure you have friends to play this with.Recommend only if you like the classic resident evil-vibe and first person games, and if you have friends to play this with, as the community is pretty much dead imo.6.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												I really hate saying that games are rips of other games but this game feels just like a carbon copy of no more room in hell they both play the same except No more room in hell is far better and free, this game has some very serious issues, there are some clipping bugs, the zombie AI is really wonky the AI is either really ♥♥♥♥ing good IE. seeing me through walls or just really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and cant see me when im 3 to 4 feet infront of them, the different difficulties make no difference really minus you may find less ammo other than that all zombies die with 1 head shot, movement is sluggish and the guns accuacy or the zombies hit boxes are awful ive had al least 20 to 30 times ive aimed for the head dead on with the sights and the wall on the other side of their head gets hit but not the zombie. lastly the direction HOLY ♥♥♥♥ING♥♥♥♥♥♥the direction in this game is so ♥♥♥♥ing terrible to the point where i want to say there is just none, youre ploped in on a map and told to go to "Chucks gun store" it does not tell you where its at what it looks like or how to get there thats all on you, now that may sound like a cool thing the game not holding youre hand but in a game where there are more zombies than you and you need bullets to kill them because the ♥♥♥♥ing melee wepons rarely spawn it gets to be pretty annoying when you keep running out of ammo from going the wrong way and kill 10 zombies that did not need to. also "KEY ITEMS" why is nothing ever highlighted i had to find a fire extinguisher i spent 20 min in a crappy lit map looking for a dark red non highlighted item that i had no clue where it would be because of the random generator for this game because there is NO DIRECTION IN THIS GAME that item could have spawned back at the begining of the level but since it did not tell you before hand what you may have needed you now have to spend 30 min looking for and item that may not even be in that area. If you want a game that actualy has a good zombie exp you should get no more room in hell its free and it plays just like this, though the graphics are less quality due to it being free but the gamplay is so much better and you can actually play it with friends and have too much trouble on the server list

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												Reviewed 12th July 2014, full released versionThe good:+ Sticking to Romero-esque zombies, no "special infected" zombies that don't really belong to the universe.+ Basic Gunplay and movement+ A more grounded L4D in conceptThe why and the bad:- immserion breaking objects placement: Tools and weaponary that seemingly can be used in the game are more often than not just decorations in maps. And there are literally littered everywhere around the map. Fences that act as wall barriers to make you go through long alternate routes is fine until you see not only zombies, but other suvivor NPCs climb over them with ease.- Very bad guns balancing. It's ok if I have to do head shots to kill zombies, but it's a bit ridiculous if I have to do a headshot with a shotgun in pin point distance to kill them too. SMGs, ARs advantages are really only just a higher fire rate for me to spam more bullets to hit heads rather than doing more damage or more stopping power.- Bad resource management and feedback. You will have to guess how much of a type of ammo you have if you don't have the corresponding guns that use the specific ammo. Dropping ammo for team mates that require them is pretty much gonna be a disaster of mess, which it really shouldn't be for a game that is suppose to rely on good team work.- Each co-op playthroughs has no or very little and quite meaningless variant in paths and objectives, despite what's being advertised to you. Randomization of weaponary really doesn't mean much when the balancing of them are so bad that your pistol will normally do the job.The bottom line:- The game is fun with friends for the first few times until you have ran through each map once or twice.- If you are looking for an experience similar to L4D campaign co-op, there is a grand total of 2 maps of that that will take at max 2 hours to complete, with a high chance that you have missed a key somewhere and spending 20 minutes being frustrated looking for it.- If you don't have friends to play this with, your best bet is the pvp hunted mode as it's the only mode that still has a few players playing in and it's the mode that require the least team work if at all. In which I really have to say that there are just about hundreds and thousands of other shooters that plays and look better, do yourself a favor and play those instead.- There is not much content, or variations as of this review is written. Surely you can always keep an eye on steam workshop for actual extra content, but keep your expectations in check until the free DLC hits.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												This is a game that I will download, play with friends for a while, forget about, notice it has an update and play again.Every-time I've opened the game something has been changed and improved, whether that's extensive as new maps or as small as a redesigned menu; this game seems to be moving forward.I really love the multiplayer ideas they have included - trying to hunt down other players while navigation a horde of zombies all whilst not giving your position away is really stressful, and really fun!As well as this, the Escape maps - where you and other players must work together to escape from the map are really fun and quite challenging sometimes. The only problem I have with the Escape levels is that when a player dies, they then become a zombie and in my past experience, it is very easy for that one player to then wipe out the remaining "survivors". I feel more could be done to increase the difficulty of playing as a zombie.Overall though, this game is a great time killer and I thoroughly enjoy it. Can't wait to see where it goes!

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												The main game mode is called escape and sees up to 8 players try to work their way through a map full of zombies to escape a situation. The puzzles are pretty basic and usually involve finding an item to open a door or barrier. Each time you play the game the route changes, keys change location, different doors are unlockable/open, one game saw the team using vents to get around the map instead of taking the stairs. The zombies are easy enough to kill but a lack of ammo and limit to the number of things you can hold means that you often resort to using risky melee weapons. The limits on holding 5 things at once mean that through the game you do things such as swap a key for machine gun with no ammo(in the hope you will find ammo) only to find that the armory later in the game is locked..    Deathmatch sees up to 8 players battling it out on medium sized maps filled with zombies. While not strong the zombies are a great addition to the fight. The match is slow paced and it can be quite hard to find other human players, following a hoard who can smell human blood is a great way to track people down. Other ways to find humans include following flashlights, which works great when you see a small flash in the front room of the house next door or following gunshots. Gunshots is a great idea by the developers because at some point human players find themselves cornered in a loft with a zombie they need to take out; unfortunately, unless you have 5.1 sound its unlikely to help locate people that much.   I should point out the game is beta, so there is plenty of time for things to change. I don’t know how being a zombie can be more fun while not making them too powerful for humans. While it takes a while to hunt a human player down in escape mode, this stops the humans getting overran by 5 zombie players. I should also note that while being a zombie was a tad boring, playing as a human was really fun. It was also really tense, death actually meant something to the player and kept you on your toes.    I’m giving this 4.5 stars because I’m knowingly taking part in a beta. Perhaps I would give it 3.5 if this was the finished product, but it’s not. Reviewing games at this stage in their life is perhaps a little unfair, but I think its good giving games trying something new and following the kickstarter/green light/beta business models as much coverage as possible. 4.5/5 stars :D

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												Ever wished L4D was less about running ASAP from A-B with magical infinite-ammo pistols & minor punishment for getting killed, and more like a first-person classic Resident Evil with full co-op that wasn't a disappointing or underpopulated mess? Well, here you go! Admittedly it's certainly a niche market and obviously not for everyone if they just want to shoot some zombies, but get some like-minded friends in on the action with a private server and you'd be surprised at just how enormously replayable the (currently) small roster of Escape maps can be, especially on Extreme difficulty. Hell, even joining public servers full of randoms manages to go against the usual online experience and can often wind up being remarkably fun. A game that will sometimes feel a little rough around the edges the more you play and experiment with things, but certainly not enough in any way to ruin the experience.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												The game is entertaining and has many great features, but it has many bugs including the following:1. Sometimes the keyboard/mouse will not move you correctly after loading; disabling controller settings can help this however these settings are on by default and it may be a recurring problem if you are not diligent about checking them.2. There is no way to tell if you are going to spawn as a zombie when joining random games, so if you're interested in cooperative play to meet objectives, you need to arrange your match ahead of time for any guarantees.3. Every time I have completed a map, the game sits on the final score screen and I am forced to exit the game which results in my not having any of my achievements recorded on my steam profile.  Annoying to not be able to track your progress.4. Between my kids and I (three computers), whenever we try to play together on LAN, if one of the games crashes it crashes the game for all three of us.  The two who do not crash get a "Game Paused" message and it never recovers, and the person who crashed (if it was not the host) is unable to rejoin the game.  We have not yet been able to complete a mission together on LAN due to this.  This may actually be two problems; either an actual game crash, or a short break in our wifi which I believe is the cause for the "Game Pause" message, however both have the same result of being unable to finish a level.If these issues can be resolved then I would recommend this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												Pros: Very tactical. Feels like the zombie apocalypse, with that atmosphere, the ability to board up entrances, infection, and a mode that allows humans to fight each other over resources. Tense, addictive. Challenging, so satisfying, hard won victories. Escape Mode plays like a proper single-player survival horror, but with co-op, and player zombies: look for the way to proceed, find objective items like fire extinguishers and keys, etc. Allows players fighting each other as Humans, zombies. Varied, dynamic modes. Randomized objectives means you can't predict quite where to go, or what to do, even after playing levels many times. Solid co-op, with 2-16 players. Good alternative to Left 4 Dead, which it is a clone of.Cons: Some awkward elements, such as glitches and bugs. Exploits that some players abuse. Players that are zombies are not quite equal to 'human' players, the way it is in, say, Aliens vs Predator. Too little content. Not as refined as Left 4 Dead. No "easy" way to play, and steep learning curve, and rarely winning does get frustrating.My recommendation: Get this if you want an alternative to Left 4 Dead that is not streamlined, and even more realistic and dynamic.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												Great game especially for the Sale. The overall atmosphere of the game is amazing, and the PVP free for all gamemode (hunted) is terrifyingly fun. It's like DayZ in the fact that it's you versus everyone plus zombies. Except, when people die, they actually join the ranks of the undead. There's nothing more intense than roaming a zombie-filled neighborhood, breaking into a house, checking your phone, and realizing you're not the only living person in the house. Then you see one of the bedroom doors open... The only downside is that it's still in its beta stages, so there's bugs here and there, like the occasional zombie model freezing in place or just a hitbox mishap. There's also only a few maps to choose from. But that'll most likely change as they continue to update the game. It's early access for a reason of course.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
 *Almost* the Zombie game we have all been waiting forI have played a lot of zombie FPS (They Hunger, Zombie Master, Zombie Panic, NMRIH, L4D...ect), however I have longed for a game that captured the essence of a George A Romero zombie flick. At last we have a game where the zombies can only be dispatched by shooting them in the head! I am suprised this has not been done before, as it not only says true to the greatest zombie triology of all time, but more importantly, it rewards player accuracy. The game offers a fantastic atmosphere, good gun mechanics and some interesting maps. What stands out from this game is the fantastic 'hunted' mode, which is essentially a last man standing PVP deathmatch with NPC zombies. However, it has a slight twist, in that when a player dies, they come back playing as a zombie. I loved the PVP element of 'Day Z', so this game mode was perfect for me. At present, I would even go as far as saying that the battles on this game are better, because the game mechanics are so fluid and the zombies are actually a threat.Contagion is by no means perfect though, for starters, the objective game modes are hit and miss. Although the player is told what to do by a mobile phone, it is often not clear what the objective actually is, or where the player should go. The game is crying out for more maps, which I am sure will come when/if it gets workshop support. Also, I am hoping that the developers adapt the current barracading system, so that players can actually move objects (at present you can only place wooden boards). Overall, this is a decent addition to the genre. Perhaps the amount of content does not justify the full price tag, but it is definitely worth picking up in the sale for the 'hunted' gameplay mode. Hopefully it will develop and maintain a healthy player count. 7.5/10
