												I've played Left 4 Dead.I've played No More Room In Hell.I've played most modern zombie games, but Contagion is by far, THE BEST.True, genuine horror at it's finest.Picture this,"You and your friend, in a guard station, trembling, ready to push a button, but you have NO idea what this button does.It opens a gate, zombies pour in, you and your friend panic, you run into the back room, only to realise there's another batchof zombies on the other side of another door.Zombies start pouring in from the other door.."Moments like that are what make this game fantastic.Ammo is limited, item locations are random.Trust me, this is a blast to play.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												If you're looking at this you're probably wondering if the game is worth a buy, 20$ may seem very expensive to those who don't have the luxury to just go out and buy games without a doubt while it may seem like pocket change to others.Considering this is my first review please take this with a grain of salt.Why should I consider buying Contagion?You should buy Contagion because It's fun, it provides an environment where cooperation is key, while that may seem like a generic statement across all sorts of zombie survival games, seriously, in this one, it is. If your friends die they become zombies and ultimately that makes your gameplay a whole lot more difficult because that one player zombie can infect another player and they're count goes up one by one until the last person is left cowering in a corner before she/he is mauled to death by a horde. A lot of players who prefer the old slow zombies and freakish hordes of them will like this game in its entirety.Contagion challenges the players in a multitude of gamemodes such as... Escape - Which you could say is the traditional left 4 dead style, "Let's go do some objectives so we can get out of here." type of thing. Extract - If you have ever played Resident Evil 3, this is the mercenary mode where you run around extracting civilains. Hunt - You versus everything else pretty much. Zombie Panic Classic - If you have ever played the Free to Play Zombie Panic Source, this is basically the same. Zombe Panic Objective - The same as Zombie Panic Source's objective escape mode, it's Escape in Contagion too but this time it's you versus a player zombie at the start.Stopping with the possibly ranting non-sense, lets get on with this review. First of all, the store page in comparison to real gameplay.Store Page Advertising in Comparison to Real GameplayIf you've read the section "What they're saying about Contagion" which is the first section of the store page for reviewers it's basically saying that Contagion is a good game that has gone back to the old style slow zombie game that is worth the 20$ it's worth. But is that really true?My Experience in relation to this statement.Yes, Contagion has done that and so far I've liked the game, even in the most frustrating moments I've had fun running around popping zombies in the head once or beating them with a melee weapon of my choice. But that is me however, how would it be for you the player?Contagion may be fun for a good majority of the possible people willing to throw money at the developers so that they can play however a there is also the fact a lot of people have said that the game is terrible, the graphics are bad, the gameplay sucks, gore is 'meh' and it's been an overall bad experience. Hell, the two first reviews I saw of Contagion had said that it was a bad game and there was only one good review. But these reviews were a bit old, like, months back old so I decided to write one myself.In all seriousness, if you have a problem with graphics, any game developed for the Source Engine is gonna look bad in some way so you should save yourself the time and money and just ignore this game all together. If you're cool with it, enjoy.Gameplay wise, if you have everything going for you and you have a smart team to play with, even on the most hardest difficulties you will steam roll through zombie hordes and make it to the end with minimum casualties if not zero. That is probably the biggest aspect of the game I consider that makes it fun for anyone to play it really. Teamwork is essential in this game and if you're not a teamplayer, you're gonna get wiped quick and you'll probably get mad very easily at this game because being mauled by a horde of zombies isn't fun, not for you, not for anyone and not even for your teammates across the map. Because when you die, they'll have to deal with you and any player zombie is more fiendish than an NPC in a horde.The Gore is decent, it's not gonna rock you and have blood spraying everywhere but the limbs will fall off I assure you this. It's also toggable so if you have children who want to play feel free to turn of it. Then again, why are you subjecting your child to such a violent gorish videogame like Contagion?Overall Experience of Contagion? It's pretty good, I wouldn't say 'decent' because the only time I would ever say 'decent' if it was a 50/50 that everything was going right and everything was going wrong at that point. With my 'small' experience of Contagion gameplay I can only say this. It's good because discluding the idiotic players, the twit taking things he doesn't need and the relatively low chance of getting trolled by a zombie because you've emptied a magazine into his head, it's pretty good.The only things you need to worry about in the game is the things I just discluded, the dumb or should I say, learning players, the trolls, the hoarder of ammo and the trollish hitboxes preventing you from ending the zombies life. Those are the only things that are going to ruin your day, mostly the trollish hitboxes on the zombies. Other than that, the players tend to listen and stick together but you will usually always have the one guy who decided to hoard everything and not share one bit of it. Dynamic Gameplay What they've said is true in terms of finding weapons or objectives but the map layout tends to be the same and you will usually have a deja vu moment here and there. It will always be new in terms of trying to find the objective in the various places they put it as well as the pathways you take to that objective but other than that the map will remain the same. I honestly thought the map would be different like they made blocks of the maps that would interlock easily and would create a whole new environment all together.Edit 9/2/2014 - Added a little bit concerning the pathways to objectives will always be different. State Of The Art Gore I would say that this would be true in terms of it described but I honestly don't think it's state of the art, you could really compare this to Deadspace's limbic system when you utterly destroyed the monsters. Immersive Sound Effects This I would consider to be definetly true, I never got to a point where I ran through the game without even thinking, I was always cautious because the obvious zombie moans around the corner usually prepared me to get mauled to death. Traditional Zombies Yes, yes, yes. Spot on though I'd have to say, they can climb ladders and get into vents? Seems a bit new to me in terms of what zombies could do...Extensive Survival EquipmentI'd have to say, this really disappointed me. I expected there to be a multitude of items to use as a weapon and it severely disappointed me when I enter a store and there's all this hardware I could use as a possible weapon but they didn't consider it. They did however say that they would continue to add so I suspect more in the future.Unique GamemodesI don't know if Unique meant that the experience in itself would be unique each time or that each game mode was unique. This statement is basically what I explained up top if you've missed it, other than that, I don't know how to respond to this literally. Stop Paying More Hurray! What else am I supposed to say?I'll probably add more to this review later on in the future, overall I have to say 9/10, the game is really fun when things are on your side, that can be said for a lot of games though.In the end, it's your choice whether or not you want to buy it or not. Hopefully this review is on your side and you don't have a horrible experience.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
												This game is wonderful, for once there is a game that brings the horror of zombies back to life. With contangions "darkness" and "gritty" enviorments and shading this game is a treat to those who want to finally partake in a game where zombies are a real threat.Contangion brings back everything i loved in zombie games and have wanted in a long line of them that have fallen short to my expectations. Todays genera of "survival" games really try to grab people into the market by saying they have "zombies" inside of them, when in fact the zombies in most those games are minor or no threat what so ever, but more of a backnoise that brings you back to the realization that the game was meant to be a zombie one, when ever you are not pvp'ing other's.this game dosent do that like the other's, Instead this game wants zombies to be the true threat, along with other player's.when bitten you can be infected and turn among you're fellow friends, making trust a very scary thing in the game.For those who want to take on the game as a hero slaying loner they have "solo" witch dose bring the realization as to how vunerable you really are in this world.ammo is tough to find, and zombies only go down in one way that has been ignored by so many game developer's, and thats "shoot them in the head"the only way to put them down, making you really hate yourself if you miss a head shot, knowing you just wasted a bullet.I suggest trying this game out while you can.it makes you feel like you're playing "l4d" but a more realistic feel instead of a cartoonish one.wonderful game, i hope they keep up the work, so far its a amazing ride.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												NOTE: This review was written 5/3/2014, things may have been subject to change.This is it, folks. The zombie game that will revolutionize the genre once again.Straight from the developers of the ever so popular mod, Zombie Panic!: Source, lies this gem, Contagion.Contagion is the definition of the first few days of a zombie apocalypse. No other zombie games I know of can capture the immersion of an atmosphere so dark, and cold. No other game captures the direct feeling of when a gunshot rings off in the distance, or a scream s heard across the open landscape. Or even... when it's a dead, dreadful, silence.The use of modern technology in this game is a neat and clever idea, using a smart phone to get info and help you on your quest makes it feel as if this can happen at any given moment, right now.Now, for gameplay mechanics and good things:You go up to a zombie. You shoot a bullet, thinking everything will be alright, as if this was Left 4 Dead. It resounds through the area and zombies reply with a big, fat "NOPE" as many rush over fences and break open windows to munch on a newfound meal. The sounds in this game are amazing, as they immerse you and give you that extra feel as if you're really there. Buildings have that nice echo that make you feel at home, then zombies are barreling through the door at the slightest loud noise that you may drum up.As of this review, you can now be infected by AI Zombies' physical attacks. It's very easy now to get infected. Now, you know that noone will have the heart EVER to tell someone they are going to turn, so they sit there, and they go throguh the symptoms. Then, their cries of agony fill the air, and it turns to a gurgle as their human qualities vanish and they lunge for their friends before your very eyes. It's a horrible feeling when you've been traveling with your friends for miles through the cities, and behind you, one of your friends is gone.It's cold.Now, for some flaws, because this is a review and I have to cover things good, AND bad.For one, and I know this will be fixed, is that there are so little maps that the replay value gets a little repetitive after a while. Now I'm sure the team is working avidly on new maps, especially co-op maps, but as of now, little co-op maps.There are some bugs, but this is all really stuff that will be fixed. I'm glad the team is really proud of this and I have all the respect for them.In conclusion, Contagion will reach for the stars for reviving the zombie genre. It's atmosphere is spot on, and it makes you feel isolated and helpless, which is what we wanetd ever since we've cracked open the pages of the Zombie Survival Guide. I hope this game makes history, and if it doesn't I will take a hot steaming crap on Steam.11/10Buy this game, and get it for your friends. You will not regret it.--------------------------Also, I guess I deviate from the norm, as for the record I think Hunted is stupid, unlike everyone else. ._.Yeah, flame me. I'm ready.*holds up AR-15*

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												If you were to immediately become blind while standing in the middle of Walmart during Black Friday, you'd probably have a better time finding where to go, what to find, and surviving than this game. Servers are usually laggy, game has barely changed over a year, zombie hitboxes are awful, player zombies are completely overpowered, list goes on and on and on.Although you might have some initial fun popping zombie heads, the more you play, the more obvious the problems become. Playing escape always tells you to go hunting for small items across an entire maps like keys, so you have to backtrack for most escape maps, and you basically bumble around for 20 minutes, die, then do it again as a zombie until the round ends. Directions are way too vague for escape, which is actually one of the best modes. The rest of the game mode are meh except for hunted, until player zombies win the match for everyone.Play No more room in hell instead, it's free and it's at least 78.54% more fun than this overpriced mess.TL;DR Gets boring after a while,zombie hitboxes are broken + player zombies opGamemodes are pretty boringGET NO MORE ROOM IN HELL

content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												It's ok for the most part. Some of the modes make no sense like hunted mode. Escape takes so long and theres many times zombies dont even spawn it makes no sense at all. I haven't tried some of the other modes yet.Extraction is proably the only mode that I like. The problem with thi smode is if a player dies he can become a player zombie and the ability to hoard zombies ruins the game. Sometimes players enter the match and are player zombies automatically. There is an option to turn this off. Problem is none of the official servers have it and if you try to run your own server its super annoying to get it working (my friend tried port forwarding like 3 times) we gave up. If its was easier to make your own server room it would be more enjoyable.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												Contagion is one of the most realistic zombie games I've come across, I bought it while it was in kickstarter and it hasn't disappointed. There's many excellent parts that make this game a whole, the UI is really easy to use, the game is really smooth and looks great on high quality, when you shoot a zombie in the head it'll blast brains out of the back of the head which I think looks really cool and you can cut limbs with sharp weapons.The zombies aren't overpowered but it's easy to die to a horde if you don't know what you're doing, it's a good strategy game in itself because if you're cornered by a big horde you need to figure out what to do, it's intense!The human zombies are definitely much harder to kill but that makes it much more fun, every mode is great, extraction, escape, panic, hunt, all enjoyable game modes.There is a minority of people who have given the game a bad review, think of these people as the critics who'm gave your favorite movie a bad review. Trust me, this game is worth your money.The only thing I can complain about is the fact that they were going to launch a DLC pack in October and it's May now and it still isn't released, I'm not sure what complicated things but I'm sure they have a good reason. they've been keeping the game bug free. You should definitely buy this.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												First impressions review so take what you will. I was granted with a main menu with options, start game, find game, extras and quit. Pressing start game takes you to the server creation page i think... find game brings you to page where you choose a difficulty, a gamemode and a map. You can do this if you want but i tried selecting random map, all modes, and easy and found nothing.So i joined an official server and was immediately confronted with a zombie, no kidding, not a foot in front of me. Of course the FPS in me came out and i immediately shot it in the face, other than that though i had no idea what i was doing. I quickly found out that control is crouch but otherwise it was not a game you can simply just pause and look at all the options, so i was immediately confronted with a tent which i ran inside and then cried into a corner. After killing two more zombies i found some courage and ran out, the zombies are rather dim witted and slow. I did find a couple players however, except they immediately shot me. Once again confused i started into the game again and immediately cowared into a shack. After shooting some more zombies i felt confident i wasn't going to die.Oh boy i was wrong. After voicing in chat my inability to actually play the game i found out i was playing in PVP with other players as zombies. Of course i also was called a camper and someone voiced my position in chat so of course they began to gang up on me so i just quit.Overall, it could be something good, but with no tutorial, no game mode descriptions and in general just♥♥♥♥♥♥other things it can't get a good review from me and it's going to be deleted.No wonder i got it for free off humble bundle...

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												I love this game, and everything about it. When extracting survivors from a house surrounded by the shambling undead, the game hardly feels like an early access game. Every bullet, every step, cannot be taken lightly - this game is a very good change to the zombie titles in the market today. With the option of both co-op and player versus player, this game can be enjoyed even without a multitude of maps for early access. Each map is random - what I mean by that, is NO playthrough will be the same - Objectives will be different, will have different locations, and different strategies for tackling them. Knowing maps won't do very good here, and thats what makes this game amazing.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Fans of the zombie genre will be pleased. Unlike L4D, there are no specials in this game. To bring down a zombie, you have to land a well-placed headshot. Zombies are typically slow, with the occasional burst of speed.The game offers three game-types as of this writing: two co-op gametypes, and one versus. In all the game modes, if you die, you become a zombie. It's definitely different and the team at Monochrome have been steadily updating the title since Alpha. I heartily recommend Contagion. The game oozes personality and runs well (pros and cons of being a Source engine game). In the end though, it's fun as hell. And isn't that what really matters?I love Contagion. Check it out.If you want a more in-depth explaination check out my impressions at my blog: http://www.saityrus.com/impressions-contagion/

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												WARNING: THIS REVIEW REFLECTS MY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE DURING THE EARLY ACCESS BUILD 4259IT IS IN NO WAY A FULL PRODUCT REVIEW AND IT WILL BE UPDATED IN THE FUTURE AS THE GAME EVOLVESContagion is in many ways the ultimate co-op zombie apocalypse experience. You have many game modes, you have many weapons to grab, tools to use, there is a variety of zombies, it's graphically superior to many other games, and it's a challenge to anybody who wants to play a zombie game and doesn't want to be bothered by a-holes ruining the games, like they do in other zombie games I could mention (but I won't, you already know of which I'm talking about).You shoot the zombies to the brain and the brain explodes, you see the bullet coming out of their head exactly where it should, and it's awesome. You need to take care and not waste your ammo because there's few and it's a valuable and scarce resource; same goes with medkits.There are currently three game modes, one in which you must escape a facility carrying on a number of tasks, another where you need to evacuate a neighbourhood before it gets overwhelmed (and you must hold position barricading and such) and a game called "hunt" made for PVP combat. The first two are cooperative, although there is friendly fire so look where you shoot. The last one is a free for all deathmatch; the last man standing wins.Although there are few maps at the time, you can see they are very detailed and won't get bored so easily as there is also a script which randomizes each game making it feel fresh, changing everything from weapon spawns to open hallways and houses.All in all and even though it's early access this game is a gem and if you're into zombie shooters you should give it a test drive because it may be just what you were looking for.

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												More effort was put into the commercial for this game than the actual game itself. This feels like an alpha product. It somehow manages to be worse than a free game with nearly the same concept. Everything is clunky, and I mean everything. Even one of the menu's used to pick your ringer for your phone is broken, as the preview button doesn't work. The servers are some of the worst I've played on, your ping will skyrocket as well as everyone else's just randomly. Even with lower ping everything is still laggy as ♥♥♥♥. The gunplay is okay, the sounds are pretty well designed, the voice acting is terrible. There are several weapons that you think you can use, but they are just part of the map itself. The animations for the zombies climbing obstacles are terribly done and as a result, hilarious. The map's are mazes, they have so many different directions that lead to dead ends. Most doors are locked. Any immersion that you thought you had is broken every time a character talks or you go into third person for a stealth kill animation. Every aspect of your movement is either slow or doesn't work half the time. On top of all these things the concept itself is flawed. When you die, you become a much too overpowered version of the undead. You can sprint faster than any human and you are constantly attacking no matter what if you are sprinting. It's even a one hit kill to any human players. Close to the end of any game someone will likely die, and as a result that one player who was bad enough at the game to die (or glitched off of a building) comes back as a zombie and kills everyone else. It is very rare that you will ever win a game, and while that might not be bad, the game is simply not at all fun enough to lose every time at. Don't waste your money, as there is a different, free zombie game with out the "coming back as a zombie" mechanic. It also has working servers and a game that isn't nearly as clunky.This game can eat my♥♥♥♥♥♥

												There is no doubt in my mind that this game is my favorite! Even after a year of playing Contagion I'm still not tired with it. This apocalyptic gem features a few different levels to play with your friends whether you want co-op or pvp.Try to escape a police station before the undead horde claims all of your lives, and if you get left for dead come back as one of the horde to hunt down your ex survivors. Take a spin at pvp. Sure shooters can be fun, but when you throw neutral zombies in the mix its not so easy to just run and gun. If you're one for the classics give panic a shot. Trust me after you play it you'll know why they call it that.This beauty of a game has so much good content already, but it doesn't stop there. These game maker guys throw in some cool updates every now and then to give us new weapon, maps, characters even gamemodes *cough cough flatline*.Stop hesitating and buy it already. You will have hours of fun playing this zombie infested masterpiece. Totally worth a $20 price tag.

Product received for free
A once promising game, offering an intriguing addition to the over-saturated "zombie survival" genre.Despite its successful initial execution, the development of the game has now been suspended (unofficially or not) due to the developers transferring their priorities to a different project. (such a shame really)Recommend it only for people who believe they would truly appreciate it.If someone wants an actively developed and constantly improved game, I recommend you choose a different title.An honest review from a gamer who seeks to combine interest with objective facts and provide trustworthy opinions to fellow gamers.- Dracus

number of helpful: 10 of 18 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Contagion is ultra realistic zombie apocalypse simulation with different modes and game types, like Hunted (PvP), Escape (exatcly what it means) and Extraction (helping NPC survivors to escape). Ammo is very limited, finding powerful guns can be pretty challenging, and the envirnoment is dark, mostly rainy and full of zombies. Graphics are very realistic, gameplay is nice and non-repetetive. It's all about teamplay; as a L4D2 scavenge rusher and soloer, (yea, right) I also wandered off the group and did objectives myself, but usually you can get yourself killed by doing that (yes, in some modes you can get infected from single scratch). All in all this game very well done, and as the workshop just came to it, it's even getting better. Rating: 8.5/10

content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												The game is decent and still obviously needs way more content.As it stands right now, the way it is going is good.Graphics: The graphics are nicely done and better than most game graphics. Audio: The audio is alright with some guns sounding weird, with even the foot sounds weird but it's fine to get over.Controls: The character control is decent just moving sometimes feels little off and kinda weird when moving around.There are some great features in the game like when you die you become a zombie to attack people... You must manually reload your gun when it runs out (No auto reload) there are a few more.The game is good fun and I have given away a few copies of this game because it is good, just it is a little hard to learn because the phone is the only way of telling you about what to do and where to go, and even then it is vague.The co-op is what makes the game, if you can get a game with your friends and if you complete a mission it restarts and nothing is the same thing.  Things change around, your route is altered so that is good thing.Things are never in the same location and some might be but others not so each time the game makes you search and look because it changes.Anyway a good game and worth buying and playing.

number of helpful: 10 of 18 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												When I first bought this game I was disapointed. I paid full price for it and I felt confused and annoyed by almost everthing I tried to do. After investing a reasonable amount of playtime into this game, I am happy to say now that I thoroughly enjoy this game. That is why I would really like for more people to buy this game and play it. This game deserves to be more popular. Furthermore, the game is on sale right now so people will be checking it out and there has never been a better time to join if you have considered it. For those reasons I have decided to provide what I think is a good recipe for getting started in Contagion. 1. The first thing you should do is go to start game and select the hunted game mode on any map. Choose solo play, turn infection off, and put the difficulty on easy. You will be dropped into a map with randomly generated zombies and a decent amount of weapons and ammo laying around for you to pick up. Hunted is a pvp game mode and since you are playing solo, this will be a good way for you to just run around aimlessly killing zombies and familiarizing yourself with the gameplay and the maps. Do this until you get tired of it and feel ready for the game to get more intense.2. Now that you have gotten a feel for the game, go to find game, select hunted as the game mode, and join the first server that pops up. From here you will be looking to find and kill the other living characters (not zombies). This is a lot of fun, for beginners and vets alilke. Since your new, you may or may not get killed early, but thats ok since you get to come back from the dead to seek retribution against the living. Basically you get to play the entire time without having to sit and wait just because you died, 3. Have you made any friends yet? If so, check out some of the escape maps and see if they want to play. If not, check out some escape maps anyway, pay attention to your phone, but dont expect it to spell out all the information you need, your gonna need to figure things out on your own. 4. After logging some time in the game, now you are ready to try your skills at extraction. Try to find and save the survivors, but be warned, it gets intense. Just remember to wait for other players before entering the extraction points, as you will need their help when the hoards start to arrive. Not to mention if you go running straight into the houses without waiting for the others, it kinda ruins the game for everyone.5. Have nothing to note on the panic game modes since it's pvp and I've never found a server playing them, looks like it might be fun though. Check this game out!! Happy gaming everyone!

number of helpful: 13 of 24 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
												This is one of the best zombie shooter games available.  The graphics are great, the weapon selection is good and the survival gameplay is major in this game.  This also has to be one of the most realistic zombie shooters too.  You have to search for weapons, ammo and supplies.  Sometimes you'll have to look for bolt cutters to cut a chain off a fence or a keycard to open a locked door.  Just like in real life you have to conserve your ammo and learn to share with fellow players.  If you grab all of the ammo they won't have any.  The game makes it easy to share unneeded ammo with fellow players.  To survive you have to work together.  The maps are large and it's easy to loose teammates if you don't stick together.  Unlike Left4Dead you don't have indicatators to help find other players.  I highly recommend using a mic so you can talk to other players.  When under attack you won't have time to type.  This game can be played single player or multiplayer.  But if you play single player don't expect casual gameplay.  Even on easy, this game isn't that easy.  Don't let any of this keep you from getting this game.  If you want a zombie shooter that has great survial gameplay and is well made, this is it!  (Hint: make your headshots count.)ProsA very well made zombie shooter!GraphicsRealisticGood sized mapsEncourages teamworkSome paths in the level randomize with each playthrough.  If you play the same map again the next time you may have to find a different door or take an alternate path to complete the campaign.The developers are always improving and adding to the game.  Sometimes they release a seasonal update to reflect Halloween or Christmas.ConsHosting multiplayer - you have to do it the "hard way".  It's not as simple as clicking multiplayer and inviting friends.  You have to do port forwarding.  If you're joining a game you can do it the easy way, just join or have the game to throw you in a random lobby.Zombies glitch a little when around obstacles.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												Have you ever wanted to play a serious hardcore survival horror game online with your friends? Well, you've found Contagion.Contagion is a survival horror game with zombie virus as theme, and has online multiplayer support, both co-op against the AI and playing against human zombies. Different modes for different gameplays. You can escape a building full of infected zombies and scarce resource, cross a city looking for a safe place, escort civilians out of a small town or even go crazy and play with your friends as humans and zombies. If you are looking for multiple gameplays, I'm happy to tell you the items and the scenario changes, forcing you to handle different threats and unexpected situations. The game really has this aura that brings you into the survival mood. It makes you want to save ammo, to stick together with your friends, to work as a team.I recommend Contagion. It has a lot the features and the atmosphere of a survival horror, and brings the best of your solo or co-op play. Its only downside is the need of more maps. Most particularly for the "Escape" game mode.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												This game just simply isn't remarkable.  There is nothing you haven't seen and some of the standard elements you might find in a game like this are missing.1.  There are only about 8 character models - one for each character you can choose from and one infected version of these characters.  These are recylced over and over making for a stale, non-emersive experience.2.  The models are all low res and don't have the visceral feel of something like Dead Island or Dead Rising.  Not a lot of blood.  No dangling body parts.  Sorta like the bad painted face zombies of the early 1980s.3.  The mechanics are a little clunky.  I don'y know how you can take the source engine and make it less elegant but they managed it.4.  Resources are limited and this is good and bad.  I did feel the need to scrounge and save resources but this was partially due to the fact that standard things you might expect are not in the game.   Example - see all that food in the cafeteria?  You might want to eat it to gain some health or at least some stamina buff.  Nope.  Non-interactable.  There is literally no way to heal yourself - that I found - in the game.  Perhaps there is a particular character that is a medic, which would increase team play, but that is not made clear to you in the character selection if so.  I found no method of healing in the game itself - no food, med packs, etc.5.  The environment is bland and interaction options limited making for a non-emersive experience.  Kill a cop zmobie?  no ammo or gun on him.  See that knife sticking out of the dead zombie's head?  Yeah you can't use that.  Unlike most half-life/source mods, you can't even pickup and throw any objects in the room.6.  Stamina system is fine but is pretty unimaginative.  It's a standard mechanic in a lot of survival games now and it makes sense.  But then you have other standard survival horror mechanics missing.  Example - your flashlights have unlimited batteries.7.  Probably the most disappointing part of this game is melee combat.  You have a regular attack and a charge attack.  While you reel from being hit, the zmobies do not.  Even wielding a large sledge hammer, your melee range is about the length of a small toothpick.   The sneak attack thing is highly buggy and this is exasperated by a really underdeveloped stealth system.  If the dev. wanted this to be a part of the game play, the execution needs to be on par with something like State of Decay, Skyrim, or Dishonored.  No stealth or awareness indicator.  The stealth attack can only be executed when you are directly behind the zombie and this often still doesn't work due to environment clipping issues.Final analysis - pass on this.  I gave it a try on the free weekened and glad I didn't spend a dime on it.  With so many other titles in the zombie genre that are quite solid (although I am still waiting for that perfect zombie game), this one is rather forgetable.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2014
												There are so many interesting concepts to Contaigon that it's hard to imagine how they made the game so un-enjoyable to play. From the shakey graphics, to the horrible weapon control, and most unforgivably: the lack of any direction to the gamemodes, make this a chore.The only enjoyment I had was on the missions where you have to rescue survivors. In that game mode, the game actually tells you where to go (rather than dropping you in a poorly designed, random, confusing maze) - and there is a nice element of survival boarding up windows and such. But there's only 2 maps for this mode, and the AI you have to save are dumb as a brick.Worth a punt in a sale, but certainly doesn't justify the £15 price tag.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I'd just like to toss in my two cents, and a hearty concurrence to the review by CunningFox. First of all, the biggest death to this game from my seasoned experience of survival gaming, is definitely the mobility. If you want to make your characters move slow for the sake of difficulty, then you need to base the entire game's format, map layouts, and zombie AI around that. Not have slow straight walking-across-open-spaces, zombies, massive spanning maps with terrible layouts, and little nooks and cranny's that are your actual necessary route, but hidden in a dark corner alleyway. You could pretty easily just melee your way through the entire map with the difficulty of the zombie pathing and behavior, so it's not like making the objectives and map routes hard to find is interesting or difficult, it's just extremely tedious. And then once you learn the route through the maps, the game becomes incredibly simple. It's just a lottery of whether humans become zombies from source external of the actual zombies attacking you; Such as joining late, or willfully being suicidal/EXTREMELY BAD AT GAMES. I mean, the first time me and my friends played escape on that city level, we actually wandered around virtually ignoring the zombies for a good 40 minutes, because the maps are just so circular fenced off in stupid places, with little hidden pathways to circumvent the randomly locked and unlocked doors. This is also so far away from realism and immersion that it becomes implausible to consider scaring or thrilling the player, and yet the genre is horror survival. Rofl. Fence gates you can't climb over, zombies that are about as threatening as counterstrike bots who aren't allowed to have guns, and the mappers in all their aesthetic glory, can't actually map at all. There's no culling, there's invisible walls everywhere because they can't design well, and random piles of debree that look like a nice one way ramp, are actually walls to prevent any access (To the other side, which is also part of the map, but you'll have to walk a big circlejerk circle around the map to get there) I can understand having restricted pathways to get to certain areas in order to make a linear pathway to a final objective, but this is definitely not how you do it. And again about the culling, that is some really terrible mapping. I go from 200fps looking in the direction of the outwards edge of the map, to 30 looking inwards. This is ♥♥♥♥ing source engine, you can take literally 3minutes to learn how to occlusively cull geometry and props, on youtube. Look up 3kliksphilip. This was a terribly impulse purchase in hopes of reigniting the days I loved on L4D in a new experience. Such good prospect, such a broken game. I was praying it was in beta or alpha stages when I closed the game and came back to the store page, because I didn't really look at anything when it was 5$Edit: Also and checking more reviews, I just had a giggle that there's two people who downvote every single negative review, for hundreds of reviews so far.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
												I would totally recommend this game if you have at least one buddy to play with on headset. The community is just fine, but the fun ramps up with a friend. If you dont have anyone you know to play with, I think it's a waste of 20 bucks personally. Maps are fun, but the game feels more like a sim more than an actual game. Needs unlockables, maybe new weapon loadouts, perhaps a character leveling system that makes people better at using specific weapons/items - or a medic class. Also...Hunt mode needs a feature where player zombies can always "smell" or sense where the human players are. Otherwise it just devolves into a guy playing hide and seek for 10 minutes while everyone else shuffles around in the street. I recommend it but wait till it comes on sale again and pick it up. Deffinitly not for $20.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												A very interesting game here is the the real reveiw of the game also somthing to keep in mind though.There are two main types of zombie games. Fast pace Hack N Slash Gore Filled Blockbusters or Mild pace realistic scavange / pvz (Player Vs Human Zed) open world shooters.Most of the people that are down rating the game prefer the big blockbuster titles such as Dead Island or Killing Floor they are into gore skill trees or rpg styled zombie games.This game is the second genre I spoke of. Very fun to play with freinds mild pace scavange / objective style game play with random generated maps. If you cant find ammo your pretty much dead using mele wepons is somthing you should avoid everytime you get hit by an infected there is a chance you will be bitten and die only to return as a zombie and then hunt your freinds. A neat feature you have as a zed is you can see human foot prints and roar to have a squad of 15 zombies rally to you and fight for you. Now we move on to the Guns let me tell you about guns in this game. They did a very good job on the wepons in this game the look good and fire like the real deal there is also no stupid aim assist or anything of the sorts I also forgot to warn you of your flash light the zeds can see it and tred lightly they hear you also and will find and eat you.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												It's not worth it at least for me so this is my opinion. I love zombi games so thats why i bought this. i expected waaay more than the atual content. I like to play lone wolf and solo the maps however you can only play like 4 maps (the city,biolab,police station, park) these maps are soloable but for me i only like the lab+police station other maps are not well designed or confusing for me (like the city). There are more maps like when you spawn in a house and need to wait/survive untill the rescue it's still soloable BUT i hate that map, you need to survive like 20 minutes or more cant remember bassicly the only thing you do is running around and around the house try dodge/kill zeds and thats all..boring. the game need MORE map which able to solo in low difficulty and requires team play in higher diff. I suggest you to save your money and play No more room in hell. its free and its better.Positive:+ zombies..a lots of zombies+ nice game modes to play (however you can only play 1 of them if you have no friends whos have the game or dont want to play with strangers)+ not bad grapcs tho but not the best (is this positive?)+ guns are cool, i like their iron sight and sounds+ large maps, first try they took 40-45 mins to beat themNegatives:- little buggy , zeds clip throug doors and can kill them easly- some maps are confusing- lack of soloable content- could have more weapons- few maps (balanced with game modes...)- few player base- maps are too dark (i know there is a flashlight but cmon you can barely see with flaslight set on)tldr;only buy(in sale) if your friend have(will have it too) so you can enjoy the game for some hours.it has replayability still i would stick to No more room in hell instead of this.i will keep testing the game and open to change my review, i really want so pls devs do your magic.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												this game is amazing. this can be coop or pvp game, you choose. play as one of the survivors... until you are bitten. then try to hide symptoms or admit your mates and let em shorten you sufferings. either way, you'll return as undead and try to hunt em, alone or with horde you build-up along the way. play against other survivors, play against zombies, team up, betray, or play solo, save other survivors, barricade the house, wait for help, take others to safe place, use your phone as gps to locate others, to communicate with survivors... lots of modes, lots of maps, lots of paths to choose. atmosphere is amazingly good, tense all the time, scary and nostalgic in a way only zombie apocalypse can make you feel.i see this as advanced, in a way, version of l4d game, it is not so well done as valve's game, but gameplay and modes are more interesting, more stuff to do, more survival aspect in it. although they all are different and unique games, i could put left 4 dead, no more room in hell, and contagion, in same coop zombie fps genre, and everyone who enjoyed any of these games should play the other two too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												I find myself playing this game on and off for some reason. It's a fun zombie FPS, but it is still missing something in the gameplay. This game is based off of the free Half-Life 2 mod "Zombie Panic! Source", so it has the Half-Life game mechanics and feel to it. I really enjoy the PvP "Hunted" game mode in Contagion. It's very fast-paced and very intense! It is fairly difficult to play solo though, so teaming up with some friends is a good idea. There are also a good variety of weapons in the game, ranging from melee weapons to guns.To make this short, the game is really fun and has lots of potential to grow. It's defiantly a different type of a zombie survival game for sure. There are some things that could be tweaked/changed, but it's not that big of a deal. This game deserves a 8/10 from me!

												An alright way to spend your time.  I don't know if it should really be worth $20, but it is a nice game.  Gameplay:  about like any other first-person-zombie-survival-shooter, so, check.  Graphics:  okay, check.  Sound: at times terrifying and at other times just down right annoying, check.  There are not may different game modes, but that's alright, things will always be changed up so you won't play a map the exact same way after just completing it.  I enjoyed the Co-op mode, but hated the PvP mode (only because I never got a chance, sniper from four or five buildings down the street or a player zombie just infected me while I was looking for some ammunition).(In other words: I suck.)It's an alright game, I enjoyed it.  I wouldn't say it's $20 alright, but if you could get it on sale, I would say go for it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I'd just like to toss in my two cents, and a hearty concurrence to the review by CunningFox. First of all, the biggest death to this game from my seasoned experience of survival gaming, is definitely the mobility. If you want to make your characters move slow for the sake of difficulty, then you need to base the entire game's format, map layouts, and zombie AI around that. Not have slow straight walking-across-open-spaces, zombies, massive spanning maps with terrible layouts, and little nooks and cranny's that are your actual necessary route, but hidden in a dark corner alleyway. You could pretty easily just melee your way through the entire map with the difficulty of the zombie pathing and behavior, so it's not like making the objectives and map routes hard to find is interesting or difficult, it's just extremely tedious. And then once you learn the route through the maps, the game becomes incredibly simple. It's just a lottery of whether humans become zombies from source external of the actual zombies attacking you; Such as joining late, or willfully being suicidal/EXTREMELY BAD AT GAMES. I mean, the first time me and my friends played escape on that city level, we actually wandered around virtually ignoring the zombies for a good 40 minutes, because the maps are just so circular fenced off in stupid places, with little hidden pathways to circumvent the randomly locked and unlocked doors. This is also so far away from realism and immersion that it becomes implausible to consider scaring or thrilling the player, and yet the genre is horror survival. Rofl. Fence gates you can't climb over, zombies that are about as threatening as counterstrike bots who aren't allowed to have guns, and the mappers in all their aesthetic glory, can't actually map at all. There's no culling, there's invisible walls everywhere because they can't design well, and random piles of debree that look like a nice one way ramp, are actually walls to prevent any access (To the other side, which is also part of the map, but you'll have to walk a big circlejerk circle around the map to get there) I can understand having restricted pathways to get to certain areas in order to make a linear pathway to a final objective, but this is definitely not how you do it. And again about the culling, that is some really terrible mapping. I go from 200fps looking in the direction of the outwards edge of the map, to 30 looking inwards. This is ♥♥♥♥ing source engine, you can take literally 3minutes to learn how to occlusively cull geometry and props, on youtube. Look up 3kliksphilip. This was a terribly impulse purchase in hopes of reigniting the days I loved on L4D in a new experience. Such good prospect, such a broken game. I was praying it was in beta or alpha stages when I closed the game and came back to the store page, because I didn't really look at anything when it was 5$Edit: Also and checking more reviews, I just had a giggle that there's two people who downvote every single negative review, for hundreds of reviews so far.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												It's not worth it at least for me so this is my opinion. I love zombi games so thats why i bought this. i expected waaay more than the atual content. I like to play lone wolf and solo the maps however you can only play like 4 maps (the city,biolab,police station, park) these maps are soloable but for me i only like the lab+police station other maps are not well designed or confusing for me (like the city). There are more maps like when you spawn in a house and need to wait/survive untill the rescue it's still soloable BUT i hate that map, you need to survive like 20 minutes or more cant remember bassicly the only thing you do is running around and around the house try dodge/kill zeds and thats all..boring. the game need MORE map which able to solo in low difficulty and requires team play in higher diff. I suggest you to save your money and play No more room in hell. its free and its better.Positive:+ zombies..a lots of zombies+ nice game modes to play (however you can only play 1 of them if you have no friends whos have the game or dont want to play with strangers)+ not bad grapcs tho but not the best (is this positive?)+ guns are cool, i like their iron sight and sounds+ large maps, first try they took 40-45 mins to beat themNegatives:- little buggy , zeds clip throug doors and can kill them easly- some maps are confusing- lack of soloable content- could have more weapons- few maps (balanced with game modes...)- few player base- maps are too dark (i know there is a flashlight but cmon you can barely see with flaslight set on)tldr;only buy(in sale) if your friend have(will have it too) so you can enjoy the game for some hours.it has replayability still i would stick to No more room in hell instead of this.i will keep testing the game and open to change my review, i really want so pls devs do your magic.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												This game is simply one of the best "zombie apocalypse" multiplayer I've ever had.It mixes a litlte bit of realism with a little bit of fast paced gameplay. The game contains good puzzles in the escape maps, and it requires a good level of cooperation on the extraction maps.Ammo isn't avaliable anywhere, so make any of your shots count, and don't forget to share it with your comrades. This has made this game pretty neat.But hey, now there is the PVP mode. One thing that annoyed me in the past zombie games/mods, was the PVP. One team of humans vs zombies. Just that. Humans could get to high places and spam M4A1 shots on them, making it impossible for zombies to reach, but in Contagion, this is different. The PVP mode is a mix of FFA with a VS and King of the Hill Mode. You have to kill the other players in order to survive, and be advised, all the players begin as humans. Killed some of them? Nice! But watch out, because they will come back from hell as reanimated corpses and hunt you down, and this is one of the best parts on this game: Humans. Are. Not. O.P against the zombies. This little fact over here made this game one of the best Multiplayer experiences I had on 2013, and it will be one of the best of 2014.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												A very interesting game here is the the real reveiw of the game also somthing to keep in mind though.There are two main types of zombie games. Fast pace Hack N Slash Gore Filled Blockbusters or Mild pace realistic scavange / pvz (Player Vs Human Zed) open world shooters.Most of the people that are down rating the game prefer the big blockbuster titles such as Dead Island or Killing Floor they are into gore skill trees or rpg styled zombie games.This game is the second genre I spoke of. Very fun to play with freinds mild pace scavange / objective style game play with random generated maps. If you cant find ammo your pretty much dead using mele wepons is somthing you should avoid everytime you get hit by an infected there is a chance you will be bitten and die only to return as a zombie and then hunt your freinds. A neat feature you have as a zed is you can see human foot prints and roar to have a squad of 15 zombies rally to you and fight for you. Now we move on to the Guns let me tell you about guns in this game. They did a very good job on the wepons in this game the look good and fire like the real deal there is also no stupid aim assist or anything of the sorts I also forgot to warn you of your flash light the zeds can see it and tred lightly they hear you also and will find and eat you.

content:
Posted: August 2, 2014
												An alright way to spend your time.  I don't know if it should really be worth $20, but it is a nice game.  Gameplay:  about like any other first-person-zombie-survival-shooter, so, check.  Graphics:  okay, check.  Sound: at times terrifying and at other times just down right annoying, check.  There are not may different game modes, but that's alright, things will always be changed up so you won't play a map the exact same way after just completing it.  I enjoyed the Co-op mode, but hated the PvP mode (only because I never got a chance, sniper from four or five buildings down the street or a player zombie just infected me while I was looking for some ammunition).(In other words: I suck.)It's an alright game, I enjoyed it.  I wouldn't say it's $20 alright, but if you could get it on sale, I would say go for it!

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Adventures in Contagion.1. Threw away useless key after needing space for a gun. Later spent 10 minutes had me and my bro-op partner backtracking trying to find the room where the key was, next 5 minutes trying get them out from under a bed.2. Zombie breaks down a door and smacks me in the face, promptly had to go replace pants.3. Me and bro-op partner doing well. Out comes a zombie in riot gear, Broson gets eaten by a zombie, I'm left bleeding with 1 bullet, promptly eaten by Broson.10/10 would get eaten by a zombified Broson again.---Extremely well done for a source engine game, needs some polish but its the first zombie game to fill the void left by BrainBread I've ever found. A bit buggy but worth it on sale for coop.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												The price point is too high, but this game does a great job of recreating the tense, twitchy situations of Zombie Panic. The atmosphere and sound is good at setting the dark tone, and the combat takes a more realistic approach, requiring precise aim and manual reloading. Playing a survivor is fun: scavenging for weapons, barricading a house, avoiding the undead and taking a few of them out silently, then sneaking up on a fellow survivor and executing them for their sniper rifle and vantage point is satisfying. Playing as a zombie is frustrating, but it is about as good as it can be. Player zombies have slightly better manueverability and the ability control the horde.There are three main modes: extraction, escape, and hunted. Hunted is the true gem. It is a PvP game mode where everyone starts off in a random spot with a few supplies, and the only rule is to be the last one left alive. I always try to forge an uneasy alliance with whoever is around me early on, each of us knowing that if things go our way then eventually one of us has to die. Large gunfights attract zombies, and any players who die become a fresh walker ready to head straight back for the camping point they just died at. It can get very tense, especially while hiding in a closet with a revolver pointed at the door while gunshots, broken windows and screams echo around you.Extraction is a co-op mode has you going from house to house and searching for survivors, then fending off waves of zombies as you lead them to safety. It's fun and challenging because each person is limited in what they can carry and do. If a person is barricading they cannot shoot, and it is useless to have a sniper and shotgun at the same time. The AI survivors however, are useless and will die without protection, even with a gun. The maps also last way too long, and most people will not make it to the end. Escape is an objective based co-op mode that isn't really all that enjoyable. As you work your way through various obstacles and puzzles, anyone who dies becomes a zombie. In the beginning it is too easy as there are only a few zombies to deal with. The difficulty either stays that way because everyone works together, or it falls apart because too many people die and overwhelm the survivors. The puzzles are okay but using a smart phone to check objectives and locations of keys isn't really that fun.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												The price point is too high, but this game does a great job of recreating the tense, twitchy situations of Zombie Panic. The atmosphere and sound is good at setting the dark tone, and the combat takes a more realistic approach, requiring precise aim and manual reloading. Playing a survivor is fun: scavenging for weapons, barricading a house, avoiding the undead and taking a few of them out silently, then sneaking up on a fellow survivor and executing them for their sniper rifle and vantage point is satisfying. Playing as a zombie is frustrating, but it is about as good as it can be. Player zombies have slightly better manueverability and the ability control the horde.There are three main modes: extraction, escape, and hunted. Hunted is the true gem. It is a PvP game mode where everyone starts off in a random spot with a few supplies, and the only rule is to be the last one left alive. I always try to forge an uneasy alliance with whoever is around me early on, each of us knowing that if things go our way then eventually one of us has to die. Large gunfights attract zombies, and any players who die become a fresh walker ready to head straight back for the camping point they just died at. It can get very tense, especially while hiding in a closet with a revolver pointed at the door while gunshots, broken windows and screams echo around you.Extraction is a co-op mode has you going from house to house and searching for survivors, then fending off waves of zombies as you lead them to safety. It's fun and challenging because each person is limited in what they can carry and do. If a person is barricading they cannot shoot, and it is useless to have a sniper and shotgun at the same time. The AI survivors however, are useless and will die without protection, even with a gun. The maps also last way too long, and most people will not make it to the end. Escape is an objective based co-op mode that isn't really all that enjoyable. As you work your way through various obstacles and puzzles, anyone who dies becomes a zombie. In the beginning it is too easy as there are only a few zombies to deal with. The difficulty either stays that way because everyone works together, or it falls apart because too many people die and overwhelm the survivors. The puzzles are okay but using a smart phone to check objectives and locations of keys isn't really that fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Okay, where do i begin?This is an early access game.That much is for sure but don't let that deceive you into thinking this game isn't good.It has so much potential and with that in mind, play it without thinking of the other games that have come before it (Left 4 Dead 1-2, Killing Floor, etc.) so that you'll experience it as the devs intended. I like how they decided to make ammunition scarce, making the experience almost like real life. You are not likely to find a gun and a ton of ammo next to it behind a desk in real life. Well unless you're in a gun shop but i digress..The stamina meter system forces players to pace themselves in order to survive as you would in a zombie apocalypse scenario.Lastly, this game was meant to be played in Co-op. Playing it alone to practice is utterly boring, it would be better to play it with friends and gradually learn how to survive rather than do it on your own.For an early access game it is really really good. I enjoyed playing, surviving, dying and shooting in the game and i'd play it again as soon as my friends are free to do so as well.Solid 8/10 material. Would be 10/10 probably when the game is fully developed. I am excited to see what else they can put in the game.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Update:So is this game still recommended? Yes, but barely. Keep your expectations low as Contagion rarely receives updates (if any) now. I would recommend buying ‘Contagion’ on a sale or getting it through a trade.  Much of the hype for Contagion has died and fans (players) of the game (like myself) have moved on to better games– so finding players may be a bit of a challenge. This is partially due to the slow release of the DLC “Flatline” and the lack of contents in the finished product. Some improvements the devs should make is an option for PvE (or an option to respawn) in game modes like “Extraction” and “Escape”. ––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––An early access review:Superb! Faith restored in indie game devs!This is one of the very few early access games that is worth getting; even at the full price of $14.99. Contagion is very stable and playable even at its early build. I've encountered minimal (to no) problems/errors or bugs so far. The developers are incredibly friendly, responsive and helpful. They take constructive criticisms positively and strive to improve the game. I can't wait for the final release.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2013
												Just wow. Even if this game is still in development this game is really well made so far. It has the right idea for a multiplayer zombie survival horror game. There are some really good mechanics such as: infecting humans as a zombie, roaring to attract nearby zombies to create your own horde as a zombie, awesome instant sneak kills from a melee weapon as a human survivor, and a lot more I do not care to mention. All I am saying is that even though this game is still early access it is very well made. Though it does need a lot more content and more weapons and more types of zombies, but right now this game is very addicting and is worth your time. This game is also challenging when you have to face zombie hordes AND survivors! Anyone can enjoy this game and appreciate the attention to detail. 7.6/10

content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Admit it, thanks to DayZ, we are simply overflowed with zombie games.Unfortunately most of them are monotone and feels like they're all the same.Contagion is nothing like that. It's the good ol' Resident Evil in first person, created with the jolly good Source Engine.The atmosphere gets tense slowly and the whole setting makes you feel that this growling you've just heard a minute ago somehow got louder, which means you're gonna cover your rear a lot.There are many useful features like unloading weapons and taking mags from the same weapon types.Although the game is still swimming in bugs and not that many maps, the potential gets bigger and bigger.I want this game to become an Indie Game of 2014 year, do you understand, Mr. Monochrome LLC?

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Well i have put in 4 hours into Contagion so far and mostly played Hunter mode. So far im loving this game! definitly worth the 10 bucks i spent. A lot of reviews seem to say bad visuals, bad maps, no point to it... i highly disagree. For a short summary, Hunter Mode is so much fun. its a couple humans scrounging for weapons and ammo, while having the ability to barricade windows and doors a bit from zombies. Its PvP during the hunt for ammo and guns and also to avoid the odd zombie or horde of zombies that come your way if you stay still. You can only kill a zombie with a headshot or a melee weapon to the head and shooting will also give away your position, as does your flashlight! Oh and you carry around an Android Smartphone and you need to pop it up often to see when enimies are nearby (also vibrates when close) and what your objectives are.I have seen one glitch so far in Extraction mode where the AI human got glitched in a bush and we couldnt complete the match.But overall from 4 hours of continual play, i highly enjoy this game and its a blast if you have a couple of buddies or not to play with!8/10Pros: Good Visuals (id compare to L4D2 for visuals) teamworkexplorationintenseCons:The odd glitch. not a lot of maps (enough to be satisfied with)some servers are laggy (as are all games)

												Buggy but fun. This game has a lot of potential to be a nifty zombie survial game but as it stand there are bugs galore. That being said, so far when I've played this game with a friend it's been a blast. The hunt is my favorite map type so far. The game is still in beta though so I'm hoping most if not all this is fixed.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Contagion is a standalone zombie survival/campeign/PvP/cooperative game run on the Source Engine. Created by the developers of Zombie Panic: Source, aswell as being inspired by it, the game really stands out apon high quality graphics, gore level L4D2, and it's confusing, long lasting objective campeigns.Zombie Panic: SourceZP:S was my favorite mod for some time. I loved the ambient environment the developers gave to the maps. I enjoyed the concept of NEVER waiting after death, and you get to return as a zombie to infect the unsuspecting, almost helpless humans. The objectives it gave to the map were not confusing like in Contagion.Objective based gameplayThe "Escape" gamemode is rather confusing and really long, I do like long objective based campeigns, but I find it repetitive when the campeigns get you lost all the time. The maps are randomised, so they are incredibly confusing. I, aswell as many other people have been lost countless times looking for a button to open a door.Gore, & GraphicsThe gore and graphics are astounding. It's what peaks my eye, it looks fascinating for the Source Engine. This and, 'No More Room in Hell' (another Source mod) are the top 2 for graphically awesome Source games/mods I've ever seen. (This one is number 1).Contagion still seems incomplete in only some areas, which may be fixed by frequent game updates. If there's anything I can recommend for the game, I recommend adding some maps from Zombie Panic: Source, remastering and implementing them in the game, I think that would be an awesome expirience for the people that have played the mod in the past.98.6/100

I enjoyed the concept of NEVER waiting after death, and you get to return as a zombie to infect the unsuspecting, almost helpless humans. The objectives it gave to the map were not confusing like in Contagion.Objective based gameplayThe "Escape" gamemode is rather confusing and really long, I do like long objective based campeigns, but I find it repetitive when the campeigns get you lost all the time. The maps are randomised, so they are incredibly confusing. I, aswell as many other people have been lost countless times looking for a button to open a door.Gore, & GraphicsThe gore and graphics are astounding. It's what peaks my eye, it looks fascinating for the Source Engine. This and, 'No More Room in Hell' (another Source mod) are the top 2 for graphically awesome Source games/mods I've ever seen. (This one is number 1).Contagion still seems incomplete in only some areas, which may be fixed by frequent game updates. If there's anything I can recommend for the game, I recommend adding some maps from Zombie Panic: Source, remastering and implementing them in the game, I think that would be an awesome expirience for the people that have played the mod in the past.98.6/100

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												**Playing Random Multiplayer Match**Journal Entry 1 I've dropped into the street of an urban area, no idea where the hell I am or what im doing. Apparently im playing the role of a police officer who due to his talents and training has survived the undead takeover. I have a pistol and a flashlight and im feeling pretty good about how quiet these streets look. The houses are nice but show signs of being boarded up and busted in, whatever happened here... it happened fast! Journal Entry 2 This is like an episode of Leave it to beaver... but there isn't any happy singing folks jumping around. I creep quietly along a white picket fence and take cover behind a white car. I can see someone up on the road walking really slowly.. Ok it looks like another player maybe? I turn off my light slowly creep up behind him, the closer I get the more odd the players behavior becomes. I get right up behind him and then he turns... well ... that's not a player at all, before me lies the bloodied face and nattering jaws of really nasty looking undead monster. Journal Entry 3 I whip on my light and take a steady aim down the barrel.... The creature gives out a shriek and starts running at me, I take very careful calm aim and fire. A perfect headshot, I can see the exit wound clearly pop open from the back of his head like a straw going through the pre-cut slits in a slurpee lid. He instantly goes silent and falls to the ground with a thud, now I hear more noises and more shrieks from all around me. It appears we woke up the rest of his friends.... Journal Entry 4 The undead are now locked in on my position and waves of them from dirty back alleys and busted up backyard fences moan and scream as they come towards me. I begin picking off the closest targets that I can get, headshoting to the best of my ability. I kill probably a dozen but they keep coming, wave after wave. I'm running low on ammo now, I've only got 5 rounds left and there are about 10 zombies close enough to deserve the bullets. I've stupidly backed myself into a fenced yard with no escape route. The only way out is in the direction that the zombies are coming in... crap this is bad... well its been a good run... I take very careful aim and shoot the next 5 zombies with perfect headshots, behind them comes a hoard of about 7 more. I don't think I will be able to charge through them, I accept my defeat and wait for them to get me.... Journal Entry 5 All the sudden I hear gunfire... wtf.... I see flashlights bouncing off the cracks in the fence and footsteps running. I hear machine gun fire and pistols going off everywhere. A group of 3 other players rush in and save the day, a feeling of relief and awesomeness washes over me as they pick off the 7 zombies that were about to make dinner out of me. I join up with the group and follow them onward into the street. Journal Entry 6 The hoards are getting worse and worse as we progress up the blocks of this pleasant valley neighborhood, Another player states that we need to go hold up somewhere until the waves calm down a bit. We find a reasonably well boarded up house and decide to take it over, we move in clearing room by room. I now have ammo again and am able to help out with the room clearing. Suddenly the waves of zombies decide to start charging the house, the doors are shut and the windows boarded.... it is here that we make our stand, we load up our guns and take our positions.... the screams of zombies makes it sound like thousands of them are outside... we begin to hear the doors getting kicked and smashed.... they are coming through... lets do this! 9/10

content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												I think I got this game for $4.99 or something, on sale, and it was worth every penny! At first the game was really laggy for me, but then I changed the video settings to "very high" and the game looked awesome and worked fine! It lags a bit from time to time but it does not hinder my performance. Lots of people play this game and most are friendly players, some people do not work well as a team... but that is the way with any cooperative gameplay and especially in a zombie game.   A lot of people compare this with Left 4 Dead and a lot say otherwise, truth is Valve was also Left 4 Dead so... YES, in many aspects this game is much like Left 4 Dead. I like the levels, they are pretty big and lots of places to search, hide, snipe, etc. I enjoy most game types for this game... my biggest issue with the game overall is, being a zombie... it SUCKS! Sometimes I am spawned really far away, or in a deadend, or my scent trail runs cold and I can't track the survivors. But it has made me get better at surviving because I don't want to be a dang zombie.   There are no "special" zombies either which I like, the only thing close to that in this game is the riot police zombie which is slow, dumb, and easy to dodge. I never liked a lot of "special infected" like the smoker from L4D is so unreal, or just about any special zombie in Resident Evil. There is a good selection of weapons to weild and I like that you need to find special tools for special tasks. Like you need to find a nail gun then you need to find a wood to board up windows and doorways. Or some doors are locked and you need to find a key, or bolt cutters to clip the chain on doors... pretty frustrating at times though, not finding what you need with a hoard on your tail.   I would recommend this game, I have had a lot of fun with it already.Rating  7.5/10+Zombies!+Level design+Weapons & tools-Being a zombie... :{}

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												The very popular sequel to Infection, Infection 2: Disease, Infection 3: Spreading Viruses, Infection 4: Transmition Proliferation Dissemination Simulator 2012.The main story revolves around the Contaigions that were caused by infectious agents such as viruses, viroids, and prions, microorganisms such as bacteria, nematodes such as roundworms and pinworms, arthropods such as ticks, mites, fleas, and lice, fungi such as ringworm, and other macroparasites such as tapeworms. You personally are responsible to attempt to counter the current contaigion in the areas by all of the equipment that you have.There's also a minor sub plot involving zombies, who are fictional undead creatures regularly encountered in horror and fantasy themed works. They are typically depicted as mindless, reanimated corpses with a hunger for human flesh, and particularly for human brains in some depictions. Although they share their name and some superficial similarities with the zombie from Haitian Vodun, their links to such folklore are unclear.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												Buggy but fun. This game has a lot of potential to be a nifty zombie survial game but as it stand there are bugs galore. Zombies get stuck on things and freak out, some will come for you even though you haven't moved or made a sound they just magically see you. The most frustrating thing is the PvP aspect, the shots do not land where you shoot (I shot like 2 feet off of target and got a kill), the sniper rifle is atrocious, the sound is extremely lacking. It's near impossible to tell what or who's footsteps you're hearing or something may just run up to you and not make any sound. That being said, so far when I've played this game with a friend it's been a blast. The hunt is my favorite map type so far. The game is still in beta though so I'm hoping most if not all this is fixed.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												So, Contagion.I'm not a fan of twitch shooter's or zombie games, so when I recieved a copy of this game from one of my friends in an after christmas gift giving spree we all took part in... i was less than exicted.While I am flat out terrible at the game, I will say that it is extremely enjoyable. The major reason? It perfectly captures the atmosphere of a Zombie Survival.What I mean is, until you finally succumb to your wounds and the infection takes over, you will try your damndest to survive and help your other survivors, excepting the Hunt PvP game mode. When the infection takes over however, it becomes immensely satisfying to hunt down your friends and bury them beneath a horde of undead. The game really ramps up as soon as a survivor dies, as now one zombie that looks like any other, has human intelligence and wants everyone dead like them.So yeah, I like it, and fans of Schadenfreude should too.
