content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Update:So is this game still recommended? Yes, but barely. Keep your expectations low as Contagion rarely receives updates (if any) now. I would recommend buying ‘Contagion’ on a sale or getting it through a trade.  Much of the hype for Contagion has died and fans (players) of the game (like myself) have moved on to better games– so finding players may be a bit of a challenge. This is partially due to the slow release of the DLC “Flatline” and the lack of contents in the finished product. Some improvements the devs should make is an option for PvE (or an option to respawn) in game modes like “Extraction” and “Escape”. ––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––An early access review:Superb! Faith restored in indie game devs!This is one of the very few early access games that is worth getting; even at the full price of $14.99. Contagion is very stable and playable even at its early build. I've encountered minimal (to no) problems/errors or bugs so far. The developers are incredibly friendly, responsive and helpful. They take constructive criticisms positively and strive to improve the game. I can't wait for the final release.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Admit it, thanks to DayZ, we are simply overflowed with zombie games.Unfortunately most of them are monotone and feels like they're all the same.Contagion is nothing like that. It's the good ol' Resident Evil in first person, created with the jolly good Source Engine.The atmosphere gets tense slowly and the whole setting makes you feel that this growling you've just heard a minute ago somehow got louder, which means you're gonna cover your rear a lot.There are many useful features like unloading weapons and taking mags from the same weapon types.Although the game is still swimming in bugs and not that many maps, the potential gets bigger and bigger.I want this game to become an Indie Game of 2014 year, do you understand, Mr. Monochrome LLC?

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Well i have put in 4 hours into Contagion so far and mostly played Hunter mode. So far im loving this game! definitly worth the 10 bucks i spent. A lot of reviews seem to say bad visuals, bad maps, no point to it... i highly disagree. For a short summary, Hunter Mode is so much fun. its a couple humans scrounging for weapons and ammo, while having the ability to barricade windows and doors a bit from zombies. Its PvP during the hunt for ammo and guns and also to avoid the odd zombie or horde of zombies that come your way if you stay still. You can only kill a zombie with a headshot or a melee weapon to the head and shooting will also give away your position, as does your flashlight! Oh and you carry around an Android Smartphone and you need to pop it up often to see when enimies are nearby (also vibrates when close) and what your objectives are.I have seen one glitch so far in Extraction mode where the AI human got glitched in a bush and we couldnt complete the match.But overall from 4 hours of continual play, i highly enjoy this game and its a blast if you have a couple of buddies or not to play with!8/10Pros: Good Visuals (id compare to L4D2 for visuals) teamworkexplorationintenseCons:The odd glitch. not a lot of maps (enough to be satisfied with)some servers are laggy (as are all games)

content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												3.5/5 gameI figured I would give this game a chance since it was up for free for the weekend. Now, I'm a big fan of killing zombies, I rarely get tired of putting a shot or a axe in the skull of a zombie. With this in mind, I like what Contagion is, but there are things about it I'm not too crazy about it. Before I go about posting what I think is great about the game, I will start with the things I'm not too crazy about.1. Forgettable characters - Aside from picking the character you like, that is really about all there is to character selection. There just isn't anything that makes you remember the character beyond it's appearance.2. Lack of a story - Now I know the game isn't a RPG or anything, but a little bit of story would be nice. Matter of fact it would be a nice way for the character's to be rememberable.3. Flashlight needs work - Now the flashlight is very handy and by no means am I saying it's useless. However, why can the flashlight not light up rooms? It just seems to light up a small area and jeebus don't get too close to anything in particular with it. The light at the center can just about block out the view of items. You cannot even light up a room for a fellow survivor whose weapon doesn't allow a flashlight fitting.4. Lack of Zombie variations - Aside from the standard Zombie, player Zombie, and Riot armored zombie. There really isn't anything else of danger around. A Zombie dog would have been a great addition to this game, or even enviromental hazards like falling buildings, out of control cars crashing, or something. A well organized team can easily put down a army of zombies, unless of course they're out of ammo.5. Ammo hoarders - Don't get me wrong, when you need ammo badly, you need it badly. However, there are people that will pick up ammo for every gun BUT the gun they actually have. I cannot tell you how many times I've been down to one bullet and cannot even get a person to throw a magazine or ammo box my way.6. Terrible Iron Sights - Now you don't need to serve a tour of duty in a war to tell some of these weapons have terrible iron sights. I've had times where I've woundered if it was easier to shoot from the hip or just aim down sights. Obviously it's better to aim down the sights, but some weapons just have such terrible iron sights it renders players ineffective at times. However, if you get use to the iron sights, you can easily work your way around their terrible design. Out of all the guns, your best bets are on the Pistols, the shotgun, and the hunting rifle. Pistols are semi-automatic, so you can control your rate of fire with them. Shotgun has bad iron sights, but it makes up for it with a wide shot spread so you just need to aim for the head. Heck you may even take down more than one zombie with a single shell. The Hunting rifle zooms in and it's the sniper rifle, so you don't have to deal with iron sights with it.7. Getting stuck on stuff - This is more of a minor complaint, but there are times that it feels like I get stuck in doorways at times. It looks like I got enough room to enter, but some how I still get stuck.Now for the things I like about the game.1. The Enviroment - It actually feels like a proper zombie apocalypse. Nothing is clean, nothing is overly destroyed. Things feel just right.2. Zombies are true to nature - Short of shooting them in the head, blowing them up with a grenade, or hitting them with a melee weapon. A zombie will keep coming after you. Thank you devs, these are true Zombies!3. Sound effects  - The sound effects in this game are really good in my opinion. Since there is no real map to use, you can listen for the gun shots of your fellow survivors to actually tell you a general idea of what direction they're at. Or as a Zombie you can use it to find where your targets are at (short of using the vision sight for foot prints.) Overall everything sounds good in this game.4. Limited resources - Nothing worse than playing a survival game and finding every little thing you need in the world in no time. Ammo, weapons, and medical kits are so hard to find. You actually have to concern yourself on how you approach the streets, corners, buildings, and rooms.5. Infection - There is a chance when you get hit by a zombie that you actually get infected. If you're infected, there is a limit of time before you start to feel it and eventually turn against your fellow survivors. You won't know you're infected till it's too late. Some people may find this annoying, but I love it. Even if you die as a survivor, the game isn't over for you. Because now you can fight against them as a zombie and lead Hordes of zombies towards them. (Nice way of getting payback on those Ammo hoaders)6. Board up and hold out - Now I know everyone likes base building, but honestly it get's old seeing player made sky forts or whatever. Contagion may not have base building, but boarding up windows is one of the most logical ways of keeping the zombies out. I just wish the boards didn't fall inbetween line of sights. If a Zombie gets close enough to try and break into the building, it's hard to get them off the window boards without shooting the defense itself.7. Plenty of maps and game modes - The game isn't limited to just your typical "Start at A and get to C by moving through B" (Though ti does have a escape mode which is fun still), but you also have a PVP game mode where players start off killing each other, then holding out against zombie palyers in a game of Hide and seek. A objective based game where players locate survivors and take them to be extracted across zombie infested streets or neighborhoods. Also with players seemingly able to make their own playable maps, it's no real concern about there ever really being a feeling of a lack of enviroments to play in.8. Maps change - Nothing better than playing a map that can change from another playthrough. I've had games where doors that were usually unlocked, were actually blocked off. So really you cannot predict what route you must take to get to a objective, you sort of have to learn on the fly.9. Random starting gear - Our survivors may be all different, but the nice thing is that they start out with random gear. You may have just a pistol at first one game, then the next you may have a pistol and a SMG. I just feel this is a nice way to keep things feeling interesting.Overall Contagion isn't a bad game, but it doesn't do too many things great. With some stuff fixed, a few improvements made, and some other little things. The game can honestly stand toe to toe with the Left 4 Dead games. Don't take this as me saying "i want it to be more like Left 4 Dead." I just want to see some more stuff that will pull me into the game more. One more zombie type, fixed weapon iron sights (or at least a visual zoom in), and some other little things would just be perfect for someone like me. While I cannot stand playing the game for hours on end. I can at least say what time I do play, I enjoy greatly.If you see this game on sale and you want a good little Zombie shooter game, I would highly suggest picking this game up. I only paid five bucks and don't regret it.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												Contagion is a zombie game that feels like no other. I've played everything from Left 4 Dead to Day Z, and nothing feels quite as special as Contagion. The felling you get when playing the pvp/pve mode Hunted, for example, is incredible. Suddenly, you truly feel alone and vulnurable, as you would in a life or death survival scenario. The sparcity of weapons and ammo give a realisitic feel, and the infection system keeps you always on edge. Most zombie games are all about fending off huge numbers of zombies with lots of ammo and powerful weapons. Contagion is one of only a few games that truly give the player a sense of anxiety. I cannot reccomend this game enough.

Posted: December 29, 2013
												This game has many rough edges (which is to expect, being an alpha). Hitbox issues, the inventory is horrible, animation quirks, bugs, and a lot of small, but visible problems.That being said, it's a surprisingly nice game, and I am getting more enjoyment out of that I thought I would.It runs the risk of being TOO punishing on its players, though. I would love to have the ability to customize my game further, adding things like the ability to ressurect dead players. It really sucks when you want to just play a co-op session with your friends and one of them dies in the beginning and cannot play with the rest of the game.There isn't a lot of content yet, but it's a very promising game that if you don't get now, you should definetly get upon release.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Update:So is this game still recommended? Yes, but barely. Keep your expectations low as Contagion rarely receives updates (if any) now. I would recommend buying ‘Contagion’ on a sale or getting it through a trade.  Much of the hype for Contagion has died and fans (players) of the game (like myself) have moved on to better games– so finding players may be a bit of a challenge. This is partially due to the slow release of the DLC “Flatline” and the lack of contents in the finished product. Some improvements the devs should make is an option for PvE (or an option to respawn) in game modes like “Extraction” and “Escape”. ––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––An early access review:Superb! Faith restored in indie game devs!This is one of the very few early access games that is worth getting; even at the full price of $14.99. Contagion is very stable and playable even at its early build. I've encountered minimal (to no) problems/errors or bugs so far. The developers are incredibly friendly, responsive and helpful. They take constructive criticisms positively and strive to improve the game. I can't wait for the final release.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												So, Contagion.I'm not a fan of twitch shooter's or zombie games, so when I recieved a copy of this game from one of my friends in an after christmas gift giving spree we all took part in... i was less than exicted.While I am flat out terrible at the game, I will say that it is extremely enjoyable. The major reason? It perfectly captures the atmosphere of a Zombie Survival.What I mean is, until you finally succumb to your wounds and the infection takes over, you will try your damndest to survive and help your other survivors, excepting the Hunt PvP game mode. When the infection takes over however, it becomes immensely satisfying to hunt down your friends and bury them beneath a horde of undead. The game really ramps up as soon as a survivor dies, as now one zombie that looks like any other, has human intelligence and wants everyone dead like them.So yeah, I like it, and fans of Schadenfreude should too.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												The closest you'll get to playing The Walking Dead and better than Left4Dead. Zombies shamble forward, they don't run. They go down by damaging the brain, not other parts of the body. Weapons and ammo are scarce. Maps are dark, zombies can creep up behind you without you knowing. You can get infected and turn. Other humans can be just as dangerous as zombies. No hand-holding objectives, you have to figure out where everything is, just like in real life. Great atmospheric soundtrack.This game is amazing. Definitely get it for the most "realistic" zombie experience.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												I played this game ALOT during the beta - im a big zombie fan, so im pretty bias but....i love it!While i mainly play co-op (escape) mode, i find all game modes very entertaining - fun as a human, hilarious as a zombie.While it does take a little bit of time to learn maps and mechanics, the pay off is worth it. Your either a zombie survival pro...or a particularly clever zombie (it never gets old dodging bullets and biting someones face off!)All in all, if you like FPS's (particularly co-op in my opinion) you will like this game, if your a zombie fan like me - you'll love it!As of summer 2014, the multiplayer community is alive and kicking, and new maps are released now and again.Considering the hours of fun i have got out of this game, its well worth the £15 - and now it has a "panic" mode like the original mod, it just keeps getting better! Buy it...buy it now!! =)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Okay, where do i begin?This is an early access game.That much is for sure but don't let that deceive you into thinking this game isn't good.It has so much potential and with that in mind, play it without thinking of the other games that have come before it (Left 4 Dead 1-2, Killing Floor, etc.) so that you'll experience it as the devs intended. I like how they decided to make ammunition scarce, making the experience almost like real life. You are not likely to find a gun and a ton of ammo next to it behind a desk in real life. Well unless you're in a gun shop but i digress..The stamina meter system forces players to pace themselves in order to survive as you would in a zombie apocalypse scenario.Lastly, this game was meant to be played in Co-op. Playing it alone to practice is utterly boring, it would be better to play it with friends and gradually learn how to survive rather than do it on your own.For an early access game it is really really good. I enjoyed playing, surviving, dying and shooting in the game and i'd play it again as soon as my friends are free to do so as well.Solid 8/10 material. Would be 10/10 probably when the game is fully developed. I am excited to see what else they can put in the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												As a enormous fan of everything "living dead", I am very pleased to say that Contagion scratches that more authentic zombie survival itch. This isn't a Left 4 Dead twitch FPS, no. Your shots have to be in the head and, considering ammo scarcity, they have to count. The guns sound punchy, feel great and do appropriate damage to the models. The dead shamble just like you'd expect and are incredibly adept at navigating the level. And, speaking of levels, the maps in Contagion are some of the best, most realistic feeling I've ever experienced in a shooter. They don't feel too "gamey", but more like real places gone to Hell because of the Apocalypse.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												So me and my wife have put a little bit of time into this game.  At first I was pretty skeptical, considering I absolutely hated the Left 4 Dead series.  I'm just generally not a huge fan of the zombie genre (it's overdone imo).  But Contagion feels different.  You, as the player, are more involved.  We've really only played the Escape game mode, which for just the two of us is great.  And it seems a lot of the maps have randomly generated objectives when you play them.  Like some times a door may be blocked, but the next play through you can go through it and explore a different path to escape the map.  It makes replaying maps more enjoyable.When you die, you become a zombie.  It'd say it's more fun on a public server with multiple players, but in a 2-player co-op setting, it's not that fun.  But I can see the effects it would have on a 6+ player server.All in all, it's a pretty decent game.

Posted: February 14, 2015
												This is a surprisingly great game.  It plays well and feels very realistic.  There's not much like getting together with some friends late at night and playing through a zombie infested bio-med company.  There is lots of room for new content down the road as well.  Since it's based on the Source engine, it's very smooth and has very few bugs.  All around, a really fun game!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Contagion is a zombie survival game with a number of game mode focused on online play. In the game you can either play as a zombie or as a person when playing pvp which is fun to play both sides. As the person you can do your basic FPS mechanics and as a zombie you are the normal zombie exept you have a small speed boost and you can call a horde to your side from any zombies near to you. Theres also an extraction game mode where you have to try to save civilians without letting anyone die. There are more game modes to suchas one that can act like a story guiding you through a map. I personally found myself playing a pvp all alone just for the fun of blasting zombies away without worry of someone else trying to kill me. When it comes to inventory, you have 4 weapon slots and you can carry so much ammo it's not a worry, but that leads me into the next thing, getting ammo and supplies.You start off every match witha random melee wapon and a pistol of some sort. From there, you must scavenge. You must break into peoples houses, movie theaters, malls, really anywhere and search high and low for things (don't worry about how the locals feel about this, they've already been infected). You can find anything from med kits to nail guns to wooden planks to assault rifles to varrying types of ammo to an occasional greanade (just try not to blow yourself up). This is a game where your shots count though and you shouldn't fire until you know it's going to be a head shot. A zombie can take a very large sum of bullets to the body or a single shot to the head.Contagion did do a nive job with the models and what they look like when they take damage for the bodies. When you put a round in an undead's head, you can see a large exit would on the other side. If you blast their leg with a shot gun, it may come right off. If you hammer away at their chest, you may leave a nice cavity there. The point is, you can blast an enemy to smitherines and you'll be able to tell.In the game you can also make a 'home base' type area such as when you're in the suburban map. The game provides nail guns and planks of wood if you look around to help secure an area. You can make this place a stock pile, a temporary place to just sit for a minute, or simply slow the zombies down for a few seconds while you run for your life out the back door.Contagion also has large maps, especially the city one which I think is something like 9 full sized blocks (also if you look enough, this is the one game to put a gun store in it if you need a couple extra rounds. *wink wink, nudge nudge*) This is great when needing to run from another player or when you just feel like exploring.The graphics in the game are good... but only at night. I've noticed that durring the daytime nothing looks as good as it could be, and though that may just be a time/budget thing to make it look good, just try not to look too closely at textures in the sunlight. When it comes to night time it does look very pleasing to the eye with their lighting engine and the reflections in everything. You can see this which helps to show off what it can do and with the lack of sunlight makes it so you don't focus on any below-par textures. Lastly for what I have to say about the looks of the enviroment is rain. Just rain. It looks very nice compared to many other games I have played especially with the lighting engine to help show it off. You can see small ripples if you look close enough to where a rain drop has landed and little things like that. Finally, I would just like to point out the sound. They did a great job with the sound like when you step on a piece of fallen fence you can hear it shake, of when you step on broken glass and hear it crack. My point is, it sounds nice.The good--Great lighting engine (if anything it's a tad too bright with the flashlight, but that's fairly small depending on where you are-Zombies look great when heavily damaged-Nice sound-big maps-good, serious atmosphere-if you look close enough, most of the little extra stuff like books do actually have titles and such.The bad--player zombies feel a bit underpowered (but thats probably to help balence)-map size can make multiplayer difficult-revolves anound the same mechanics most of the time, it's more just who you're shooting at.The ugly- -It may just be me but I've noticed a case of "fuzzy screen" when playing this that usually doesn't happen with other games-don't look at textures to close in the day timeRating: 7.5-8/10If you catch it for under $5 on a steam sale I definatelty reccomend, it's a fun game but some will like it more than others.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Great co-op zombie survival game. It's challenging and fun, and makes you think twice before you shoot as your ammo is limited and you have to scavenge for weapons and ammo. The zombies are also quite interesting as they aren't your typical weak zombie. You have to aim for the head and get headshots or else these guy's are bullet sponges.There are some minor bugs like zombies glitching out and such, but it isn't enough to really affect gameplay. Contagion is really a very well made and polished game.Overall, Contagion has a nice balance of challenge and fun, and you can survive with a big group of your friends which is awesome.I highly reccomend Contagion. And tell your friends to get it too, as it's more than just 4 player co-op, it's 5/6+, heck I'm sure you can get 12 of your friends in a game.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												You are a survivor armed with a assortment of various weaponry and a next-gen smartphone with unlimited battery against an horde of infected zombies.But the real danger comes not from the horde,no it comes from the very teammates you have to survive with....In all seriousness this game is a nice take on using l4d's system with more of a walking dead bunch of zombies that die from headshots.Gameplay:8/10-Quite enjoyable with strong amounts of co-op play.Visuals:7/10-Dated but not a real eyesore.Sound:8/10-The zombie horde causes a earbleed :DServers:?/10-I am unsure of the server status at the moment(will edit)Overall:8/10-The game may lack single-player or a general plot unlike l4d but it is a enjoyable experience that I would recommend

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												Good game, but either some of the menu options are just placeholders for the final product or the developers were really lazy with their copy paste job, seeing that these menus look exactly like Left 4 deads. Theres an option in menus to to turn subtitles on.... but there are no subtitles in game so why? The gameplay itself is really good, but it doesnt make sense why most of the time you play as a zombie instead of a survivor, because most if not all games you join will have you as one. Also, why do the zombies have stamina? I don't know, but ohwell. One last thing is the lack of content. Theres only 3 maps and 3 modes. At the moment this really isnt an issue because I'm still fairly new to this game, but once I clock more hours into it, I hope there will be more contentto keep me coming back for more. In a survival horror game like this, the game doesnt need to sport dozens and dozens of weapons and this game makes that statement true. Theres enough variety to give players options without over saturating the game with unessecary crap, like 12 different types of ammunition and such. This review may sound like a fairly negative one, but rest assured. I like this game. Just pointing out the faults for anyone who might see them as a concern.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												I played Zombie Panic Source back in the day a little bit and had some fond memories of it. Along with that, I've got a bit of a soft spot for mod-teams turned dev and like to give them support where I can. As a result of these things, I picked up Contagion during it's early access period.My first impressions? It was rough as guts, but had a certain charm. Graphically, not amazing but solid. It is Source engine after all, it's old but it's capable. It was a little bit limited in terms of maps and modes at the time but, being early access, I couldn't expect it to be fully featured. The melee was atrocious, and was so hard to use that it wasn't worth using. Animations etc were a bit clunky and sometimes awkward, but forgivable coming from a (until recently) mod team. The gore was humorous, seeing heads pop open was always fun to see. One thing that really irked me though was the teleporting...sometimes the zombies, either AI or player controlled, would teleport a metre or so at a time which made it impossible to shoot them in the head. It's fair to say that I liked the game but that I had a few gripes.I went away from it for a while, distracted by other games (it happens to me very regularly) and came back to it a little more recently, probably just after it had officially launched. By this time, Barlowe Square had been launched and the bugs ironed out, melee was FAR more usable and a lot of the teleporting was gone. It was nice to see things progressing.What do I think now? To be honest, it still feels like it's in beta a lot of the time, but end stages of beta. There are still problems. Player controlled zombies seem to be able to hit me from 2 metres away. There is still a shortage of maps. The animations are still mostly awkward. On the other hand, things are improving steadily. More maps are on their way out soon, along with more weapons. Steam Workshop has been integrated. The melee system is being revamped, animations and textures are getting work done. Just recently, split screen mode was added (AWESOME FUN!) It still has a few issues, but they don't get in the way of me enjoying myself.I now play regularly with a number of mates, running our comms through GameVox. With only two of us, we can have a great time playing Escape or Extraction. With any more than that, we can quite happily play Hunted mode. In my opinion, this game is best played with friends. Playing against unknown wombles is still fun, but having a laugh with your mates while you play is where it's at. Contagion will never be perfect, but it's faults are forgivable due to the insane amount of giggles that we get out of it. That, and it scratches that zombie game itch like no other games I've played.I'd give it a 7.5 out of 10 currently, but with what's on the road map I could see that easily going to an 8 or 8.5. Contagion has some rough edges but it also has a strange appeal, and I certainly don't regret buying it. If anything, I actually feel a bit guilty that I paid so little for it (weird, I know).

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Great co-op zombie survival game. It's challenging and fun, and makes you think twice before you shoot as your ammo is limited and you have to scavenge for weapons and ammo. The zombies are also quite interesting as they aren't your typical weak zombie. You have to aim for the head and get headshots or else these guy's are bullet sponges.There are some minor bugs like zombies glitching out and such, but it isn't enough to really affect gameplay. Contagion is really a very well made and polished game.Overall, Contagion has a nice balance of challenge and fun, and you can survive with a big group of your friends which is awesome.I highly reccomend Contagion. And tell your friends to get it too, as it's more than just 4 player co-op, it's 5/6+, heck I'm sure you can get 12 of your friends in a game.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
												New review since the game just released from the Early Access stage. Immediately had to reset to dafault keys and it seems to be an okay game. It's more serious than L4D as the game has no specialized zombies like a tank or witch, just traditional zombies. Players can also play as zombies after dying as a human, so it has a bit of Zombie Panic and No More Room in Hell mixed in together. Considering part of the Zombie Panic team also worked on No More Room in Hell, this game really does resemble a bit of both. The game offers a fair amount of modes, objective mode is fairly complicated and easy to get lost in. Extraction mode I didn't particularly like since you're acting as rescuers. A bit strange of a goal especially when the NPC's follow you around like clueless morons with no survival skills. That's the job of the military usually, to rescue survivors, not you because you're too busy trying to survive on your own. You'd think the NPC survivors would also be trying to save their own hide. So it offers a new gameplay mechanic that Nmrih and Zombie Panic doesn't offer, but it's not the best mechanic either. Cellphone replaces the compass function you'd normally have in Nmrih and unlike Nmrih the players can still play after dying so a bit of Zombie Panic.The good news is the game is less spatially disorientating than what it was in the past, so I give it a thumbs up for improving the camera movements of the game. The zombie running animation with the claws running out furiously could use some work, but aside from that, overall it's a mediocre game. I suggest buying this cheap and not at the full price ($19.99) it is currently at. You can have more fun with the free Zombie Panic and No More Room in Hell mods.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												A friend of mine told me to get this game awhile back, and when I was checking it out it seemed pretty cool but not amazing. I'm always cautious of early access games because you never know where your money is being spent, or if they're even working on it at all. But I risked it for this game based on the fact that it gave me and my friend something to Co-op for awhile.And I'm so glad that I did, because It's one of the best early access games I've ever played, and absolutely worth the price. I got to play it for most of it's beta, and I've seen it go from a cool little zombie game, to a game on par with L4D2. At it's current state, It's added so much more content to the game since Beta, the Developers have listened to every bug or problem I found while playing (which they'd look into and fix almost immediately) And graphically, it's the best looking game I've ever seen coming from an indie team, even better than most AAA games aswell. You can really feel how much effort they put into this game, from the subtle references of their original game Zombie Panic Source, to the finer details in lighting, textures, ambient noise and overall atmosphere. Also did I mention, you can chop the arms off a zombie, and watch as it attempts to grab you but can't? Yeahhh this game is worth your time

I don't care about the whole being the last player alive thing, because I see it as us against the zombies. Reminds me of the Day Z mod a lot actually. So, I'm recommending you all give this a try, but with reservations.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												Contagion is a more than decent zombie survival game, It has a variety of fun game modes and I enjoyed playing it. I also have to note that I really like the games soundtrack/ score, It stands out to me more than the gameplay even!Contagion is pretty fun but does not come without a few problems. The biggest to me is probably that there are not very many maps, though varied item spawns can help decrease content fatigue, it can only do so much. There is a workshop for the game, and this also helps shake things up if you ever get bored with the vanilla content! Another issue I have is that playing as a zombie can be frustrating. Often times I find myself being spawnkilled by someone from a very long distance, or worse yet never being able to find anyone at all because they are just too good at hiding.All said, I still think Contagion is good fun, and worth your time if you are a fan of zombie survival games. The co-op is pretty top notch, even if the versus is often sub par.

content:

												It could have been an awesome game. Unfortunately, it has never been finished properly...However, I can STRONGLY recommend the game for its "hunted" game mode. This one gives me pretty pretty much adrenalin and a lot of FUN. Because you are being hunted by the zombies and the other players there's always danger plus you think twice about using a gun on zombies because other players then can locate you. Overall, the atmosphere, for me, is quite thrilling, especially when playing a new map!The escape mode is also quite nice but the problem is it needs polishing... (For example voting for server options like "no more new players are allowed to join" etc.)Don't really care about the missing community/the empty servers btw. You don't really need other people to play it (especially not if you got one other person to play with via Teamspeak or what ever). Some will join the server after you've joined any way.Overall, if you can get it cheap, get it. It's worth it - especially playing with buddies + microphones!

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												This game delivers very well for what it has to offer and I would definitely recommend this game to someone who is intrigued by cooperatively-driven gameplay. I shall continue to play because it offers a very entertaining and somewhat rewarding experience that I enjoy very much.Presentation: This game has a low production value, but that doesn't really negate from the overall package. Monochrome has delivered a reasonably enjoyable title that differs greatly from other titles that are similar too it. Generally speaking, the game has a nice and slow pace, but picks up progressively as you immerse yourself into the game modes that it has to offer. The game modes are all worth playing. They paid a legitimate amount of attention to detail. Many environments are dark, the zombies can be fierce, and you feel as if you must really fight for your survival. And that's what it's all about.Graphics: The Source Engine has been on the market for quite some time now, but that doesn't mean that the graphics are unimpressive. The graphics are still very nice and there are a lot of options you can adjust to get it to how you'd like. This game does not push the Source Engine to its limits in terms of visual aesthetics, but there is a sufficient amount of visuals to keep you immersed in each environment. The lighting can be a little-bipolar - either extremely dark or extremely bright, but the flashlight lighting was done very well. It even alarms the zombies quite a bit. The frame rate also holds together very well when tons of zombies drop in on you and your partners' location.Sound: They did a fantastic job with the audio system. You can hear rain drop onto tin roofs of surrounding shacks or drop onto plastic tents and the differences in sound are all there. You can even hear the rain trickle off of buildings and onto the ground. The voice overs were done okay, but the players can be a little annoying when they say the same thing over and over about keycards or how every door separates "US" (players) from "THEM" (zombies). Because of the fact that the GPS system is not an absolute pinpoint marker to locate other players, you must really do well to communicate with other players, but with that said, you'll also learn to appreciate the sounds of other players' gunshots, bones cracking from falling, and other sounds as well. Music is also there and it is very appropriate. It's subtle, but enough to enhance the overall feel.Gameplay: This is where the game stands out. I'd definitely recommend playing with people you know and play it with the intent of wanting to succeed, otherwise you will crumble. Alone, you might not even enjoy the experience at all.  You cannot run and gun through this game. You have to plan routes together, find and conserve resources, as well as ration them fairly. Knowing what you NEED to take versus what you WANT to take can make the difference in having to put bullets in the heads of a legion of zombies or just wiping a huge chunk of them out with an IED. This is one of those games where you will be highly tempted to wander off alone, but doing so can be extremely dangerous and may cost you the game. Stick together and you will find that it is a much more rewarding experience, even if it is possible to succeed scrambled. That would be a no-no.Lasting Appeal: The gameplay formula is sufficient enough to provide for definite replayability, but the ice-breaker is content. The small number of maps and game modes may feel limited to many people who have played or decide to play this game. If Monochrome adds more content to this videogame, this will definitely be a much more longer-lasting game. However, the maps and modes are very fun when played as they should be, and the overall experience does not have a bad aftertaste. On the contrary, it may feel natural to want to play multiple sessions on the same map. Aside from it being fun, there is also a modest level of randomization on each map, which allows for some unique playthroughs each time.I'd say play it, but play it with the right people. :)

If you want a more realistic experience where teamwork does matter, buy this game.

												I would've enjoyed this game if the devs could PLEASE fix the clunky zombie animations and hitboxes:The way the do a full climb animation over the smallest obstacle is annoying and really just looks plain silly and cheap. Hitboxes are terrible - aiming dead on the head a few meters away should result in a clean headshot, right? But no, that happens maybe half the time. Yeah the zombies are shambling a lot, but so fast that they dodge bullets from point blank range? I don't think so.And the physics.... just awful, and combined with the poor animations it just looks and feels like an annoyingly bad made B-movie...Graphically, the game looks good enough, but the exaggerated lens flares are just annoying.So yeah, that pretty much sums it up; this game is annoying.It had promise, but was poorly done.

												You will find many people complaining about this game and its wonky controls but in my opinion the good outweighs the bad.+its very well optimised+i like the idea of using "movie zombies" only and not some OP monsters+it has a great atmosphere +fantastic hunter mode where u have to fight off zombies and other players+i like the fact that zombies can inffect you, yet sometimes it take just 1 scratch and another time u may have 10% left and are still not infected. content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												I just happen to come across this game by chance and thought it might be interesting to play. I didn't have the cash to purchase it at the time but a friend of mine actually gifted it as a present and I was on my way. At first glance getting into the game was quite interesting with different styles of maps, modes, and objectives. My personal favorite were escape modes which is pretty self explanatory. After getting well adjusted into the game I decide to move up to harder difficulty seeing as that was the only viable option instead of doing straight PVP (hunted). Reason being the overall game lacked content so you often found yourself in repetitive situations ultimately remembering specific locations to give yourself an edge versus other players. To my surprise the difficulty was quite challenging however certain mechanics left the overall experience bland if not just right out horrible. Some examples of this were random disconnections, hit-box for zombie head-shots, and the overwhelming powerful armored zombie that required an large amount of ammo to take down if you aren't good at using melee attack (which by the way wasn't an easy task on extreme). Putting that aside, another problem facing this game was the community. Now, by community I mean specifically the typical run-of-the-mill ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s you'd often see in any online game. See, this wouldn't be such an issues however, with the open mic feature and team killing enabled... Well let's just say the overall game experience dropped to below average. You'd often join games hoping to have some fun but run into horrible people that would kill you on purpose, disconnect and reconnect (which auto-turns you into a zombie) to sabotage the team, or have players just abuse the mic privileges by spewing some toxic things out of their mouths. Now, in order to have fun in this game emphasis on teamwork is required without doubt, it is a must or the game becomes virtually impossible to complete or even be slightly successful at (speaking for average players). To put things in perspective, ultimately the game itself will fall into one of these headings for the majority of players either death by fellow teammate, accidental shots (leading into arguments), players turning into zombie (on purpose), players throwing away valuable in-game-items needed progress (by hiding it), player stalling the game when everyone is dead (on purpose) by hiding in specific areas before progressing to far, players mass looting all items which should be shared leading to the teams inevitable death, or completing the game successfully without any issues. In team-based games such as this one, it is important to work together to better the overall gaming experience however Contagion fails to really address these issues thus the problem persist even today. Granted there is a mute feature which is nice but doesn't do justice. So, in conclusion, if you decide to play this game with friends consider it a decent game but overall short (content wise). If you decide to play by yourself, consider yourself warned and tread lightly. The game itself would best be described as a "pick-up" game in which you can start and stop at any time with no real commitment towards progression or anything of that nature. If you find yourself in the long-haul playing a lot more (for the competitive gamer) I'd recommend a pass on this game altogether, save yourself a headache personally. There are much better games out there. I don't recommend this game.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Looking for a zombie game thats not like any others?Looking for a well made coop FPS experience?Well you havent found it. If you have played any zombie game then you have played this. What the dev's will tell you is that the game is complete. Thats a lie. For starters let me preface by saying i play every type of game and strive to do the best at them. So i have mastered first person shooters. let alone zombie games. I know to aim at the brain and im accurate enough to hit it everytime. However in this game the brain hitbox is not the best, many times i have accurately hit the brain only to have nothing happen. Shotguns destroy flesh in real life however in this game they are the worst weapons, they do nothing. This goes for melee weapons as well. choping off arms doesnt do anything as they still hit you with phantom limbs. When you die you turn into a zombie and are pretty much unstoppable, and when you die as a zombie you respawn as another zombie making the game really unenjoyable. You are pretty much a tank. The NPC zombies always get stuck on something or each other. You cant climb down ladders. There are many problems with this game. All in all its a bad No More Room In Hell knock off. With so many zombie games out, this is nothing new or creative.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2014
												After i had played this game for 4 hours when it still was in "Early Access" i was thinking, "This game is garbage". But when i saw  that this game was out of Early Access and was realeased i decided to install the game again and give it another try. Now i have one word to say "Wow". I can't believe that this is the "Contagion" that i tried months ago. Now my view of this game has completly changed. This zombie game is not just a zombie game. It's a game that has a wonderful co-op, fantastic graphics and alot of fun and action. I really must say "Great Job" because this has changed my view of this game. For a zombie game this got all the content that it needs. I really enjoy playing this and the opportunity to meet new players. I will rate this game at 8/10 for being a fun zombie game with wonderful co-op.

												TEN OUT OF TEN.....Is what i would be saying, if:I didn't get auto disconnected from ever server i join: As soon as i get in my camping spot after aobut 3 or 4 rounds i get auto disconnected, its not my internet, I have 5 bars at all times with fios quantum.There was a way for zombies to locate camping survivors: In big maps like that city one with the gas station, its damn near impossible to find them, i like how its realistic, but for a video game i think we need a way to find them.The Good:This is what i said to my friend after i first got this game: Thursday, April 17, 201412:00 AM - Tybalt: dude this game is the scariest zombie game ever made12:00 AM - Tybalt: its amazingIts very true, i was terrified while playing, im in a corner looking at my phone, sending messages, to turn hear a "buzz buzz" directly behind me, i turn, a zombie standing over me, i jumped so far out of my chair, i didnt even get a chance to kill him, and i was laughing my♥♥♥♥♥off afterwards, it was an amazing expierence along with many more ive had and hope to have.Overall i give this game: 8/10P.S. i understand you guys want to make it as realistic as possible, but its also a video game, we play them to get away from life and have fun.My Suggestions:I didn't get auto disconnected from ever server i join: This i have no idea, idk if its the server or the game, i myself can live with it, seeing as the game is new and things like this are expected, i hope you are trying to fix it, if i am not the only one experiencing this.There was a way for zombies to locate camping survivors: Simple, maybe make the survivors cough or talk to themselves like in ZPS (have not checked in game if they do that already, if they do just ignore)LONG STORY SHORT: GREAT GAME!!! BUY AND PLAY!!!!

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
What makes this Game specialDon't ever compare it with Left4Dead2.You can compare some of the gamemodes and teamplay but overall, Contagion is much more realistic and L4D2 more the oldschool arcade type.Here are some differences:Any different Zombie species?L4D2 yeah, loads of with different abilitiesContagion no, only normal and armored policemen, just differs from NPC (no special abilities except crawling) or player controlled (able to crawl, to blend, to build a horde and special vision)How to kill a Zombie?L4D2 pump 'em full of leadContagion headshots are a one-hit-kill and therefore key to survival, because a bodyshot does much less damage, means it takes alot more ammo and ammo is sparseGetting wounded/killed by a zombie means...L4D2 wounded...it slows you down, killed...you're dead (unless a teammate helps you up)Contagion wounded...you'll probably turn into one of 'em, killed...you'll turnWhat about the User Interface?L4D2 displayed health and inventory of you and your teammates, cursorContagion only your health, stamina and inventory (teammates displayed by holding tab), no cursor, map and notifications on the phone (equipped by tapping B)How's the weapon handling?L4D2 fire arms: no aiming (except sniper rifle) instead there's punching with weapon, melee: chargable punch from upContagion fire arms: aiming for every weapon (punch with weapon by tapping V), melee: chargable punch from up(LMB) and the side(RMB)other differencesother gamemodes like extraction (your team has to escort NPC  survivors) or hide'n'seek with player controlled Zombiesthere's a PvP mode for survivors (last survivor wins)ammo and weapons can be found anywhere, mostly where you least expect itthere's no storylinesome character animations a bit poor but hopefully getting better with the next patchesAs you read, it differs from L4D2.But I can't say that one is better than the other because they're different. I really enjoy playing L4D2 when I'm looking for fast-paced oldschool arcade fps action. But when I'm in the mood for a realistic Zombie-experience, I choose Contagion over all for the time being.ConclusionIt's a realistic Zombiegame where you can also play as a Zombie in any gamemode.I rate it 82/100Also check out the wikia http://contagion-game.wikia.com/wiki/Contagion_Game_WikiThank you for reading the whole review.I hope it was helpful for most of you.Feel free to comment if you have a question about the game or the reviewDominik

What makes this Game specialDon't ever compare it with Left4Dead2.You can compare some of the gamemodes and teamplay but overall, Contagion is much more realistic and L4D2 more the oldschool arcade type.Here are some differences:Any different Zombie species?L4D2 yeah, loads of with different abilitiesContagion no, only normal and armored policemen, just differs from NPC (no special abilities except crawling) or player controlled (able to crawl, to blend, to build a horde and special vision)How to kill a Zombie?L4D2 pump 'em full of leadContagion headshots are a one-hit-kill and therefore key to survival, because a bodyshot does much less damage, means it takes alot more ammo and ammo is sparseGetting wounded/killed by a zombie means...L4D2 wounded...it slows you down, killed...you're dead (unless a teammate helps you up)Contagion wounded...you'll probably turn into one of 'em, killed...you'll turnWhat about the User Interface?L4D2 displayed health and inventory of you and your teammates, cursorContagion only your health, stamina and inventory (teammates displayed by holding tab), no cursor, map and notifications on the phone (equipped by tapping B)How's the weapon handling?L4D2 fire arms: no aiming (except sniper rifle) instead there's punching with weapon, melee: chargable punch from upContagion fire arms: aiming for every weapon (punch with weapon by tapping V), melee: chargable punch from up(LMB) and the side(RMB)other differencesother gamemodes like extraction (your team has to escort NPC  survivors) or hide'n'seek with player controlled Zombiesthere's a PvP mode for survivors (last survivor wins)ammo and weapons can be found anywhere, mostly where you least expect itthere's no storylinesome character animations a bit poor but hopefully getting better with the next patchesAs you read, it differs from L4D2.But I can't say that one is better than the other because they're different. I really enjoy playing L4D2 when I'm looking for fast-paced oldschool arcade fps action. But when I'm in the mood for a realistic Zombie-experience, I choose Contagion over all for the time being.ConclusionIt's a realistic Zombiegame where you can also play as a Zombie in any gamemode.I rate it 82/100Also check out the wikia http://contagion-game.wikia.com/wiki/Contagion_Game_WikiThank you for reading the whole review.I hope it was helpful for most of you.Feel free to comment if you have a question about the game or the reviewDominik

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Contagion is an amazing Co-op Survival game that can be highly addictive (in my case). Contagion features Five impressive game modes,, each including it's own styles of gameplay:+Escape+Extraction+Hunted+Classic (x2)+Flatline(DLC Bundle/not yet released)* Escape puts you and other players into the world with an Objective- Escape the undead. It is recommended that you raise the difficulty (if easy/normal) if playing with 3+ players. * Extraction again teams up the players against the dead to rescue survivors around the map. This mode can be difficult. (play hard with 5-6 Players)* Hunted pits Players against eachother - but the undead still wonder the streets? thats right! watch your back because once you begin shooting at other players, the Undead will come for you. no recommended difficulty.*As well as the main modes, Contagion has two Classic modes that are very similar to ZPS. Both are player only modes and support larger servers. The first Classic mode is very similar to Escape but with only players. The other is a timed survival themed mode. * Flatline SHOULD be a wave based survival. This game plays well on low preformance PCs, however it greatly reduces the graphics to a simple toonish feel. If playing Solo, i Recommend playing Escape or Extraction, Just set the Difficulty to its highest setting.---I've been playing Contagion sense its beta stage and it has greatly improved, however i've always enjoyed it.Thumbs up, and post your own recommendations to let others know of Contagion!

												Okay, so I think this game does not deserve all the good reviews it has..  I bought this in early access and I enjoyed the game, even though it wasn't "good" in my opinion. CONS-The gun gameplay is BAD and the game has the worst rifle scope in history, wich makes it very scary to use since all the zombies in the medium sized maps of this game will come knocking at your door when you shoot even one bullet.-Not many players in multiplayer, which makes it difficult (for me at least) to find a server with good ping.-The zombies lag! This is a major and a common problem in zombie games. I haven't seen a zombie game with zombie hordes where the zombies wouldn't lag, with the exeption of Black Ops zombies. This is not my computers fault since it runs everything quite well.-Too much 3d anaglyph.. At first on early access the amount of it was good and it gave the game a little bit more realistic feel. Now there is just too much of it though. It is ditorting and confusing. PROS+Mods! This game has mods, which can of course make it better by some amount. In the other hand there aren't too many of them, because there aren't that many players either..+Well it has zombies and CO-OP, so if you like those things you will enjoy this game to some extent like I did, even though it is a little unpolished and crappy :PCONCLUSIONThis is Steam, so buy it on sale if you really like co-op zombie games. The game can be enjoyable, but i wouldn't recommend it.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												If you're looking for complete realism, this may not be the game for you, but it comes close. If you want something as realistic as it can get (at least at the time this was written), try No more room in hell, which is free on steam. Anyway, in this game, you play as a survivor of a zombie apocalypse, where zombies are everywhere and ammo is everything but plentiful. Players can play in (Again, in the time this was written, because updates happen) 3 different gamemodes. Hunted places players in a deathmatch-like game, where you are your only friend, and the zombies aren't the only threat. Humans can fight off zombies as well as each other (Which is why I never play hunted). Objective has players meneuvering throughout a map attempting to complete a list of objectives in order to escape the nightmare. And finally, Extraction consists of players going to different locations looking for survivors, and once a group of survivors are located, players have to defend the area for a specific amount of time, after which they are escorted to an extraction point. Players who die will take control of a zombie for the rest of the game (Which is one of the reasons I find it unrealistic), and have some abilities to compensate for their very small amount of heallth (Another reason it's unrealistic). Undead players can call zombies to their aid, and can command them to attack living players, and can let the AI take over to seem like AIs to living players and lower suspicioun.IIt's a tad pricy, but it's good fun, and using a mic is recommended for communicating with your team without stopping and letting a zombie take you out.

Posted: May 11, 2014
												I would probably not buy this game for $20. Its kind of fun with limited maps and gamemodes but the fps aspect is horribly innaccurate. Would not reccomend mostly due to weak game mechanics. There are no working vehicles, the trailer I watched said that you can throw coins to conserve ammo which is only true if you are using cheats. All of the maps are pretty straight forward (not at all openworld in anysense) and I have not once played a round where I did not have an excess of 45+ rounds for the standard handgun (Not to mention any 3 other guns I might have.)All of the zombies are the same height so anytime there is more then 5 of them coming at you, all you need to do is walk through any doorway and they will line up for you.If you want to shoot mindless zombies who shuffle straight towards you in almost a single file line with excess ammo and no need for a team, then this is the game for you. Mindless headshots is a big part of the game. However the guns are really innaccurate. I dont expect to be able to snipe with a handgun but I should atleast be able to hit a non-moving target that is 15feet away.Also, they have 1 map that is endless waves of zombies but if you arent using cheats, you are limited to about 30 - 45 bullets and they recreated the map from the first nazi zombies. They didnt add all of the furnature and stuff, but it is the exact same game mode and map layout.I give Contagion 3/105/22/2014

												I feel so stronly about this game I hope for the day its developers hire me. I would love to make half-baked,glitchy, bugged,fundamentally flawed garbage and sell it for a living. I tried to give this game a chance but it is so utterly and profoundly screwed up I shudder to think how unplayable the early release versions were. Did the zombies just stand there and pee their pants? The suvivors? was there even a map or was it just some dark abysmal purgatory where the players floated about as disembodied spirits crapping on eachothers shoes?You got three modes for your money. Escape, in which you wander about aimlessly looking for keys or a bolt cutter or (after 5 minutes) a reason to not bash yourself in the temple with your mouse. Extraction, in which you use your smartphone to go find grown adults, fight some zombies and walk those armed adults to a fence just so they can NOT climb it to safety. And Hunted mode...basically organized trolling. The only redemption to this game is that you can be a cockroach. I cannot begin to tell you how many times my friends and I were sitting around talking about video games and, forlorned and angry at the world, regretted the fact there was nowhere on the market we could be at the helm of some disgusting insect watching people kill zombies...pay attention Walking Dead there might be a season finale here with this meticuously crafted and fresh perspective on the whole zombie genre. For those of you who like this game and/or lack attention span I'll summarize:♥♥♥♥ this game. Seriously...♥♥♥♥ this game.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												Ah Contagion.....Do I love you? Or do I find you utterly redundant? Maybe a little bit of both. You see, this is a game that provides some innovative mechanics into a familiar video game theme. I have had this game since it's early days, so I have had the chance to watch it grow, and grow it has. I personally find the art style nice, and the graphics quite good, so I have no complaints in those departments. The physics are fine, and I absolutely love how the zombies can only die with a proper shot to the brain. I feel like this game has really improved my overall skill and precision using a mouse for aiming. The game consists of a couple modes, only two of which I personally find interesting. There is mainly just co op modes, but there is one mode that shines, and it's called "Hunted". In Hunted, it's every man/woman for his/herself with weapons and pathways randomly generated, but there are of course, zombies everywhere. Now the thing that makes this game different, is that when you die, you actually BECOME one of the zombies, and have multiple abilities, including the power to call a horde of up to 15 zombies to follow you, zombie sight (Basically night vision for the deceased), and the ability to blend in with the NPC zombies. Sounds cool right? It's not. I'll be honest, it gets very tedious running around as a zombie, as people RARELY work together and use strategy to take down the remaining survivors, and it's simply not as fun as being human. The factor of fear completely disapears and I think that's actually the issue with this game. It's very shallow and one of the only things that makes it interesting would be the fear factor. Hiding in a house, then you hear a player walking in, for example. The maps are very well created, and I give props to the designers responsible, but it still doesn't save this game from being mediocre at this current time. One thing that's cool, is that the devs have stated that all the upcoming DLC will be free, and they apparently plan on implementing more features, but I have no idea if any of that is actually true in the long run.Okay, so the game is original, and has style, but what does it lack? I shall start with the fact that there is absolutely nothing to unlock, or achieve, other than steam achievements. It does not matter how many matches you win, all you will ever recieve is a little message, and "awards" like "Hunter" that actually hold no weight whatsoever to your profile or game at all. I know some people prefer this style of online game, but I find it totally destroys replayability and makes the game feel pointless. I think this is a great game to play in SHORT bursts but only with close friends on a mic. I find going online solo, only lasts me about 25 minutes before I have to turn it off due to how repetitive and redudant it had become. To sum things up....The game is well made, and bursts with creativity, considering the genre. Although it's creative, looks good, and the bugs are extremely rare, the game lacks content and feels very shallow in comparison to other modern, multiplayer online games. PRO:-Creative take on the zombie game genre-Very nice visuals and not too hard on your PC. - Interesting weapon selection/Small selection of maps, but they are well done.- Virutally no bugs (100 hours of playing and I have yet to encounter many past full release.)- All upcoming DLC are going to be given to us free (They say they plan on POSSIBLY adding a ranking system of some sort, but only want to add it to "Escape" mode which absolutely baffles my mind.CON- No Ranking/No unlockables whatsoever. Nothing to achieve.- Small map selection- Only ONE proper pvp mode (It's good though)- The other modes are boring (Escape isn't terrible but as I explained, there is no reward for completing it other than a steam achievement)- Lack of replay unless you have close friends to play with using mics. I have friends that play but even then I find it redundant, so it's truly hard to say.- NO CHARACTER CREATION/NO CHARACTER PROFILE FOR ONLINE- The head developer of this game will reply in anger to criticism on the forums, defending his game to the very last breath, even if it means he is so completely incorrect about the subject at hand. -Warning-If you enjoy FPS games with a zombie theme, and enjoy a minor horror touch, then go ahead and buy this...If it is ON SALE. I would never pay more than $10 for this game in it's current, shallow state.6/10

												If you even hated L4D series for it's arcade'ish pushing gameplay but wanted a spooky zombie survival game - you just found it. Well... kind of.True what Contagion currently suffers from all common Early Access problems, starting from bugs and broken critical features (like melee combat) and ending with lack of contents. I mean if you want a pure survival gem, you probably want Contagion right now - before it will be tainted by all-popular 'balancing' stuff, like special infected and infinity horde collection mode.Just look the negative reviews - people actually complains what they can't shove off bunch of zombies with a 700g handgun swing. Yes, in Contagion you'll die if you failed to determine the right moment to reload when fighting horde. You'll also die if you failed to check what is behind door before opening it... Or to check room for stray zombie before start looting it... Or to plan yourself retreat path before engaging larger hordes. Did i mention that you can simply run out of ammo - depends of how good team survivors are?

content:
Posted: October 9, 2015
												My experience with this game was and is still great. I always played as a host with two or three friends with in-game vocal chat in Extraction or Escape modes (PvE). I played  Left 4 Dead and one difference I can recall is the fact that, even at normal difficulty, you can run out of ammo in Contagion if you don't search for it or you waste it. It gives a small inventory management challenge and search-for-items pleasure. Since your inventory is limited, you'll find ammo for guns that you don't have but that one of your friends have, this adds to the cooperation since you often have to drop ammo for your teammates to be efficient.The maps are well made even if the objectives are kind of confusing for the first time you do the map (We usually play at lower difficulty than usual for a new map to get hang of the objectives). There is some nice replayability on maps since the path you take from one game to another may not be the same. In one playtrough, you may use a certain door but in the other, this door is locked and then you realize you have to find another way or that the keys you need are not at the same place and you have to search for it, this help to lessen the feel that you are playing the same map.The only major crittic I have about this game is the lack of variety in ennemies. Since shooting is a large part of the game, your target stays the head for everything you encounter (walking and crawling zombies). The only exception is an armored zombie, he just have a lot more health, no weakpoints like 'You need to shoot it in the back' which would be a perfect feature for a cooperative game but no, you just have to fill him full of lead. Many Shooting Zombie-Themed games use different types of ennemies to create some variety in shooting (Like Left 4 Dead, Resident Evil, 7 Days to Die...) but maybe the concept of a 'realistic' zombie virus locked the concept of using more variety.

number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 16, 2014
Rank: 6/10Recommendation(s): Buy on sale, don't think this is a triple A title, and live in New York or beside server host.Major Theme: Significant lack of professionalism.Bought at Price: $0 - Gifted when $3There's quite a list of things to touch on, so let's get right to it.I have always been a big fan of Source powered titles, and even more so of mods going pro level. This title is a big let down, and I certainly hope it improves quickly. To me, licencing and using the Source engine means serious work. The developers are willing to step up to the AAA level and deliver. So far, development has been very amateurish, almost what I would expect from a Source mod.Being SteamWorks enabled, the download and install process was easy. On launching the game, I was shocked and confused as to why I am seeing a notice about RAM requirements. This original shows the situation hasn't improved:


Uhm... WHAT!? What kind of unoptimized hunk of junk is this? Since when did source games use close to 1GB of RAM? This doesn't look good.... 
A Screenshot of Contagion
By: DarK_St3alth




From what you see today:


The programmers still can't do basic math.. So much for leaving early access! 
A Screenshot of Contagion
By: DarK_St3alth




If you are having issues understanding (which is the case with many) what the issue is, please read this little bit. The game notifies me that the OS is reporting there's 4087MB of RAM to use, yet the game needs a minimum 4064MB.Tieing back into the amateurish development, it seems that the developers can't even do simple math; is 4087 bigger then 4064? I'm not sure why this hasn't been resolved or if it will ever be, but it's scary to think that it has passed through not only QA (quality assurance) but the project lead and programmers as well.Talking about testing and QA, a recent issue came up of kill reporting. If you were to throw a grenade bound to kill someone, and switch to another weapon, you will find that the server reports back that the person was killed with the actively selected weapon.I hate going on about the QA, so let's move to another topic. How about effects for show?Throughout my education to date and programming experience, I was always told "simple is best". There's no need to overly complicate things or add things "just for show". Sadly, Contagion falls into this trap. What I call the "dirty lens effect", doesn't make any logical sense. This effect is used when characters have glasses or a protective visor on. When used correctly it can add that extra level of immersion, knowing that you are looking out of a visor. Last time I checked, none (or the vast majority) of characters didn't have a visor or glasses on. So why include it? What was the gain from adding an effect that doesn't have sound backing? It's just yet another questionable move by the amateurish development team.I can't bash the game that much, because gameplay wise, it's nice to see some fresh elements in an over crowded and over saturated zombie genre. The cell phone dynamic/mechanic allows for greater immersion, and removes the need for HUD elements. Operation can be odd due to the key bindings.Rescuing trapped survivors was another fresh idea, but again has a failing in it. While they added the ability for the AI to defend themselves, they tend to shoot each other if one is in the line of fire.Jumping into the most worldly debated topic of "PvE" and "PvP" (which I don't agree with the terms) would seem logical at this point. The hunter maps seem to be random, but don't provide enough randomness to prevent players learning the how many different combinations to gain an advantage. I vouch for games that focus on player skills, rather then easy memorization. Sadly, memorization is the is the only skill really required and doesn't allow for fair play.The randomness the title does provide in the "hunted" gamemode seems to be unbalancing. Some players are given the more powerful 1911, where as others are given the weaker Sig Sauer. While the round progresses, this doesn't matter that much, but early on can certainly provide an unfair advantage. There's no counter balance to the 1911 early game, because you don't need that much ammo to kill targets.On that topic, due to using a certain server host, latency can be a real game killer. Valve tends to spread their servers out, and have enough in reserve to get people playing. This is not the case with Contagion. Either there's an issue with the server host or game code, but you can end up playing on a UK server while sitting on the far side of North America. Not sure how many of you have done this, but let's say 130ms makes shots and server-client prediction interesting."Early Beta" for the team was really more of an excuse then a development status. Besides the ambiguity caused by using "early", it just seems that there was (and continutes to be) a significant lack of professionalism.So there you have it. All the major issues, and the unfortunate lack of positives. Throughout the whole review, I keep going back to the idea of "amateurish development". It's the biggest idea that screams out the most when playing the title.

												It's actually not that bad of a zombie game. If you were to play alone I can see why it can be boring and hard to complete. With a friend or a group it's quite enjoyable. I don't really care for Extraction mode though, even with friends. I find it to be repetitive, going from house to house saving people who all look like the previous saved people lol. Escape is my favorite. The objectives can be quite annoying though, especially when you are low on ammo, barely any health, have a  zombie horde trying to murder you, and you don't know where to go. I love the little cockroach you become when you die. It's so fun to jump around, trolling the remaining survivors lol. Oh, and medkits are too scarce. There is also a tiny problem with hitboxes not registering when you melee. When you take a sledgehammer to the head of a zombie 5 times, it should die right? Well not all the time :)As for the pumpkin head Halloween update: It was fun for awhile, but it is so hard to get a headshot on them so you are constantly just wasting ammo.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
												Spectacularly bad and I'm not generally a picky gamer.Contagion crashed 4 times over the course of 2 hours and with very long (3-4 minute) load times, that's really irritating.The graphics are shockingly poor, even by 2014 standards. The sound is broken.  For example, if you let out a zombie scream (after you've become one), it plays maybe once or twice but then you just get the animation.  You'll also hear sounds that are not coupled to direction.  Got headphones on and there's gunfire to your left?  No there isn't.  And this is for ALL sounds, not just some.  Might as well just play with the sound off as it is quite literally worse than useless.If you die, you become a zombie.  Good luck trying to find that one survivor holed up somewhere in a huge map loaded with explorable buildings.  When you do find them, hopefully they aren't barricaded in a room (they will be) because you can look forward to getting killed quickly, then spending five minutes getting back to where they are (provided you know the map well enough to know how to get back to where you were), and get killed again.  And that's if you're lucky and they haven't moved.  If so, back to square 1 which can take 20-30 minutes of just wandering around.  You think there'd be a game timer move the game along.  Nope.  You stay in this state until all survivrs are dead.  Invariably, the survivors get bored and just die intentinally because that's more fun than the self-barricaded stalemate.  Nothing serves as an impetus for the survivors to be pushed toward action like a countdown to a carpet bombing or the last evac helicopter leaving.  Success is survival and if that means sitting in a closet with three bullets forever, your optiosn are to either stay in that closet forever or intentionally die.What's irritating is that it's a generally interesting concept but everything about it, and I mean everything, is fail.  That this game got a "mostly positive" review is mind-blowing.  It's terrible.  I wouldn't play it if it were free.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												If you expect an easy 0815 zombie shooting game, you're wrong.There are many gamemodes like Escape, save NPCs, a simply deathmatch etc.Find your equipment, avoid making sounds and avoid as many zombies as you can.DON'T GET HIT! It could be over after one simply hit because you can get infected by one hit and then you'll turn into a zombie... is it over then?NO! You can still play as a zombie, lead a horde of 15 zombies and kill all the remaining players. Now you ask, why should I kill the guys I tried to survive with? Cause it's fun. But be careful, you're easy to kill as a zombie and if you die too often, you'll become a cockroach (simply a spectator). You'll run around on the map as a cockroach, waiting for everyone to die or escape (depends on the gamemode you chose). But hey, its not that simple, players can run over you and kill you even if you're a cockroach.Theres death everywhere ;DBut it's not only fun but.. the game is dead. Feeling like there are only 50 people playing it. Thats quiet sad cause it's such a fun game :(PS: aim for the head, don't waste ammo

												As of 4/10/2014, this game is still in its beta stages. And I am a very negitive person, so of course I'll start with the badBAD: The overall game is buggy at best, (I'm rating this on its current stages of the game) and it has the HL2 trademarked terrible hitboxes. Overall the gamemode is very tense and I would buy it just for that gamemode. The other gamemodes are nothing glorious, but nevertheless fun.
