number of helpful: 16 of 31 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Definetly worth the price! Contagion has left the BETA stages and is now a full game. The game is awesome graphically, amazing and detailed sounds! [Incredibly useful for when playing The hunted gamemode] Plenty of fun to be had! with 5 or more game modes theres a lot to do! One of my favorite features is for the Escape game mode which puts you in a situation and you and your team need to cooperate to get out alive. The best part? the mission's objectives are randomized so you don't always play the same thing over and over again. Contagion Currently has 6 maps to choose from [which are incredibly fun] And Steamworkshop to add a bunch of player made gun skins, flashlights, phone backgrounds and maps! Also they announced the up coming DLCS will be absolutely free! Contagion is a refreshing and fun addition to the zombie survival genre with a mechanic where when ever you die you yourself get to become a zombie! Even better you have full controll over your zombie and must kill the rest of your old team to win! SO wether you're a zombie or a human there is lot's of fun to be had. Now the cons of the game: Sometimes the zombie AI will group up to attack a player but get stuck in a giant mass [can be fixed with the roar ability as a zombie to make them follow you] [I forgot to add that a great feature is the ability to climb over objects and break down doors] other cons are sometimes the zombie vision can kinda hurt your eyes so don't leave it on for too long. Now that the cons are over one of my favorite features to the game they recently added is Controller Support and wait for it..... SPLIT SCREEN!!! Yes split screen! Plug in 2 controllers or one controller and the other uses the mouse&keyboard and guess what? you got yourself some couch co-op which most games lack these days! [ No auto-aim for controllers i might add] [PS4 controllers work to!!!} All in all Contagion is a really fun game especially with friends! I would go into detail about the gamemodes but that would take too long! Anyway I give Contagion an awesome 8.5/10 Go pick this game up! Have fun in big picture mode on a tv with controllers! Do what ever! 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												Contagion is a 2011 medical thriller directed by Steven Soderbergh. The film features an ensemble cast that includes Marion Cotillard, Bryan Cranston, Matt Damon, Laurence Fishburne, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow, Kate Winslet, and Jennifer Ehle. Contagion's plot documents the spread of a virus transmitted by fomites, attempts by medical researchers and public health officials to identify and contain the disease, the loss of social order in a pandemic, and finally the introduction of a vaccine to halt its spread. To follow several interacting plot lines, the film makes use of the multi-narrative "hyperlink cinema" style, popularized in several of Soderbergh's films.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												Bought this on a sale with my partner a while ago and we love it. We have been looking for co-op zombie orientated games  and for us this game is brilliant. The map selection is small but what makes it fresh is that locations change, while some doors will be open one time the next they will be blocked up and you'll have to find alternate paths or alternate items to progress. It would be nice for more maps to be added in the future though.Gameplay is great, I feel it's as realistic as it can be in a zombie apocalypse in which if a crowd finds you, you will be overwhelmed which means you need to form tactics with a partner or solo, the way that the zombies only really die by headshots is also brilliant while difficult when first getting into the game but it becomes easier in time. The objectives are plenty and each gamemode has different aims which is great when you get bored with one.The only issues I can really come up with are zombies pathing is sometimes strange but it doesn't affect the game much, could use some more maps. Also when infection is on and you'll sometimes change for no reason even if you haven't been hit, but it's not extremely common though when at the end of a game waiting to escape it's a damn pain in the♥♥♥♥♥Love this game I'll give it 9/10. had a very good time with it. Though I would reccomend it with a friend rather than solo as it is fun.

												As of 3/10/14, I give this game a score of 7/10.PROS: O  The graphics look very good.O  Many characters to choose from.O  Animations are fluid.O  Sound is immersive and realistic.CONS: X  There is a lack of maps, but that's okay as long as they are working on making the mechanics of the game better. You can only play the gametypes for certain maps. They should consider making survival-like versions of every extraction map or versus gamemode so that you could play the same mode but in a survival mode.X  The gunshots in this game sound like little BB guns. There is only about one gun that sounds like an actual gun and the sound isn't even for the right type of gun. Not big enough of a deal to take a rating off, but hey it's the little things that count. X  The shove with V is terrible, it doesn't even push the zombies away.X  When you die, the game is extremely boring. You spend all of your time as a zombie going around trying to find the humans and it's just terrible. CONCLUSION: Concept is good but needs a LOT of work. If you are reading this and have watched the trailer, realize that the trailer is a bit misleading. Not all of the things in the trailer are in the game yet, but that's not to say that they won't add it soon. After buying the game during the fall sale, I was a bit skeptical to whether they would update or not. However, the game has been updated regularly so you can count on the developers to add more things to the game. I play this game every time there is an update so that I can change the review to match what the current product is. I do realize the game is in beta and I hope they continue working to make it a better game.EDIT: As of 3/10/14 the game has been updated several times and improved on animations, bugs, and the graphical user interface. I have updated the overall rating to match its current state.The moderators on the Contagion discussions delete reviews that talk sh*t about the game. Haha.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												The word is Clunky.Clunky controls.Clunky words.Clunky AI.Clunky gamemodes.Clunky pvp.Clunky Co-Op.Everything about this game doesn't work smoothly, whether you get literal jerks attempting to jump over something in a motion similar to being yanked by a short string and dragged over the obstacle.or more metaphorical clunkiness in the form of map readability and gameplay flow.Additionally, many of the features this game presents as it's strong points are actually weak points, or hardly points at all."Map variability" here means "Sometimes a door is open that isn't always open".Does that door matter? Heck no.Except one in a million times, the objective decides to be behind that door, so you run the map you've run a hundred times before, only to realise the end was 1/5th of the way through the 45 minute run."CooP and PvP" here means: ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s will shoot you at random, Rust Style, and if they don't, people will join your server as you're in site of the goal as zomies, kill you, then leave the server. Say goodbye to another 45 minutes.Weapons function strangely, and there are odd levels of spread. Additionally, with no viable dedicated servers for half the countries that play this game, good luck getting a stable connection.Try sniping in a game where even high sensitivity makes you feel like your arms are encased in jelly with a grainy scope with poor resolution compensation on a connection that drops every tenth of a second.... with 15% spread.Additionally, and finally, The developers censor any negative comments or constructive criticism made to them on their forums.They have since beta.They act smarmy in and out of game, and don't hesitate to inform you that they can make you jump through a hoop at will.It's likely this mentality is what lead to the games... mediocre state.Don't buy, not even at 75% off, courtesy of the steam summer sale.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Have you ever played Dead Island? It's mediocre, does nothing special and has tons of bugs. Despite that, it's still enjoyable to play with friends and worth it if the game is on sale. I feel the same thing applies to Contagion and if Steam reviews had a rating between yes and no for recommendations, that's where I would put this game.My first thought about this game was that it simply did not feel finished, or like a retail game. It was then quickly pointing out to me that this is based on a Source game, Zombie Panic. That's what this feels exactly like, a source mod, as opposed to a game you pay for. Although despite this, the game somehow manages to look dated and the animations are shoddy. Gameplay itself can be quite fun in places, but feels bear. For example, there is one gamemode in which you are given a location you must get to, find supplies and kill zombies. At first, this seemed really enjoyable, there was no map apart from those located in-game as models which was a neat idea but soon we discovered everything felt extremely linear with many of the paths we wanted to take blocked off. You quickly learn this game is not as open world as it seems, which is disappointing since taking multiple routes to get to an objective in a zombie game should be encouraged.The game also includes a neat mechanic in which if you die, you become a zombie and get to hunt down your friends. This is a good idea and proved to be some fun, however it is somewhat flawed. It is extremely hard to find other players, unless they're close. If you press a button, you get a red filter which is supposed to make things easier, I don't know, I didn't find it useful. Zombies have no trackers to find humans which is probably intentional but when some maps are so big and dark, it can be a nightmare and purely coincidence to find humans. So zombies are probably more fun for people who are actually used to the game and know the maps, but the first time it happens, especially if it's on Barlow Square, it's extremely tedious to do and you will spend ages just trying to find your way around the map.Another problem this game suffers from is the surround sound is complete and utter garbage. I don't know if this is a Source Limitation or what but on a gamemode like Hunted, which is PvP and is vital for you to be able know where enemies are to stay alive, it can be absolutely frustrating and disorienting. The game isn't terrible, we had quite a lot of fun on some gamemodes when a bunch of us got together but it just feels extremely hard to recommend, with the tipping factor how much you're being asked to pay for it. If you don't bother with it, you aren't missing much and should probably go download No More Room In Hell instead since they both generally feel on the same level.However the SDK it comes with has a very nice interface and it's pretty easy to get css/gmod maps into the game.Also to point out what Panda posted in his review: http://i.imgur.com/6Td7w0E.png

content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												I played Contagion during the time it was free so my time was short. The concepts in the game were a lot of fun. Working together, hunting, being hunted, extractions etc. As small of a thing as it was, I thought the cellphone idea was cool. Overall, I would not pay anything for this game if it receives no major updates. The controls are very clunky. Granted, this is partially due to my machine, but I found the gameplay very rough when the action was on. Graphics-wise, I was not super disappointed (because I paid nothing) but given what is out there I would expect more. Gameplay was only fun because I played with others. Oddly enough, I agreed with another player who said the running around searching for a way out and looking for ammo/tools was probably more like a 'real' zombie apocalypse than running and gunning everywhere. Playing as a zombie was basically like Left 4 Dead but worse. I would have preferred dying and waiting for my teammates to die or win instead of playing as a zombie OP. Potential is there but not fulfilled.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I bought this game on sale for $5, thinking I was getting a steal because It was a full released game. After playing for a while I felt scammed because it felt like an alpha or a really bad beta. Pros; It can be fun to blow a zombie's brains out, but it gets old because that's the only satisfying place to shoot the zombies. Playing with a friend is fun, but there are bugs such as your phone map displaying your friend's phone map. You can- There are- .... This one map-, ... Nah thats pretty much it. Shooting a zombie in the face is the most fun thing about the game.Cons: The graphics are eh and the gameplay is poor. There aren't very many guns or weapons to use, and the game modes are very tedious, boring, and unsatisfying. The mechanics are lame too, the only things you can do are aim shoot and press E to interact, which doesn't even serve you well. I found myself trying to interact with loads of stuff that didn't work. For example, there was a cleaver stabbed into a countertop in one of the maps, which seemed perfectly suitable for zombie killing, but it turns out it was just part of the scenery. There were also lots of small places and corners to investigae, however they never had any loot or useful weapons, so it turned out to be a waste of time. Speaking of wasting my time, this game is also a total waste of money. **PLEASE, NO MATTER WHAT, DO NOT SPEND $20 ON THIS GAME**. 5 is acceptable, but 20 is a bit crazy. The zombie AI is strange, they're slow moving and unintelligent, however they can climb ladders and come after you if you're on a roof. The mele button may as well not be there because hitting a zombie with your gun seems to not do damage, and doesn't even knock it back for breathing room. The fact that you can't knock zombies really stinks because if you get cornered by an armored zombie, (I've seen 2 my entire time playing.) you're as good as done.All in all, don't buy this game unless it's on sale for under 5 bucks, and even then you'll probably be disappointed.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Contagion is a 2011 medical thriller directed by Steven Soderbergh. The film features an ensemble cast that includes Marion Cotillard, Bryan Cranston, Matt Damon, Laurence Fishburne, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow, Kate Winslet, and Jennifer Ehle. Contagion's plot documents the spread of a virus transmitted by fomites, attempts by medical researchers and public health officials to identify and contain the disease, the loss of social order in a pandemic, and finally the introduction of a vaccine to halt its spread. To follow several interacting plot lines, the film makes use of the multi-narrative "hyperlink cinema" style, popularized in several of Soderbergh's films.Soderbergh and screenwriter Scott Z. Burns had collaborated on The Informant! (2009). Following that film's release, both considered creating a biopic covering Leni Riefenstahl's life, before Burns brought up the idea of producing a medical thriller film depicting the rapid spread of a virus, which was inspired by various pandemics such as the 2003 SARS epidemic and the 2009 flu pandemic. To devise an accurate perception of a pandemic event, Burns consulted with representatives of the World Health Organization as well as noted medical experts such as W. Ian Lipkin and Lawrence "Larry" Brilliant. Principal photography started in Hong Kong in September 2010, and continued in Chicago, Atlanta, London, Geneva, and San Francisco until February 2011.Contagion premiered at the 68th Venice Film Festival in Venice, Italy on September 3, 2011, and went on general release on September 9. The film was well received by critics, who praised the narratives and the performances of various actors and actresses. It was also well received by scientists, who praised its accuracy. Commercially, the film was a moderate box office success. Budgeted at USD $60 million, Contagion attained $135 million in box office revenue during its theatrical run.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Great game, especially in escape co-op mode. Haven't tried PVP yet.Luckily developers still support it and react to player's reports. With the last patch released it became stable. Haven't noticed a single crash after playing it for 3-4 days.Zombies are not superfast and intelligent. There are only two types of zombies - regular and armored SWAT ones. This game doesn't have any science fictional weapons of the future which is a plus for me.Weapons, ammo and medkits spawn rendomly, so you always have to look for any useful loot everywhere which increases the replayability.I recommend playing this game with couple of friends using voice chat.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												I am a die hard L4D fan and so I was a little hesitant to purchase this game, I'm really glad I did. Contagion is co-op survival horror at its finest. Your actions must be deliberate, especially on the higher difficulty settings as ammo is scarce. Headshots and a reliable buddy are your only way out of this zombiepocolypse. The maps have mutliple pathways to them so it is not always the same experience. Add into that the player controlled zombie feature (after a friend gets killed) and you will dread the sound of zombies groaning in the distance. My advicve is to stop reading this pathetic review and click buy.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												This game is really good for a early access game. It feels like its a complete game even though its in beta. The maps are a decent size and weapons are relatively easy to find and easy to access. Every gun sounds and handles great with little to no problems about bullets not registering. I haven't experienced any lag and there are little to no bugs from what I see ( except an occasional zombie getting trapped behind some funiture). the graphics are good and maps are pretty well detailed. The AI is kind of derpy at sometimes. In some cases you could be standing yard or two away from zombies and they wouldn't even see you standing there. My only big problem in the game I see is that you get control of the situation to quick! there is almost little to no dread in the "survival" situation of the game. If your playing with a well coordinated team or just one friend in any of the modes theres not much you haft to worry about except other players. Now what I mean by that is sometimes weapons, ammo, and health are too easy to find and stack way to high!!!! you could have more then 100 rounds in any smg, assualt riffle, or even the pistol. Besides the rediculous amount of ammo you can obtain with four weapons  is that the hordes of the zombies are too small. Pros:- No lag- every gun looks, sounds, and handles great.- decent graphics, good maps, well detailed enviroments- classic shoot in the head to kill zombie style gamplayCons:- occasional bullet not registering and weird AI- loot in the game is to easy to access overall 8.5 out of 10 would like to see a variety of new maps, maybe make it so you can't contain so much ammo, and more random hordes of zombies.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												I am surprised this game is in it's finished form. I did a LAN with 5 other people and to begin with, the game was fun. However, when a player dies and the mission continues, those that are dead are either turned into a zombie (hopefully), or turned into a cockcoach to help other players navigate the rest of the map like a scout. however, players can squish the cockroach and once they do, that player is dead and has to sit and wait until everyone else either wins or loses. At one point, I was "infected" and turned on the spot. It was a cool mechanic, but I had NO idea how I became infected or what the prerequisite is for turning into a zombie. I want to turn into a zombie if I die with friends!! Prepare to sit and wait patiently after you die. Overall:Tutorial - 0/10Gameplay - 6/10Unique Mechanics - 7/10Sound - 1/10Graphics - N64Replayability - 3/10

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Survivors vs Zombies gameplay is fun but gets old quick if stuck on the same map with no cycling. It is a $$ knockoff of the FREE Zombie Panic! Source mod on Steam:I would only recommend this game if it were free or had significant overhaul/expansion of features to explain the price increase from a free mod. Some constructive criticism for the devs based on my gameplay experience follows: -Zombies get tired? No ranged attack? WTFrack?? Get rid of the stamina guage for the Zombie run or use it instead for a spit attack (minor damage+chance to infect+momentary blurred vision?). The undead don't tire, but it does take time to cough up more corruption+parasites from their dead lungs. Make it an unlock if you think Zombies with ranged weapon is unbalanced - refillable only by devouring Surviors perhaps (minor health gain)?-Insanely difficult to track down survivors on the larger maps as a zombie, especially if you are new to a map and don't know the layout. The pathing/tracking blood sight system needs to be improved badly.-Royal Pain to sneak up on anyone as a zombie, especially with the constant moaning an groaning. Maybe limit the noise zombies make to only when they are attacking and/or running quickly. It should be much easier to get one good stealth bite in and would definitely increase the suspense factor.-Remove the Nail Gun + Boards or make them easier to use. Easier currently to just defend an area yourself than board it up, as it is very non-intuitive.-Survivors should be able to scale fences just like Zombies, faster even but using their stamina meter, same as jumping or running. Very annoying when the undead are climbing over fences and cars but you cannot. Other option is to take away Zombie ability to scale anything and instead allow them to knock fences down especially when zombie buddies helping, similar to the destructible doors.-The physics engine felt blocky with most of the movement - maybe smooth it out? I don't know if collision can be tweaked, but I found myself frequently getting snagged on corner of cars, buildings, dumpsters, etc. Definitely breaks the mood when you are running someone down or trying to run from a horde.-No anti-camping mechanism. All roofs should have multiple access points but do not currently. Zombie spit attack (see above) would also help with this. The other option would be to make all survivors spawn in an infected state with life steadily decreasing. When it hits zero, they die and turn. Obviously you would have to have more med kits and/or food/drink items laying about to counteract this. It would add a definite sense of urgency to scavenging items besides ammo.-Headshotting zombies is a guaranteed one-shot kill. The only difficulty with this is the zombies which have broken necks or otherwise move their head down or to the side when shambling about - also the riot gear zombies. Grappling+biting survivors should be a guaranteed infection to balance things out. Didn't seem to be the case.-Nothing sucks worse than running from a horde shrieking like a lil girl because you have no weapon with which to defend yourself. Sometimea your teammate is hogging all the drops or just got to them first because you're new to the map. More variety and availability of improvised weapons would take care of this problem - ie screwdrivers, broom handle, ice pick, meat cleaver, molotovs, hairspray+lighter, etc. There should be an improvised weapon in almost every room if you looked closely enough. This doesn't mean they cannot be depleted, snap off in or get lodged in a zombie carcass, forcing you to obtain another. This increases the need to scavenge.-Plenty of weapons in game, but I'd like to see more, so long as they are not too similar to existing weapons - ie flamethrowers, katanas, crossbows, etc. Permanent weapon mods/unlocks such as extended mags, flash supressors, vertical foregrips, silencers, laser sights, extra magnifcation scopes, etc would be awesome but should be rare finds or purchased DLC unlocks. Also more ammo types per weapon - ie hollow points or shotgun slugs to blow thru the SWAT zombies.-Varying reach and delay for different melee weapons. It felt as if all melee attacks were pretty much the same and equally susceptible to getting your arm chewed off. Only thing that seemed to help was higher ground and timing. Close quarters should be knives and Grapple+Bite only (quickest). Everything else requres room+time to swing and thus 1-2 meters more reach. Also additional effects such as block, knockback, dazed or impaired runspeed dependant on what was struck by which weapon. Zombies don't feel pain but they lose limbs fairly easily. Its all that corruptive rot setting in.I did enjoy the few flaming zombies I saw, but did not get to see how long they could last running about like that - they caught a round to the head far too quickly. Saved my assault rifle ammo for when I ran into SWAT zombies or all my other ammo ran dry. Also got infected twice and the blurred vision was a good indication I was turning. IMHO it should be more nauseating and/or disgusting to watch them turn, within the existing ESRB rating ofc.  Chance to infect seemed random but may have been based on how many times I was gnawed on.

Posted: August 29, 2014
												Was a little bland. The zombies come at you but not too fast and there does not seem to be any real goals other than to live through the zombies. Maybe I missed a bunch by playing at the noob level but that is what I am when it comes to this type of game. The tutorials could have been more obvious and there should have been some sort of indication if you were supposed to be getting somewhere other than just walking around killing zombies.I did enjoy getting to bash zombie heads in with a wrench and stabbing them with a knife. Much more fun than wasting bullets but survival is more difficult.

Close quarters should be knives and Grapple+Bite only (quickest). Everything else requres room+time to swing and thus 1-2 meters more reach. Also additional effects such as block, knockback, dazed or impaired runspeed dependant on what was struck by which weapon. Zombies don't feel pain but they lose limbs fairly easily. Its all that corruptive rot setting in.I did enjoy the few flaming zombies I saw, but did not get to see how long they could last running about like that - they caught a round to the head far too quickly. Saved my assault rifle ammo for when I ran into SWAT zombies or all my other ammo ran dry. Also got infected twice and the blurred vision was a good indication I was turning. IMHO it should be more nauseating and/or disgusting to watch them turn, within the existing ESRB rating ofc.  Chance to infect seemed random but may have been based on how many times I was gnawed on.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												The best zombie game I have played. Character movements, sounds, and lighting are the best I have witnessed. The amount of blood and gore in the game is fantastic and realistic-like. But, that's where it ends.Pretty much everything else about this game is not great. The amount of maps and game modes is poor, boring and repetitive. You could complete this game within a couple of hours of playing. This is where I was severely disappointed, for a great game, not enough effort was put into map making, game mode making, etc. I believe the community needs to get more involved and make player based maps,  so that we can broaden our entertainment purposes. This game is similar to Left for Dead 2, but in my opinion, much better. It's just too bad that the developers did not follow on with what Left 4 Dead did, and make player based maps, and hold competitions to who could make the best map. I would rate this game 10/10. But this the content that it is lacking, I would lower it down to a 5/10. This game isn't worth $20.

												This game is a breath of fresh air among a horde or zombie games coming out these days. Although in beta I find this game very playable and extremely fun! Once you get into it there is no turning back. The Hunter (free for all) mode is fantastic and can be VERY intense! This intensity of trying not to make a sound because you hear another survivor close by, but there is a zombie headed towards you, do you shoot your gun? Then everyone will hear where you are. Do you run? Other players might see you or hear you and follow your movements. Often you have very little time to make critical decisions in order to survive. These moments can be wonderfully terrifying and make the game in my opinion. Cant wait for more updates!! (holiday update is great!)

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												Contagion is a fun objective based zombie survival game. Minus some initial issues with crashing to the desktop before getting into the game, I'd recommend it heartily. The game rewards good observation skills and keen awareness of your surroundings. There are a couple issues with odd animations when the zombies get in close to attack or when they go to climb over something, but the sound quality is very good including some background noise such as far off gunshots, which is hard to mistake for gunshots within the map that you're playing. Good job on the sounds. The zombies sound eerie and when they spot you, you'll know it. Ammo is spread around the maps, and is sparse, but luckily, there are some decent melee weapons.For people who want to compare this to Left 4 Dead, I'd say it's a bit more easy going, but just as scary even without "special" infected. The maps objectives and loot is randomized throughout the map, so check your corners and behind desks because there are some surprises occasionally in the form of ammo and weapons.Multiplayer requires cooperation. Those people who run and gun getting all the loot will find themselves alone soon with the players that die taking over spots as zombies. More than a few times I was surprised by a zombie while I was going to check a dark room and it turned out a player who had died was waiting for someone. It's worth the full price of the game, although I got it at the steam sale for half off. I'd recommend it as a well thought out zombie survival game.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												While Contagion may sound like another generic FPS with tons of zombies, it has much more to offer.Contagion is developed by Monochrome LLC, the same guys who previously created Zombie Panic: Source (you probably know that one). Game's Source based but don't get all disappointed - the graphics still look pretty amazing for a Source game, as obviously effort was put into that. This doesn't mean that the game isn't optimized - I personally didn't have any lag spikes due to the maps not being optimized, and I could play on max graphics with a Radeon HD 4850. This doesn't mean that your grandma's computer will be able to run this, though - the graphics do take their toll on your hardware.The game has Workshop support as well, making customizing the game as easy as never before. It also has an SDK for those guys who know how to release skins for Source games and such ;)Contagion takes place in some sort of global zombie apocalypse event, in a city called Roanoke or something. There are a few gamemodes in this game, probably the highlight of all of those is the Escape gamemode. It's a co-op multiplayer gamemode which supports up to 4 players in a match. The premise of this gamemode is that you have to wander around the map to find the exit, but it isn't your simple hit n' run match - maps are usually randomized, that means that there is more than one possible way to complete the game, that gets chosen while the map loads. So if you beat the map once, don't expect the second time you play it to be the exact same - you will have to find a new path. The maps are fairly large as well, you'll spend probably an hour on each map.The downside to the stuff I wrote above is that there are 2 maps at this very moment which actually support the Escape gamemode. There might be more made by other people, but I didn't look into it.Another gamemode which I really liked was Hunted - that gamemode has 4 maps, which I won't spoil. The premise of that gamemode is pretty simple - only one human must survive. This gamemode supports up to 8 players, which randomly spawn around the map. You look for supplies, guns, anything useful and attempt to hunt down the other players. The map is still full of zombies though, so you will have two things to worry about - the zombies and the other players sneaking behind you and killing you when you are completely unaware. Trust me, that happens a lot ;)Now this game offers some more gamemodes, such as Extraction, but I didn't look into them as well - just those two gamemodes I mentioned before are more than enough for this game already, but it's nice to know the developers added even more to accomodate to different tastes.When I got the game, it was just a few days after release, so lots of updates and bugfixes were being pumped out, which really made me angry. Not the fact that you had to download the updates - the fact that the official servers had to be updated as well, which usually took a long time and you had no choice but to host a server yourself because you can't play anywhere...So, the final word; should you buy this game?YES.

												While I do reccomend this game in steam I do say it comes with the caveat  that only fairly expierenced gamers should get this one. This game is a okay game for some one to mess around with but is really not a good game for begginners due to it's issues.   It  needs serious map improvements as well as user interface improvemnts. Some maps are litterally truncated and should be under  a different catagory than they were assigned. it is good that like Left 4 Dead and its sequel Left 4 Dead 2 there are different catagories of missoin types but the types are confusing and mislabled for some missions such as los muertos escape and the stone creek escape where it is basically a hold out mission with a limited map rather that a challenging map with different destinations and puzzles like in other missions of the same catagory. How ever that being said the other missions are fairly challenging and fun the only real problem with them is the extreemly overwhelming haord attacks at the end of the missions. The game has been updated recently with new content which I have not yet played and do not yet know about but will play and then update this review so give it a look see any way if you want. Now having played the new content I do like the game better though the weapons and items inventory still sucks, being only able to hold four items at once is not really conducive to good game play. It would be better if you could hold more items although the limit to the amount of weapons does make game play more challengeing and interesting.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												I enjoyed this game a lot. It stood out as a fun, realistic, zombie game. But after a while, I got bored of the content that it had and left it for a while.Then I got a few friends and played it a few years later. This game is an amazing coop experience. Multiple times, after failing or winning an escape map or extraction, me and my friends will just sit there and just talk about parts where it looked like it was ripped straight from some zombie movie. The best thing is, they weren't really scripted to be just like that. The power wasn't scripted to turn on so we were able to run away right when the horde got close to us, it just happened. This game, the atmosphere, the teamwork, the constant struggle of ammunition and weapons, it feels like a zombie movie. Long story short, I really enjoy it, especially with friends. The only downsides I have is that the voice acting can ruin some people's immersion and atmosphere. It's not bad, I love it, but some people may not think so. Especially when you can constantly scream, "LETS WAIT AND BARRICADE HERE" when you're literally in the middle of the street. And, it does have it's fair share of bugs. Not too bad, but... ye

content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Here we are for Contagion ! A game developed since 2005 if I remember, ok so I will be fast because the game is very very very short. There is five missions, the principal mission is in cooperation (you need to escape to a prison), one mission is called extraction (you need to protect a survivor until he escaped), and the three other are make for kill other players and you can be bored after 2 hours of gameplay (it's my case by the way)The good things are: there is not a lot of glitches (I found some but I'm a pro for this lol), and the gameplay is optimised (I have a very bad computer and I can play without any freeze or something like this) The bad things are: the game can be annoying when you tried all the missions, the new map is weird (there is some places than you can be sure you can enter but no) and the coop mission is glitched sometime.My final verdict is a 7/10 because except the game life, the game is very fun and the "Hunted" (PvP) mod are cool to play.

content:
Posted: April 14, 2014
												this game is quite fantastic. more akin to the original style of zombies started so long ago by George Romero, the zombies in here as slow (most the time) and hard-hitting enemies. sometimes plentiful, and always dangerous, even the small hordes hold great threat to you and your friends. to kill one, its best to shoot once in the head to conserve ammunition, otherwise, you arent doing very much against them. the maps are all randomly generated, giving you different experiences each time. the maps are pretty damn big too, and take a long time to complete, so you definitely have plenty of stuff to play through.the game is, however, quite difficult to play on your own, and not much fun either. that is a downside to me, as most the time, i prefer to play on my own if not playing with a friend. regardless, i still strongly recommend this game, especially if you enjoy the more tense and difficult type of zombies and an eerie atmosphere, instead of the crazed, adrenaline rush Left 4 Dead zombies

content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
												Awesome Zombie shooting fun with a different pace to L4d or Cod Zombies!This started off as the half life mod Zombie Panic... then Zombie Panic Source followed and finally this stand alone offering named Contagion.The most played game mode is hunted, where every survivor is spawned randomly accross a map and last man standing wins. One player will be randomly chosen as a zombie and each survivor who dies (from the zombies or other surviors) becomes a Zombie. Players can work together, gather guns and supplies, barricade doors and even Text each others phones to give away thier locations!!! Its really edge of your seat stuff especially as the survivors die and you are one of the last few left, everyone is out to get you as you make your final stand!You can also get a group together and take on a pre set mission map with various objectives to solve and NPC zombies to kill, these can be very hard on the harder settings as ammo is sparse and the zombies lurk round every corner. I have had hours of fun with this game and I hope you will too :)Lewpac

												I gave this game a chance hoping it would provide me and my pals a great zombie survival experience something to rival the other ones currently out... sadly we were all dissapointed. the grafx werent great but thats less important then gameplay. the characters movements and controls felt awkward and bulky specially when coming from something more fluid like l4d2 or most other FPS games. the melee attacks are also terrible in there own right, they are slow and cumbersome this game reminds me of a nightmare i once had where it felt like i had no control over my own movement, i would try to move yet it would be delayed or do nothing....  other then that the concept and game modes make it a different experience for a zombie survival but due to its unplayability with character movement this game isnt worth the money... should be a free mod at best.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												This a load of junk. I played this during the free weekend deal, and I wish I didn't. This is an awful game, it's a generic zombie coop game similar to left 4 dead. You check objectives with your phone (ya know, that thing a bazillion other games haven't done) and complete them. There are several gametypes, though I wouldnt be able to tell you which ones are which as I only remember escape and extraction. The others are basic PVP and PVE unlimited round survival games, that much I know. Escape has you follow a set of objectives to get to the end, and extraction...has you follow a set of objectives to get to the end and escape..? I didn't play for long, but I could NOT tell the diffrence between extraction and escape, both were similar and boring. And also, this game looks hideous. Not gonna pull any punches, this game is ugly. Textures look muggy, animation is stiff, the models look like they were pulled straight outta some zombie mod from GMOD, sometimes models overlayed themselves over some textures (Example: a fire extinguisher popping out behind solid glass) and for whatever reason this game has tons of lens flares which make the game IMPOSSIBLE to play. The reason being is in order to check your objectives, you have to check your phone. But because of the lens flares, you can't read your objectives, and if you can't read your objectives, then what the hell are you gonna do? Delete this game from your account. 1/10, only because the game didn't seem to buggy. Not sure about that though, you might wanna check some of the other reviews.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												Terrible game.  I read one of the positive reviews and wonder what game they played.  This game is confusing and glitchy.  The cell phone, which gives you your missions, had text that was too large for its screen, so I ended up with only a quarter or less of the goal description, which was useless.I spawned (twice) in a building that had no way out.  I gave it the benefit of the doubt and searched for a key or something to open the outside doors, and after about an hour of searching, gave up and disconnected.  It wasn't even that big a building.  Even if there WAS a way out, a good game doesn't have you sitting around with nothing to do for an hour.Buttons would sometimes not do what they were supposed to.  Once I ran out of ammo, and it wouldn't let me melee.  What is worse, when you do melee, it feels like your just slapping the zombie.  If I was gonna hit a zombie, I'd hit the zombie hard enough to knock it over or break something.  In the game, I hit a zombie over and over and over, and it never got knocked back, and it never died.  Finally a teammate found me and shot it.Someone mentioned how much fun it was to not have much ammo.  Well, I got stuck without ammo on a ladder with zombies at the top, and I couldn't get them out of the way.  These zombies finally discovered the perfect strategy.  Just swallow the ammo and stand on the ladders, and there's no way they'll ever escape.If this game has any hope of being a fun experience, they've got a lot of work to do.  It isn't exciting.  It isn't scary.  It isn't fun.  What were they hoping the game would be?  And why have a free weekend when the game is in such a terrible state?I'll follow this up by saying that the game may have some redeeming qualities that I didn't see.  I didn't play much, and won't be coming back, so I may have missed the best it has to offer.  But with so many excellent games out there... I don't see how they can balance out the hours of unexplained, empty, lonely exploration that concluded in exiting to desktop.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												Poor old Contagion gets bashed a bit, but I adore it!Now, it's not perfect. Sometimes the puzzles can be a bit fiddly especially for new players and I personally am not a fan of player zombies, although it can be fun on occasion. One can always just choose other modes or customisations though.Overall though, I find the game wonderfully atmospheric, immersive, intelligent, convincing and probably my favourite co-operative game I have ever played. Genuinely scares me quite regularly, and very few games do. Just the right pace - not too fast, not too slow.A brilliant title. I got it for about £4 but I would have probably paid up to £20 for it at this point in time, maybe more simply because NO OTHER GAME DOES WHAT IT DOES THIS WELL! Or at least none that I've ever played!Wonderful stuff :)

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												I am surprised this game is in it's finished form. I did a LAN with 5 other people and to begin with, the game was fun. However, when a player dies and the mission continues, those that are dead are either turned into a zombie (hopefully), or turned into a cockcoach to help other players navigate the rest of the map like a scout. however, players can squish the cockroach and once they do, that player is dead and has to sit and wait until everyone else either wins or loses. At one point, I was "infected" and turned on the spot. It was a cool mechanic, but I had NO idea how I became infected or what the prerequisite is for turning into a zombie. I want to turn into a zombie if I die with friends!! Prepare to sit and wait patiently after you die. Overall:Tutorial - 0/10Gameplay - 6/10Unique Mechanics - 7/10Sound - 1/10Graphics - N64Replayability - 3/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												The best zombie game I have played. Character movements, sounds, and lighting are the best I have witnessed. The amount of blood and gore in the game is fantastic and realistic-like. But, that's where it ends.Pretty much everything else about this game is not great. The amount of maps and game modes is poor, boring and repetitive. You could complete this game within a couple of hours of playing. This is where I was severely disappointed, for a great game, not enough effort was put into map making, game mode making, etc. I believe the community needs to get more involved and make player based maps,  so that we can broaden our entertainment purposes. This game is similar to Left for Dead 2, but in my opinion, much better. It's just too bad that the developers did not follow on with what Left 4 Dead did, and make player based maps, and hold competitions to who could make the best map. I would rate this game 10/10. But this the content that it is lacking, I would lower it down to a 5/10. This game isn't worth $20.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Survivors vs Zombies gameplay is fun but gets old quick if stuck on the same map with no cycling. It is a $$ knockoff of the FREE Zombie Panic! Source mod on Steam:I would only recommend this game if it were free or had significant overhaul/expansion of features to explain the price increase from a free mod. Some constructive criticism for the devs based on my gameplay experience follows: -Zombies get tired? No ranged attack? WTFrack?? Get rid of the stamina guage for the Zombie run or use it instead for a spit attack (minor damage+chance to infect+momentary blurred vision?). The undead don't tire, but it does take time to cough up more corruption+parasites from their dead lungs. Make it an unlock if you think Zombies with ranged weapon is unbalanced - refillable only by devouring Surviors perhaps (minor health gain)?-Insanely difficult to track down survivors on the larger maps as a zombie, especially if you are new to a map and don't know the layout. The pathing/tracking blood sight system needs to be improved badly.-Royal Pain to sneak up on anyone as a zombie, especially with the constant moaning an groaning. Maybe limit the noise zombies make to only when they are attacking and/or running quickly. It should be much easier to get one good stealth bite in and would definitely increase the suspense factor.-Remove the Nail Gun + Boards or make them easier to use. Easier currently to just defend an area yourself than board it up, as it is very non-intuitive.-Survivors should be able to scale fences just like Zombies, faster even but using their stamina meter, same as jumping or running. Very annoying when the undead are climbing over fences and cars but you cannot. Other option is to take away Zombie ability to scale anything and instead allow them to knock fences down especially when zombie buddies helping, similar to the destructible doors.-The physics engine felt blocky with most of the movement - maybe smooth it out? I don't know if collision can be tweaked, but I found myself frequently getting snagged on corner of cars, buildings, dumpsters, etc. Definitely breaks the mood when you are running someone down or trying to run from a horde.-No anti-camping mechanism. All roofs should have multiple access points but do not currently. Zombie spit attack (see above) would also help with this. The other option would be to make all survivors spawn in an infected state with life steadily decreasing. When it hits zero, they die and turn. Obviously you would have to have more med kits and/or food/drink items laying about to counteract this. It would add a definite sense of urgency to scavenging items besides ammo.-Headshotting zombies is a guaranteed one-shot kill. The only difficulty with this is the zombies which have broken necks or otherwise move their head down or to the side when shambling about - also the riot gear zombies. Grappling+biting survivors should be a guaranteed infection to balance things out. Didn't seem to be the case.-Nothing sucks worse than running from a horde shrieking like a lil girl because you have no weapon with which to defend yourself. Sometimea your teammate is hogging all the drops or just got to them first because you're new to the map. More variety and availability of improvised weapons would take care of this problem - ie screwdrivers, broom handle, ice pick, meat cleaver, molotovs, hairspray+lighter, etc. There should be an improvised weapon in almost every room if you looked closely enough. This doesn't mean they cannot be depleted, snap off in or get lodged in a zombie carcass, forcing you to obtain another. This increases the need to scavenge.-Plenty of weapons in game, but I'd like to see more, so long as they are not too similar to existing weapons - ie flamethrowers, katanas, crossbows, etc. Permanent weapon mods/unlocks such as extended mags, flash supressors, vertical foregrips, silencers, laser sights, extra magnifcation scopes, etc would be awesome but should be rare finds or purchased DLC unlocks. Also more ammo types per weapon - ie hollow points or shotgun slugs to blow thru the SWAT zombies.-Varying reach and delay for different melee weapons. It felt as if all melee attacks were pretty much the same and equally susceptible to getting your arm chewed off. Only thing that seemed to help was higher ground and timing. Close quarters should be knives and Grapple+Bite only (quickest). Everything else requres room+time to swing and thus 1-2 meters more reach. Also additional effects such as block, knockback, dazed or impaired runspeed dependant on what was struck by which weapon. Zombies don't feel pain but they lose limbs fairly easily. Its all that corruptive rot setting in.I did enjoy the few flaming zombies I saw, but did not get to see how long they could last running about like that - they caught a round to the head far too quickly. Saved my assault rifle ammo for when I ran into SWAT zombies or all my other ammo ran dry. Also got infected twice and the blurred vision was a good indication I was turning. IMHO it should be more nauseating and/or disgusting to watch them turn, within the existing ESRB rating ofc.  Chance to infect seemed random but may have been based on how many times I was gnawed on.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2013
												Really fun and entertaining zombie game. Unlike many others the zombies actually "feel" real. They shamble through the streets, heads bobbing around like maniacs as they slowly pace toward you, making those headshots more difficult than one would imagine. Completely ignoring bullets as they rip through their arms and legs, as it has no effect other than waying their arm slightly. If you want the kill, you're going to have to get that perfect headshot.They stupidly wander aimlessly, only beginning the chase once you've alerted them by sprinting through the streets or firing like a maniac. Smashing through doors and barricades with their bleeding arms, lacking the mental capacity to use door knobs. The zombies definitely have a life-like, or rather, un-life-like quality that makes them very appealing.But the zombies aren't the only threat. Aside from the co-op "Extraction" and "Escape" game modes, "Hunted" brings one of the most exciting and dynamic pvp experiences. Because unlike other games, being shot down doesn't just end your life, it brings on a new one. The hunt continues as you stalk the humans from the shadows as a newly made zombie. As a human you scavenge for weapons and supplies on the spot, compulsively checking your phone for nearby survivors, or player zombies. You can run guns ablaze through the streets, hoping to run into il-prepared survivors, or barricade a house of your own and take your last stand. Shooting through windows at other survivors or battling an onslaught of zombies as they swarm their way up the stairs or bashing down the door to the room you've taken shelter in.Overall it's a great game and I strongly recommen it. However, a Mic is basically a must. While not so much if you fly solo on Hunted, but the co-op modes desperately require coordination and team work, as a well-crrafted co-op game should. Definitely better with friends. Teaming up with them as securing a house together as you battle off the undead is some of the most fun I've had in a multiplayer game.The only downside to this game is the lack of content. Which can be expected from an early-access game. There's only 3 maps as of yet, 1 of which is used in 2 of the game modes. But with steam workshop support in the works, user maps and mods, that will soon be a thing of the past. But it doesn't require that. The devs are still very much working on the game and supplying new content.Well worth the price. I'm already over 30hours of gametime and it has yet to lose it's luster. At $15, this game is a steal.8/10

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												I've played many games over the years, especially zombie games, so I have allot of experience of this genre, I found games like left4dead and Killing Floor allot of fun and worth my money, so you will understand when I say the following.Do not buy this game, no matter how cheap! This is the most basic Zombie shooter, it is less fun and has less content than Killing Floor or Left4dead, it does "NOTHING" new, there is zero innovation here, this is a shooter made to ride on the cash train created by better Zombie games.Dead Island even which I don't rate super highly is a diamond compaired to this game.To sum up this game, you go around corridors of a city, not able to enter most buildings, having a really hard time getting ammo, to shoot a few basic crappy guns, the zombies are nothing special and you will get bored with this game unless you have never played a zombie shooter before.I'd write more and go into the out of date graphics, the monotonous gameplay, the vagueness of the missions and the corridor streets of boring, but it isn't worth my time or yours.There are better games out there, do not bother with this lazy shell of a game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
												SUCKS BIG TIME. Could have been something awesome but turned into a poorly copied left for dead clone. Linear maps with no explorabilitly, poor character handling, simulated restrictions to mimick real life setbacks are just there to get in the way not challenge you. All these things could have been put to the side for more team oriented play and better rewarding gameplay when completing a mission. The game avertises about "realism" but offers no character development and no true reason to press on. The only interesting thing to mention is the multiplayer gives you a chance to become a zombie and that seems to be the most fleshed out part of the entire game.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I have been playing the game since it came out on Steam and since Alpha it hasn't changed a whole lot in my opinion. Sure there are more maps and most of the bugs an glitches that were there in January have been removed but it could have been a whole lot more.The Engine supports large campaign-style maps but is poorly optimised. The zombies in this game are actually pretty lethal so be careful not to make too much noise or you may find yourself surrounded by the undead! It has good balanced gameplay elements for the casual gamer. If it could be any better it is if had more content and mod support. Overall it is a fun little first person zombie shooter more suited to groups of friends than people you do not know.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												A game released from early access... that still looks like it's in early access.Picked this up on sale 75% off and even then it's only just worth it, what's wrong, well:1) It doesn't look great, source engine may be old but it can still be beautiful, unfortunately this game is not an example, it's hard to put my finger on it, but all the environments feel too "clean", they look pristine, in fact, so much so they don't look real, especially for an apocalypse.2) The guns, they all feel like toys, cannot tell the difference between any of the pistols, the shotguns have really stupid damage (point blank to the chest wouldn't flat out kill you?) and are buggy and the sniper scope is near impossible to use.3) It really doesn't feel finished, you can do dumb stuff like run a long fences, the zombie climbing mechanic can never make it's mind up whether you can climb that thing - and will allow you to climb out of the map, and movement feels clunky. As an added bonus, as I found when launching the dedicated server, one of the things it printed to console was "Map is missing dictionary - DON'T SHIP LIKE THIS", even the developers don't seem to think it's finished.4) The gamemodes - Hunted just turns into free for all, Escape (I think) is just like nazi zombies but with a vending machine that randomly spits stuff out and you all end up running out of ammo, then there's another one which is "lead the AI around" and then there's another one which I don't even remember so it must be great. 5) The phone, pretty much a gimmic, being able to ring people in hunted is good, but beyond that it just feels shoehorned in, in some missions you get to use it as a map, why not all? The game really needs one! Each time I spawn I have no idea where I am, most times because I'm in the dark.Redeeming features: If you like L4D and got bored of it then you'll probably like this for a couple of days until the four maps get repetitive - more are coming though as free DLC (DLC or 'finishing off the game'?)Oh and the English is really terrible in places and it behaves really weirdly with a controller.TL:DR Pick it up for less than £5, no more.EDIT: Proof on issue 3 - http://i.imgur.com/6Td7w0E.png

content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Here we are for Contagion ! A game developed since 2005 if I remember, ok so I will be fast because the game is very very very short. There is five missions, the principal mission is in cooperation (you need to escape to a prison), one mission is called extraction (you need to protect a survivor until he escaped), and the three other are make for kill other players and you can be bored after 2 hours of gameplay (it's my case by the way)The good things are: there is not a lot of glitches (I found some but I'm a pro for this lol), and the gameplay is optimised (I have a very bad computer and I can play without any freeze or something like this) The bad things are: the game can be annoying when you tried all the missions, the new map is weird (there is some places than you can be sure you can enter but no) and the coop mission is glitched sometime.My final verdict is a 7/10 because except the game life, the game is very fun and the "Hunted" (PvP) mod are cool to play.

												While I do reccomend this game in steam I do say it comes with the caveat  that only fairly expierenced gamers should get this one. This game is a okay game for some one to mess around with but is really not a good game for begginners due to it's issues.   It  needs serious map improvements as well as user interface improvemnts. Some maps are litterally truncated and should be under  a different catagory than they were assigned. it is good that like Left 4 Dead and its sequel Left 4 Dead 2 there are different catagories of missoin types but the types are confusing and mislabled for some missions such as los muertos escape and the stone creek escape where it is basically a hold out mission with a limited map rather that a challenging map with different destinations and puzzles like in other missions of the same catagory. How ever that being said the other missions are fairly challenging and fun the only real problem with them is the extreemly overwhelming haord attacks at the end of the missions. The game has been updated recently with new content which I have not yet played and do not yet know about but will play and then update this review so give it a look see any way if you want. Now having played the new content I do like the game better though the weapons and items inventory still sucks, being only able to hold four items at once is not really conducive to good game play. It would be better if you could hold more items although the limit to the amount of weapons does make game play more challengeing and interesting.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												I enjoyed this game a lot. It stood out as a fun, realistic, zombie game. But after a while, I got bored of the content that it had and left it for a while.Then I got a few friends and played it a few years later. This game is an amazing coop experience. Multiple times, after failing or winning an escape map or extraction, me and my friends will just sit there and just talk about parts where it looked like it was ripped straight from some zombie movie. The best thing is, they weren't really scripted to be just like that. The power wasn't scripted to turn on so we were able to run away right when the horde got close to us, it just happened. This game, the atmosphere, the teamwork, the constant struggle of ammunition and weapons, it feels like a zombie movie. Long story short, I really enjoy it, especially with friends. The only downsides I have is that the voice acting can ruin some people's immersion and atmosphere. It's not bad, I love it, but some people may not think so. Especially when you can constantly scream, "LETS WAIT AND BARRICADE HERE" when you're literally in the middle of the street. And, it does have it's fair share of bugs. Not too bad, but... ye

content:
Posted: November 11, 2013
												Really fun and entertaining zombie game. Unlike many others the zombies actually "feel" real. They shamble through the streets, heads bobbing around like maniacs as they slowly pace toward you, making those headshots more difficult than one would imagine. Completely ignoring bullets as they rip through their arms and legs, as it has no effect other than waying their arm slightly. If you want the kill, you're going to have to get that perfect headshot.They stupidly wander aimlessly, only beginning the chase once you've alerted them by sprinting through the streets or firing like a maniac. Smashing through doors and barricades with their bleeding arms, lacking the mental capacity to use door knobs. The zombies definitely have a life-like, or rather, un-life-like quality that makes them very appealing.But the zombies aren't the only threat. Aside from the co-op "Extraction" and "Escape" game modes, "Hunted" brings one of the most exciting and dynamic pvp experiences. Because unlike other games, being shot down doesn't just end your life, it brings on a new one. The hunt continues as you stalk the humans from the shadows as a newly made zombie. As a human you scavenge for weapons and supplies on the spot, compulsively checking your phone for nearby survivors, or player zombies. You can run guns ablaze through the streets, hoping to run into il-prepared survivors, or barricade a house of your own and take your last stand. Shooting through windows at other survivors or battling an onslaught of zombies as they swarm their way up the stairs or bashing down the door to the room you've taken shelter in.Overall it's a great game and I strongly recommen it. However, a Mic is basically a must. While not so much if you fly solo on Hunted, but the co-op modes desperately require coordination and team work, as a well-crrafted co-op game should. Definitely better with friends. Teaming up with them as securing a house together as you battle off the undead is some of the most fun I've had in a multiplayer game.The only downside to this game is the lack of content. Which can be expected from an early-access game. There's only 3 maps as of yet, 1 of which is used in 2 of the game modes. But with steam workshop support in the works, user maps and mods, that will soon be a thing of the past. But it doesn't require that. The devs are still very much working on the game and supplying new content.Well worth the price. I'm already over 30hours of gametime and it has yet to lose it's luster. At $15, this game is a steal.8/10

content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												Bought this on a sale with my partner a while ago and we love it. We have been looking for co-op zombie orientated games  and for us this game is brilliant. The map selection is small but what makes it fresh is that locations change, while some doors will be open one time the next they will be blocked up and you'll have to find alternate paths or alternate items to progress. It would be nice for more maps to be added in the future though.Gameplay is great, I feel it's as realistic as it can be in a zombie apocalypse in which if a crowd finds you, you will be overwhelmed which means you need to form tactics with a partner or solo, the way that the zombies only really die by headshots is also brilliant while difficult when first getting into the game but it becomes easier in time. The objectives are plenty and each gamemode has different aims which is great when you get bored with one.The only issues I can really come up with are zombies pathing is sometimes strange but it doesn't affect the game much, could use some more maps. Also when infection is on and you'll sometimes change for no reason even if you haven't been hit, but it's not extremely common though when at the end of a game waiting to escape it's a damn pain in the♥♥♥♥♥Love this game I'll give it 9/10. had a very good time with it. Though I would reccomend it with a friend rather than solo as it is fun.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												A middling first person shooter of infected genre. Decent graphics and scenes, tight mechanics, big maps, classic selection of guns and tools. Light and sound effects and its consecuences are very fine finished too. Includes an option of infection risk and play as a zombie. But its quite limited for single player: hand combat is insecure, slow and without options to block or evade attacks, the stealth system is poor, guns are little useful at closer ranges and the most powerful ones attract so many foes that is better to use them only at final struggles or known places; to survive depends on random placing of medkits. Missing classic weapons of genre like flametrower, molotov cocktail, katana and chainsaw. Player can not climb fences and walls like the infected, that can to sprint and pursue players without pause, at long distances. Foes are a bit exaggerated: are infected, but they can running a lot and make strong damages with bare hands, only a headshot can kill them, like conventional zombies; some wear really heavy armours. The difficultly is bad leveled: normal is piece of cake but hard is nearby to the impossible: get cornered by two or three enemies at close range always is lethal. Could be better with more scenarios for "escape" mode. Causes glitches on Windows 10 and Workshop community has few mods. Very often offered with high discounts, no buy without.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												I highly recommend this game. Don't expect your standard COD zombies experience, or even anything exactly like Left 4 Dead. This game is all about zombie survival horror. There is a fair amount of content with several gamemodes, and while the playere base isn't huge, you can almost always find a game in progress to join if your friends aren't online to play with you. Also, there is a fair bit of custom mods out there to improve your experience, ranging from slight visual tweaks to completely new, often vast and terrifying, levels. I got this game in a Humble Bundle 4 pack, and my friends and I have put about 85 hours or so into this game in the last three weeks. Thoroughly enjoyable.

content:
Posted: May 14, 2014
												Have only played a bit but am ready to review it since I have experienced almost every gamemode some with friends some without friends. So let's start off with the core game itself it feels like Zombie Panic and any sexy new source engine game had sex. They have added the core gamemodes from ZPS in a recent update the maps are a bit lacking for each gamemode except for Hunt. Hunt is a great gamemode it is a mix of PvP/Survival if you have a buddy you can team up and take other players out but in the end only one survives. Next we have Extraction which is a gamemode where you have to extract AI survivors you and your group of players move to a point on the map that survivors are held in and you fight off zombies for a certain time then move the survivors to a certain point and they throw ammon and weapons down before they jump the fence to leave the map. Basically if your a fan of Zombie Panic Source or a fan of Zombie games this is for you I am enjoying it the only thing is the lack of maps so far but the community will soon fix that.
